column2: ['I dont like this school as much as i thought i would. this school has very poor security and very bad alumn. they really dont have teachers doing the right thing . the food is also terrible , i dont eat at all during the day because its bad. but they do have alot of sports club but i dontmlike sports.', "It's an average school. It has many sports and clubs to enjoy after school. Teachers can either be a hit or miss; there are some who don't take their jobs seriously and some who do.", 'This school is what you make of it. In addition to the lack of clubs and activities for those who avoid sports, this might not be the school for kids who rather be challenged.', "LICHS is a wonderful school. Offers many programs and opportunities for us. Academically speaking the school is very decent and if you ever need help it's quite easy to find it in the school. There's also alot of AP courses. The Culinary arts program was very They have care center inside for babies they take care of your babies while u study. They have sport classes wrestling,Swimming,Hockey & more they got guitar,violin,piano,hand classes. fun as well. It's a good school for those who take advantage of it and if you don't start and trouble in school everyone will leave you alone.", 'What I like about Long Island City High School is its diversity and the different programs it offers, students can choose from different study programs such as culinary arts, robotics, hospitality and tourism. There is also diversity in the school community, students are introduced to people from different cultures which is helpful because they get to know certain facts from other countries.', 'LIC has improved tremendously in terms of the opportunities they offer for students, because students are now able to find jobs at the school. LIC offers a lot of AP courses, clubs, sports teams, and even internships, so it has definitely come a long way. Yes, there are students who do not care about school and do not take their education seriously, but there are also students who make the most of what LIC offers.', 'As a incoming senior, Long Island City has welcomed every student with a warm touch. I’m glad I went to lic.', "It's a really big high school that offers over 32 sports, it has two gyms, has a pool and a big field. This school is best known for culinary arts which is a academy that prepares you for the future to be chef or work in business management. This school offers you many AP class which can help you save for college .", 'The teachers are very supportive of the students and so as the guidance counselors. The school also have good support programs for students with both mental and physical disabilities, as well as an indoor clinic for a nurse office, and most importantly any school staff is willing to help a student who needs help. As someone diagnosed with Autism Spectrum Disorder, the therapists at the school are very helpful in helping me learn to deal with some troubles I get.', 'As a senior and graduate from long island city high school there are many things that make this school special. There is a variety of extracurricular activities and more than 20 sport teams. The teachers are helpful, kind, caring, and understanding. The college office is the best place to go when you need help with anything whether or not your a senior. There are many great program/ opportunities available such as taking college now courses while in high school, AVID that is a college readiness program, LIFE center, etc.', 'Long island city has many opportunities but the kind of people that go there make the school a hard place to stay focused and get college ready.', 'The school was in a bad area. The teachers didn’t really care about the students or even helping them learn. They didn’t treat us right and it was just an overall bad experience.', "I like the large number of programs that they offer. I'm in the culinary arts academy, being in this program has shown me a lot of different options I have in the culinary field.  Besides their culinary program, they offer a lot of other clubs, programs, etc.", 'This school as far as I’ve known hasn’t been very fun until the senior year, which they give you elective classes like woodshop or internship, etc.', 'This school provides many opportunities for students. Teachers always allow makeup work and are very flexible. This school offers many advanced placement courses. It has over 30 sports teams. There is a pool for the swim team and even a chance to take swimming as a class. This school has multiple academies that prepare u for a certain career feild. There is a kitchen for the culinary arts academy. There are also a huge variety of gym classes. Furthermore there are many college now courses that students can take in school or in LaGuardia community college. Also, students are offered payed internships in school for helping teachers. Culinary and hospitality students are offered payed internships in real restaurants and outside businesses to experience what its like to actually work in a particular feild. There are many workshops offered to parents as well.', 'Long Island City High School has a variety of programs such as Culinary Arts and Hospitality that can interest students in finding out what they like. One thing I would like to see change is making the school look cleaner.', 'The school has improved more for the better. Has more scholastic and academic programs. Easy commute from any borough.', 'My experience at Long Island City Highschool was a pretty average one. I loved that they had a culinary program in it. And the difference resources.', "Long Island City High School allowed me to open up and become a leader in many areas that I am strong in. I was able to be a student leader in our Student Government, in our Marching Band Program, and in our Robotics team. Overall, if it weren't for the experiences I received in this school, I would not be the person I am today. It's what you make out of it that makes you a good student.", 'What I like about this school is that there if always someone you can go to if you need help , guidance counselor , therapy , college office . Everyone is a helping hand , the school is also very diverse and it has over 20 sport teams which is really cool .']

column6: ['I like how the teachers create the classrooms a place where a student feels comfortable and ready to learn.', 'I like all the different sports and clubs available for students at L.I.C. I also really enjoy the Culinary and Hospitality  program at L.I.C. I would like to see the bathrooms and locker rooms renovated. The bathroom stalls are always broken and so are the soap dispensers.', 'It was allright, there alot of students here and the equipment in the school is very old but the teachers are good.', 'I believe this is a good school . It has a bad reputation but this is no where near the truth . We have  so much to offer including a wide variety of AP classes and 33 sports teams ! I absolutely love my school despite my apprehensions when first beginning there in 2016 . Would highly recommend checking it out', "Rigorous academics teachers challenge you with lessons every day . diverse culture , they attempt on a daily basis to get all family's involved within the school . Always have help available when needed. In school there is always security guards checking staircases hallways and putting a stop to any suspicious behavior/activity multiple clubs and sports available to those who wish to participate", "This school has so much potential because of all the programs they offer. But the students really aren't helping improve the school. And the teachers could be very lenient by offering Saturday school andextra credit assignments.", 'what i like about long island city high school is how much they involve the parents in the school and how diverse it is.', 'It is a nice high school for the high school student. They provided good change to students study high school knowledge.', "The top thing that I most enjoyed being at LIC is the diversity. I have never met so many people from so many ethnic, religion, race backgrounds. Most students get along with one another regardless of how they look like. Yet the school does need to work on some things. For instance, budgeting is a big issue like any high school. It's easily noticed on how the school replaces a perfectly good vending machine for another one while the bathroom stalls don't work and close right. Or on how more money is spent on the football even if they don't win games while other athletes in other teams have to buy their own equipment to make ends meet. Regardless my time at my school is well spent and I have enjoyed my time but some things do need to change.", 'The school was decent, you have to know the right people for it to be enjoyable. However, there are cliques and it may be hard to integrate yourself at first. The location is ideal, but there is a lot of violence at this school. Fights break out and drugs are sold or taken in this school. Lots of security guards too. Easy to cut classes and such. The teachers either care a lot or not at all.', 'Long island city high school is open for anyone with any grades and gives everyone an opportunity to achieve something. This school offers many programs clubs and classes that can help you stay on track. They also offer college courses that help you receive college credit which helps you save money and time in college. It is a very diverse school and it is very easy for anyone to maintain their grades with the system they use. Most of the teachers genuinely care about the students and care about helping them keep their grades up. Most teachers are also really amazing at doing their job and keeping the students educated. Few know how to control their students and actually make them learn something which needs to be carefully overlooked. Overall, this school offers many opportunities that no other school offers and you will find yourself making unforgettable memories in this school.', "I really enjoy the adversity found in long island city but the classes could be a little more challenging and the school as a whole doesn't function very smoothly.", 'Long Island City is a high school filled with opportunities and hands on help. Teachers and staff always helping out students with whatever a student might need with no hesitation. Not only are the staff great but there is also an amazing culinary program where students learn different recipes every week. Students who want to pursue Culinary as their career have the chance of joining the CCAP competition where students from other schools practice to compete for scholarships helping them out in college. Extra curricular activities/clubs are also a big job in L.I.C. Having over 30 sports teams in the school help students connect with one another,go further with the sport in college ,even making it their lifestyle. Clubs are also a big thing. Yearbook, Leadership,Dance,College readiness etc. Long Island City High School is a school filled with chances and teachers who will never say no to a student and make sure the student is ready for the next step in their life.', 'This school has a negative reputation but as an attending sophomore I can confidently say that if you take advantage of all the amazing opportunities L.I.C offers, it will be an unforgettable experience as long as you make the most of it. The school has a diversity and culture not very common in nyc high schools and if you join clubs and some of the over 32 sports we offer, you will find yourself actively engaged in the school community surrounded by friends and teachers that by the end of senior year you will consider family.', 'do not go to this school if your english is not perfect. I transferred other school. COUNSELARS are unproffesionals. I had 2 or 3 gaps btw class. I wasted three hrs at school....', 'A VERY smooth 4 years of education. Friendly environment with students and staff. A lot of extra culicilar activities.', "Really good high school many might argue it isn't but they provide students with many opportunities that other high schools don't such as free SAT prep, Culinary Arts and Hospitality Program where students can cook and also learn how to run either a restaurant or hotel as well. Many clubs to join as well and the teachers are really nice, some might be strict but just want students to do good and accomplish graduation on time. I'm glad I go to this school and hopefully others have a good time as well.", 'Great academic atmosphere with many amazing teachers who want to see their kids succeed. The student body is very diverse and everyone gets along as school pride is very high in the school.', "my 4 years of high school in long island city high school was one of the best experiences i had , it had taught me a lot of important things , Long island city high school was my second home , the time i had in that school was beyond amazing and thrilling , and not only that but i made some great connections with teachers and facilities , they were caring and loving and always made sure to give you enough help to pass the class , and now i moved out from New York and the only great experiences that i recall are all in long island city high school ,  but let not lie we all have our ups and downs but long island island always found away to make these down times better and funner , long island city high school was my second home , it didn't just teach me math English and science but it thought me how to deal with the real world out there and have a lot of great connections .", "the school is good has good teachers and programs and good athletic teamsit's location is good and serve free food to the student and the school have a great college office"]

column1: Liberty High School Academy for Newcomers
column2: ["I remember the first time I stepped in Liberty High School; I knew little English and did not know how to proficiently speak the language. With the help of teachers and staff, I soon felt at home They were full of patience and love. Also, Liberty High School's brightest attribute is its diversity. Students around the globe gather in one single place, for one big objective, sharpen their English Skills. Moreover, diversity in Liberty High School also brings distinct perspectives around the globe in one place. Liberty High School also offers various ways in which students from distinct origins will be able to interact without difficulties. How? They do so by tackling their common interests and likes. It may be through sports- soccer, volleyball, basketball, baseball- through parties or through clubs. Overall, Liberty High School is the perfect fit for a student, who seeks to start from scratch and emerge into someone who mastered the tools needed to succeed in this fast-growing country.", 'I really like how the system works, everyone is so helpful and I have a lot of fun there. I would like to see different kinds of food because there is a lot of students who don’t eat the food from school.', 'Liberty High School is an international school for newcomers only. I fall in love with Liberty since the first day, because I was new, I did not knew anything; English included. I was starting over and Liberty created the perfect environment for me, I had found myself in the same page as many others newcomers, we were all struggling with the language but more important, we created group to help each other. Liberty had provided me with ESL classes to mastered the language. Now that I can defend myself (speak the language) is all thanks to my lovely high school.', 'I love my high school because there is all help, teachers are the best and they help us too much. I’m very happy to be in this High school. Also, this is my last year and I will miss my school because this is the best school that New York City have.', "My school is a good school as a foreign school, because all of the students didn't speak English when they first came, but we have great teacher who take they time to help us to learning the knew language. My favorite experiences is after school drama class is really fun and you really get chances to learn from each others. One think I could say make my school unique is that everyone always ready to help each other and it is a peace full place. If, I have to go again to High School I wouldn't choose that school, because we don't have that much fun the principal believe that we should only study, and not having fun.", "My school does not have any sports facilities, However, when our soccer and basket ball team needs to practice we usually use one of the soccer  field or basket ball court in he city. Many students are involve in athletics at the school. Even though we don't have the best team in the city, other students in our school play a Major part to the team , because they  come to our game and support us.", "Some teachers in my school do care about the students ability to understand certain topics, because they want what is best for us. When students don't get the objective of a lesson, the teachers use different techniques, because we are all different and learned a different way. Teachers also stay after school to help students in need.", 'robotics and drama are the most popular after-school activities in this school. To be in the robotics, students need to be excellent in math and science and are able to work under pressure. Drama needs confident students and are able memorize scripts.']

['Eximius was a school I wont forget, Best four years ever and I wish I could do back and re do it, I met my husband in this school so it holds a special place in my heart.', 'With my now 4 years worth of experience at ECPA, I can say the faculty and staff helped me tremendously when it came to college readiness.', "I liked that at Eximius they pushed you to be college ready and achieve more then just a passing grade. At Eximius the teachers try to help you as much as possible no matter where you're at and actually care about you passing and understanding the material.", 'I love how there is the staff and teachers being very supportive of you and being on top of you making sure that you are on the right path and feel you from your rights and wrongs. To add on, students are offered various of opportunities, such as after school clubs, summer programs, and to be part of a summmer bridge program to help incoming freshmen.', 'My experience at Eximius College Preparatory Academy has been one to remember. The friends i’ve made both with students and teachers is great and i’ve learned a lot from them as well. I grew as a person and as a student.', 'Im a senior in this school. I never really liked the school because they do to much. But over all its an alright school', "Eximius college prep is a pretty good school, it's small and everyone knows everyone . The staff are friendly and the teachers care a great deal about your education. The food however could improve but other wise from that the acedims and diversity is really good.", 'I had a good experience at Eximius. The teachers are very nice and they are dedicated when it comes to working with students. The counsellors help and guide you step by step to apply for college and other college related stuff.', 'My experience in Eximius is amazing because you get to create and get into may difference clubs. I love that fact that Eximius teachers are decatied to encourage the students to keep going and they are willing to give us their all.', 'I like how my school allows you to take many AP courses so you can be college ready. They allow you to have a foretaste of what your future will look like if you want to major in a certain field. One thing my school should change is how the administration deals with certain situations. They aren’t really involved in real life issues when it is brought to their attention.', 'Great teachers and counselors. They helped me finish high school in 3 years. I learned a lot and I believe because it was a small school, I was able to focus and didnt get lost in the shuffle.', "This school is an excellent school because it's an all uniform school so there's less discrimination. They help you be collage ready and children have lots of goals.", 'I enjoy the fact that you can build a connection with the staff. Also, the guidance counselor is really helpful.', 'I had a horrible time as a student.  I was picked on by the teachers and the faculty. The principle never made me feel safe, if anything, he put me down a lot. I was not the best student in high school, but that is no reason to pick and constantly egg on a student. I was given detention all the time for the minor reasons, while the "good" students were given passes. I was classified as a bad kid and they used that against me all four years. Even when I tried to change my ways, the staff made it so difficult for me to achieve goals.', "It is a contradicting situation. At first, everything seems okay but there's is no real source of inspiration nor motivation. Like in any other school, there is favoritism, and the administration only seems to care about themselves. There is no one really in charge of the school because Dr. Daly doesn't show that he cares. The teachers are either the best teachers in the world or the worst to ever teach, if you pick randomly. This school is hard to love but also hard to hate. Asses need to be kissed in order to be privilidged which I freaking hate!!! They choose who they want to succeed. I'll give it 6/10.", "The school enables us to growth through diversity and it's a great learning experience it's not perfect but no school is as a small school it gives us a humble background and although it's size is small it provides us a college based learning experience", 'This school is amazing when it comes to preparing for college! They have provided me so far with many resources and websites to apply for scholarships, internships, and summer programs that I will be participating in this year.', 'I really enjoyed attending Eximius. The school culture was great.They really prepared me for college.I loved my teachers they were very supportive.', 'I like how they help every student to get ready for college one thing they need to change is some of the way some teachers teach they move too fast', 'My school is very safe. Security guards are always at the doors or walking around on the floor  just to make sure each and every student is safe .If a student needs to go to the nurse they  will get permission to go right away . The nurse is always available when someone needs her. Additionally bullying is that a problem at my school all the students. are treated fairly.']
column4: ['Eximius was a school I wont forget, Best four years ever and I wish I could do back and re do it, I met my husband in this school so it holds a special place in my heart.', 'With my now 4 years worth of experience at ECPA, I can say the faculty and staff helped me tremendously when it came to college readiness.', "I liked that at Eximius they pushed you to be college ready and achieve more then just a passing grade. At Eximius the teachers try to help you as much as possible no matter where you're at and actually care about you passing and understanding the material.", 'I love how there is the staff and teachers being very supportive of you and being on top of you making sure that you are on the right path and feel you from your rights and wrongs. To add on, students are offered various of opportunities, such as after school clubs, summer programs, and to be part of a summmer bridge program to help incoming freshmen.', 'My experience at Eximius College Preparatory Academy has been one to remember. The friends i’ve made both with students and teachers is great and i’ve learned a lot from them as well. I grew as a person and as a student.', 'Im a senior in this school. I never really liked the school because they do to much. But over all its an alright school', "Eximius college prep is a pretty good school, it's small and everyone knows everyone . The staff are friendly and the teachers care a great deal about your education. The food however could improve but other wise from that the acedims and diversity is really good.", 'I had a good experience at Eximius. The teachers are very nice and they are dedicated when it comes to working with students. The counsellors help and guide you step by step to apply for college and other college related stuff.', 'My experience in Eximius is amazing because you get to create and get into may difference clubs. I love that fact that Eximius teachers are decatied to encourage the students to keep going and they are willing to give us their all.', 'I like how my school allows you to take many AP courses so you can be college ready. They allow you to have a foretaste of what your future will look like if you want to major in a certain field. One thing my school should change is how the administration deals with certain situations. They aren’t really involved in real life issues when it is brought to their attention.', 'Great teachers and counselors. They helped me finish high school in 3 years. I learned a lot and I believe because it was a small school, I was able to focus and didnt get lost in the shuffle.', "This school is an excellent school because it's an all uniform school so there's less discrimination. They help you be collage ready and children have lots of goals.", 'I enjoy the fact that you can build a connection with the staff. Also, the guidance counselor is really helpful.', 'I had a horrible time as a student.  I was picked on by the teachers and the faculty. The principle never made me feel safe, if anything, he put me down a lot. I was not the best student in high school, but that is no reason to pick and constantly egg on a student. I was given detention all the time for the minor reasons, while the "good" students were given passes. I was classified as a bad kid and they used that against me all four years. Even when I tried to change my ways, the staff made it so difficult for me to achieve goals.', "It is a contradicting situation. At first, everything seems okay but there's is no real source of inspiration nor motivation. Like in any other school, there is favoritism, and the administration only seems to care about themselves. There is no one really in charge of the school because Dr. Daly doesn't show that he cares. The teachers are either the best teachers in the world or the worst to ever teach, if you pick randomly. This school is hard to love but also hard to hate. Asses need to be kissed in order to be privilidged which I freaking hate!!! They choose who they want to succeed. I'll give it 6/10.", "The school enables us to growth through diversity and it's a great learning experience it's not perfect but no school is as a small school it gives us a humble background and although it's size is small it provides us a college based learning experience", 'This school is amazing when it comes to preparing for college! They have provided me so far with many resources and websites to apply for scholarships, internships, and summer programs that I will be participating in this year.', 'I really enjoyed attending Eximius. The school culture was great.They really prepared me for college.I loved my teachers they were very supportive.', 'I like how they help every student to get ready for college one thing they need to change is some of the way some teachers teach they move too fast', 'My school is very safe. Security guards are always at the doors or walking around on the floor  just to make sure each and every student is safe .If a student needs to go to the nurse they  will get permission to go right away . The nurse is always available when someone needs her. Additionally bullying is that a problem at my school all the students. are treated fairly.']

column8: ["I'm involved in student council and we are nationally recognized and we have plenty of support form the facility.we are always being encouraged to do our best and dream big.", 'The school is pretty good but some of the kids here still do t act as if they are in high school and act like middle schoolers', "Technology is really good sometimes it don't work but they always fix it", 'Dance team won first place at six flags competition and our cheerleading won second place', 'The best one is the dance team their really good but I think the cheerleading could be a much better group', "There should be more different academics and teachers shouldn't be giving tests together with other teachers it stresses the students out", 'Not that good but not bad but I think there should be more different types of food.', 'the school aid safety always gets to fights fast to break them up but their not always accurate because some fights still occur under their eyes and some they allow others to fight', 'its barely any thing offered to you', "i hate it with all of my heart its no fun and isn't as its described in the pamphlets.", 'the teachers try to be close to us as students for if we need to speak we can talk to them but their un-trustworthy because what ever you tell them they run back and tell it to the principal or guidance counselor and gets acs or others involved.', 'this school is awful its not as it seemed on the pamphlet they dont even have any of the things that they described and quallified for.', "I don't know much about the sports. we do have a soccer, baseball (girls/boys) and basketball (girls/boys) team.", "There's a lot of college prep sources.  They help us get ready for the transition. There's tutoring for specific subjects tuesdays and wednesdays after school.", "It has changed drastically for the better. The school is unique because it's small and you're able to get acquainted with the teachers", "Dress code is highly enforced. If it's not worn properly or not fully there you will get detention or a possible suspension if it continues to happen or you're being rude and disrespectful.There's a zero tolerance for bullying. There are other students who may not be able to work as hard and diligently as others but they aren't bullied They just receive extra help which is great.", "It's not all that great. It can't be too seasoned because it's school food. They can't serve shrimp or pork because of safety reasons. We have a snack machine, it has fruit, cereal bars, whole grain ships and other healthy things in it.", "If you're a student who's involved in their school, there are many extra curricular activities to be involved in. There's a dance and cheer team. they're always working out and prepping for the next event where they hold 1st place for many of the competitions. Also there's the cheer team, they are also always working out and holding meetings as well as fundraising. Then there's a chorus club that is recent and  a keyboarding club that's trying to fall into place by this fall.", "Ever since we've received the new principle, the academics stepped up as well.before it was relatively easy to receive an A. however, the course work has become more difficult and they make sure they're building our vocabulary and essential skills so we'll be college ready.", 'Each teacher would go above and beyond to make sure his/her students is going to pass. Many times they stay late to help students with extra credit to pass or help with the classwork.each teacher that i had has been wonderful. They want to ensure that each student is learning the material and if the student is behind there are after-school programs twice a week to attend to catch up.']

column2: ['Great school, great experience. Thank you IDP for pushing me to get my credits and pass the regents. I also got lots of help preparing for my future.', 'This school offered a second chance to my son. For the first time I saw him excited to go to school and make a change.', 'This was the best high school during my experience. When ever I needed help the facility was right here to help me out. They provided me with a job until I finished school. Made sure I stayed up to date with my work and grades .', "What I like about innovation ....is the way of teaching. Teachers encourage students to use all of their full potential. I have had many times where I felt like I was going to give up on graduating. Although principal storchan helped me out and said to me that you're only as good as you see yourself. I was motivated after that and even after he said that he still checked on students to see if they was making progress. In the end I graduated class of 2016 and am on my way to college. I wouldn't have had graduated or meet so many great people if I hadn't gone to innovation diploma. I highly recommend it .", 'none had kids in the school that didnt want to do anything', 'teachers,guidance counselors,and facilities are good but bad principal', 'kids do not what to do nothing', "They had the right attitude but the students didn't/", "I liked the school but it wasn't high on their exceptions. not that I blame them.", 'Eh... we had rules but they were rarely followed.']

column1: Urban Assembly Academy of Government & Law
column2: ["The is an average school. Most of the students are immature and are not serious about education. Some teachers aren't good and don't teach well so you can learn well. Most of the teachers don't care if you do your assignments or homework and nothing they do to improve a student progress.  The grading is very unfair and don't expect to get higher grades", 'My school, Urban Assembly Academy of Government and Law, is my home away from home. As many other people would agree, the transition from middle school to high school isn’t very subtle, and in this case, this statement stands to be very true. However, the teachers were very compassionate and helpful during my times of hardships which helped to establish a connection while also creating a smooth classroom environment. Among those hardships, a few of them were due to acad struggles, but the school offered tutoring, extra credit, and several other resources so that I could achieve academic excellence, which is the bare minimum presented to all of the students by all of the faculty members. Lastly, with all of this positive influence, the students tend to mimic that same model behavior, which is the reason for the student community that we have now.', 'This school is perfect for someone who just wants to be mellowed out. It includes a lot of activities as a school like Eagle day ( playing sports in the gym). This shool offers a law and ethics class. It also has a student government club, law club, and National Honor Society. I would like for the shool to do moe team building trips. This will help boost our community.', 'At this school, I enjoy the classes that I take and the amount of work that gets done. I feel as if I really learn from the classes. What I would like to see change is the very little amount of parent involvement in the school. Parents should be encouraged to join the community.', 'the teachers teach everything that they possibly can', 'even though we share a building with 5 other schools our security is capable of handling a situation', "there is a 9th period where 9'th graders stay and complete things that need to be done. IE. Homework, projects, studying, ect..", 'being apart of the school is like being apart of family', 'Attending AGL was the best decision I made in my entire life, I am extremely glad I chose to attend this school.', "Its not the best food, its lunch food what do you expect? a four star restaurant? its lunch food if your hungry you eat if not don't. besides if your a 10-12th grader you can go out for lunch and pick what you want. AGL is located around a lot of food service like McDonald, Chinese food, Subways, Papa john, 7 eleven, burger king, Popeyes etc.", 'Workload is reasonable but most of the seniors have jobs so think differently. Teachers give students chances to get back some points lost on a test or homework and allow to make it up for some credit.', 'Staff is helpful depending on who you ask for help, most of them are willing to help students out. A policy that has gotten students upset is to see the college adviser you need a pass to see her. Everyone is overwhelmed with college apps, recommendation letters, etc. They really need her and now you have to get a pass to see her.', "I don't really notice any bullying and there is always a lot of guards are the school to keep students safe.", "PSAL Girls Bowling team - our team doesnt always win but we're a great group of girls that get along and have an amazing time together. Its free bowling almost everyday with a bunch of your friends who wouldnt join??!!!!", 'Food services in the school are average. The best option that the school gives students is to go out to eat from restaurants, such as, McDonalds, Popeyes, pizzeria, Burger King, Dunkin Donuts, and other areas. However, the school does put discipline by only allowing sophomores, juniors, and seniors to go for lunch as a privilege.', 'There are some athletics and fitness opportunities. This area is where the extracurricular activities in sports, such as, basketball, volleyball, and tennis come into play. All sports have the same amount of high school spirit.', 'Teachers are willing to prepare students for the real world especially college. Their primary focus is on academics.', "The teachers are very welcoming and focus on students' performance. The primary tool for class lessons is Smartboard. Schedules are flexible and adjusted based on students' grades.", 'After graduation, I felt completely ready for college. University at Albany is definitely a good choice for college. It is academically challenging. My first year of college has definitely been breath taking.', "There are a variety of extracurricular opportunities at this school. It has basketball, tennis, volleyball, handball, art, drama club, and cheerleading. On an academic concept, the school has law team. Law team is the primary extracurricular activity that fulfills the school purpose of teaching law. Personally, law team is a great club, because I have been on it for all my high school years and it improves students' social and academic life."]

column6: ['My high school was above average when it came to having a teacher teaching multiple classrooms due to its small population. Every year a new class concerning college now, such as, U.S. History, and Microeconomics was adjusted.  Guidance counselors were always available.  Technology definitely plays a major role in teaching the classes particularly the Smartboard.', 'Overall, my high school was average with health and safety. There was definitely security guards patrolling the school grounds. As far as health, a doctor did come in once a month for physical examinations. This I found to be useful, because I did not have to make an appointment with a doctor outside of school.', 'The school is a very diverted school.', 'Staff encourages students to attend clubs and participate in clubs.', 'A variety of sports teams.', 'There are a lot of athletic clubs.', 'Although cafeteria lunch is available, we also have the choice of outside lunch.', 'It has one of the safest school environments.\r', 'The food was just plain cafeteria food, not a very large selection and some of it tasted bland, not very enjoyable at all, just edible. Every day they would have maybe 2 or 3 choices to offer, most of the food was not very healthy and if it was, it tasted bad. There were really no dietary accommodations for the students.', "The principal tried to be as involved as he could. The guidance counselor always tried to help but only when the students came to her. The office staff was okay, there wasn't very many of them. The policies on bullying were that it would not be tolerated at all but it wasn't always enforced heavily. The dress code was strict, you had to wear the uniform. ", "Most of the teachers truly care about their students and want to help the because they know that they come from a poor background. The teaching styles were average, nothing extravagant but enough to challenge the students a little more every day. Most teachers had very good knowledge on their subject but a very select few had trouble making the students understand it. They were pretty consistent with grades, if you didn't put effort into it, a bad grade. If you did put a lot of effort into it, a good grade. ", "there weren't many kids involved in sports at this school, the only sport offered was basketball which only had a few members on the team. The team played okay but didn't have the motivation to do very well so they lost most games. Barely anyone went to the basketball games except for a select few that were close to the players. The athletic facilities weren't very good or big for that matter, the fitness programs were of poor quality. ", 'There were a few clubs at the school but not everyone joined them, usually it was only the most intelligent kids at school that did so. Depending on the club, if it was an academic club with all of the most intelligent students then most kids would be committed, but other clubs like for the performing arts some would stop attending meetings until eventually the club became nonexistent. ', "There was a lot of bullying but only towards certain kids. You were safe only if you hadn't made a problem with the ghetto kids or the gangs at the school. There were no special security measures until someone got stabbed and then they decided to put metal detectors but only for 3 days. The school nurse was somewhat helpful. We didn't really have any health programs or services. The school was pretty safe, the teachers and principal kept a pretty close eye on the students to keep them from getting into fights. ", "There wasn't a high level of student involvement. There was a lot of peer pressure to do the wrong thing but the smartest of the kids never fell for it. Of course there were those people who spoke badly of people of other sexual orientations or religions, but not everyone did it, just a select few. Also, many of those who did only spoke that way because of their ignorance towards the subject. No one at the school was really racist at all, and most of the school consisted of blacks and hispanics, with a very small population of white students and asian students but no one treated them in a racist manner. ", 'The high school did open me up to some opportunities to study at Ivy League Universities for the Summer such as Princeton and Yale University and for those who did well at the school, which included myself, they went away to colleges in upstate New York as well as other states around the country. I felt very prepared for college after graduation but that was only because I had taken full advantage of some of the resources at the school. As far as the world, i did not feel prepared. ', 'It was a good school, it should have had more ranges of study but it was still a school that would challenge, not at very highs standards but it would challenge the students somewhat. ', 'There needs to be better transportation and college prep courses ', 'There are a variety to choose from', 'they do a pretty ok job']

column1: High School for Law & Public Service
column2: ['My overall expo at this school is pretty average. There is a lot of teacher involvement with students which really helps motivate us.', 'My high school has many clubs and sports that are available for all the students. I like that my high school has diversity and everyone communicate with each other. There is a Student Government Organization and we can see the spirit of the high school through the spirit days. Also, there is a NJROTC program were cadets have a new experience and learn leadership, commitment, and communication skills.', "What I like about my high school is the people, its not like every high school, the students and the teachers they care about every student, they are like family you get too meet different kind of people with different backgrounds and struggles, and the teachers support you all the way through and they want to get you to you're dream destination.  What I would like to see different in that school is the way the school uses its money, the money should be divided equally in all activities.", "It's a pretty great school, even for an anti social guy like myself, the teachers where really engaging with their students for the most part, but the student themselves are reckless at times and make it hard for those that really want to learn because they usually make a show and becomes the highlight of the class in a bad way and that makes the teacher put most of the attention on that given person or group of people slowing the whole class room and throwing the whole class out of whack. The resources the school has is great they really work with you to get you as ready as possible for the college life but then again if you're anti social and have social anxiety like myself you'll miss lots of opportunities not only on resources but with building chemistry with friends and teachers which I heavily regret till this day.", "What I like about HIGH SCHOOL FOR LOW AND PUBLIC SERVICE.. easy! That's an excellent school you can learn y practice a lot fun things that you will never forget the teacher are awesome that's one of the part that I love of the school I'm a senior recently graduated and I will never forget the school that taught me That I have to follow my dreams and not what somebody else say.. and keep that I my mind.", 'Not a bad school overall. From my time visiting there, I think that the school allows students to be college read, and the administration is indeed quite responsible and efficient in their duties. The teachers are passionate and the school is overall great in my opinion.', 'The one and only thing I liked about this high school were the passion and devotion of some teachers. They really showed a deep sense of passion when teaching their subjects and they wanted to see all of us succeed. Some teachers pushed us until the very end and their main goal was to guarantee getting our high school diploma.', 'My high school has a lot of school spirit, as a community we all work well together.Especially when it comes to shows or raising money for sports teams. One thing I would change about my school is better school lunch and keeping the bathrooms clean.', 'I honestly  hope to see new materials for students and their learning, such as desk, computers, books.', "Highschool for law & public service has been a interesting experience I wouldn't take back. The only slight problem is that sometimes the school dosent give you much hope.", 'Many students of different cultures.', 'Although there are not many , the extracurricular that they do have is pretty good .', "The students weren't the best but the teachers were.", 'Teachers try their best to teach the kids.', 'there are police and security trough out the school. Also there are cameras in the halls and a nurse office', 'It was a very nice experience because when i started school I had less than a month in the US and did not know nothing more than hi in English. The teachers and students where very supportive and help me feel comfortable. I was able to graduate and enter college with no problems with the language after only attending school for 2 years and a half.', 'The teachers are very help full and care for the students. Also most of them are very nice and friendly.', "It's ok not very diverse though", "The teachers are nice and helpful but sometimes there grading doesn't make sense.", 'They take the safety of the students and staff very seriously.']

I like that my high school has diversity and everyone communicate with each other. There is a Student Government Organization and we can see the spirit of the high school through the spirit days. Also, there is a NJROTC program were cadets have a new experience and learn leadership, commitment, and communication skills.', "What I like about my high school is the people, its not like every high school, the students and the teachers they care about every student, they are like family you get too meet different kind of people with different backgrounds and struggles, and the teachers support you all the way through and they want to get you to you're dream destination.  What I would like to see different in that school is the way the school uses its money, the money should be divided equally in all activities.", "It's a pretty great school, even for an anti social guy like myself, the teachers where really engaging with their students for the most part, but the student themselves are reckless at times and make it hard for those that really want to learn because they usually make a show and becomes the highlight of the class in a bad way and that makes the teacher put most of the attention on that given person or group of people slowing the whole class room and throwing the whole class out of whack. The resources the school has is great they really work with you to get you as ready as possible for the college life but then again if you're anti social and have social anxiety like myself you'll miss lots of opportunities not only on resources but with building chemistry with friends and teachers which I heavily regret till this day.", "What I like about HIGH SCHOOL FOR LOW AND PUBLIC SERVICE.. easy! That's an excellent school you can learn y practice a lot fun things that you will never forget the teacher are awesome that's one of the part that I love of the school I'm a senior recently graduated and I will never forget the school that taught me That I have to follow my dreams and not what somebody else say.. and keep that I my mind.", 'Not a bad school overall. From my time visiting there, I think that the school allows students to be college read, and the administration is indeed quite responsible and efficient in their duties. The teachers are passionate and the school is overall great in my opinion.', 'The one and only thing I liked about this high school were the passion and devotion of some teachers. They really showed a deep sense of passion when teaching their subjects and they wanted to see all of us succeed. Some teachers pushed us until the very end and their main goal was to guarantee getting our high school diploma.', 'My high school has a lot of school spirit, as a community we all work well together.Especially when it comes to shows or raising money for sports teams. One thing I would change about my school is better school lunch and keeping the bathrooms clean.', 'I honestly  hope to see new materials for students and their learning, such as desk, computers, books.', "Highschool for law & public service has been a interesting experience I wouldn't take back. The only slight problem is that sometimes the school dosent give you much hope.", 'Many students of different cultures.', 'Although there are not many , the extracurricular that they do have is pretty good .', "The students weren't the best but the teachers were.", 'Teachers try their best to teach the kids.', 'there are police and security trough out the school. Also there are cameras in the halls and a nurse office', 'It was a very nice experience because when i started school I had less than a month in the US and did not know nothing more than hi in English. The teachers and students where very supportive and help me feel comfortable. I was able to graduate and enter college with no problems with the language after only attending school for 2 years and a half.', 'The teachers are very help full and care for the students. Also most of them are very nice and friendly.', "It's ok not very diverse though", "The teachers are nice and helpful but sometimes there grading doesn't make sense.", 'They take the safety of the students and staff very seriously.']
column6: ['The food is average school lunch but there are vending machines in the cafeteria also most students just bring food with them and heat it up in one of the microwaves around school', 'The teachers are really dedicated to the students they are kinda more than teacher some teachers call kids at the school their children like Ms.Serelis who is by far one of the best teachers at the school she is my 2nd mother .', "The schools student government and tutoring are usually the reasons why students tend to stay after school most of the time other after school activities include Mock Trial which I participated in and I would say is the best after  school program to begin you go to a law firm on 54th and 3rd I believe called debevoise&plimpton llc you work with a group of talented professional lawyer they provide gourmet dinner including salad and fruit trays as we'll numerous juices and water selections and you are driven home by a private car service no matter where you live and to top it off you compete in the mock trial competition against many other schools one other after school activity is national honor society which only students with a 80 average or above can be apart of.", 'The school has no uniform but  students are expected to dress in a respectful manner but still casual meaning no sagging your pants no shorts skirts sandals or booty shirts also wearing hats in the building students who don\'t follow the dress code rules are sent home .The principal Mr.Politis is very good he is loving and caring and is a father figure to some students He even know every students name in fact on my first day of ninth grade he knew who I was before I knew him someone said "Mr.Frazier are you lost" "I said yeah and who are you" he goes by last name by the way also his secretary Ms.Cynthia is the wisest woman you will ever meet she\'s the best . The guidance counselors Ms.Bloch and Ms.Fleischmann are  very good as we\'ll there is a zero tolerance for bullying of any kind including cyber bullying the only one thing that is controversial is the metal detectors and scanners attendance rates are average.', 'I feel the school prepares you for college the curriculum is constantly being updated and the school offers 9 AP courses which may seem small but for the size of the school that is okay also I believe my school prepared me for college not the real world but I feel that college does that', "The school is well known for its baseball team the George Washington trojan's .the schools football team is pretty good as well and the basketball team is average one cool thing is that we have a swim team with an Olympic size swimming pool", "On a scale of 1-10 my old high-school is probably a 7.5 as far as safety goes there a metal detectors to ensure that students don't bring in any weapons . The deans do there best to try to resolve conflicts and to get students to avoid fighting . Mr.Politis  the principal has a zero tolerance for fighting and when there is a fight he suspends both students also when there is a fight which is very rare the security guards immediately break it up the nurse is good because in the school it is a New York Presbyterian clinic the library is a good resource when doing papers. Overall the school is an okay school with great teachers and counselor and the principal really cares about each student he also knows every students name and schedule .", "Great teams with great coaches and it's the bet way to make friends", 'Theres some resources but it could be better if they where more.', 'I can not say is the best school in the worl but I rely enjoy my experiance as a high school student. Made a lot of fun memories and some realy nice friends. And I was able to learn english in the 2 and a half years I spend studying there.  At the first months of when I was a new student a lot of teaches and students help me aout a lot. As i said this school is not the best in the world but in my opinion is good enough because is a place you can call my second home and I think why things are like this is not only because of the facilities but because is a nice place to be. Thanks to all the staf, and students that learn to be friends to everybody in the school.', "It wasen't so bad, some times good and others not so good.", 'There is a lot of police presecens in the building and the surroundings. The nurse office is well equip, and there was almost no fights during the time i was in school and most were in other floors.', 'They rely care about what students wear. and they can even be punish for braking the dress code. Shuc as preventing students participate in activities', 'I never participated my self but my friend like them.', 'There is a lot of oportunities to participate in the teams and to play in the gym period. It was very fun.', 'After I graduate from high school is not the best, but not so bad. I didn’t have any problems getting adapt to my College life. And what I have learned in my classes back in high school has helped me a little bit in college.', "I love my school, all the teachers there are super supportive and they care deeply about each and every student. They make sure to keep everyone on track. I've met alot of great people throughout my 3 years there. ", 'The academics include, regular AP classes & honor roll students. Theres not many extracurricular activities, only law classes. ', 'There arent many food options. Sometimes the food is undercooked or overcooked. Some of the food is unhealthy & not everyone eats the same thing. ', 'They serve pizza mostly everyday- which is tiring. Most kids have to pay 1.50 and up.. But they do have snacks such as chips,candy, granola bars and cold water ']

column1: Middlesex County Vocational School - East Brunswick Campus School of Career Development
column2: ["My experience is decent. I'd like to see an honors program added, instead of limiting only to AP classes. A lot of students as well as myself have the capability to take on honors courses, and our education is limited by low classes. The arts program is phenomenal however, offering very intensive and strong focuses on performing , digital, and visual arts.", 'I like the school very much, I have been attending the school for all 4 years. Only thing I wish they have is better school lunch options and more clubs ']

column1: Urban Assembly School of Design & Construction
column2: ["I love the staff members. There was this one time i didn't feel good and a few of them noticed and they try to make me feel better. However something they need to change will be  clubs, activities, and sports. There isn't a lot of options when it comes to activities.", 'I enjoy the design class in my school. Design studio class allows me to challenge myself in the making of projects. All throughout this year I have been working on a high school model. The challenge was to incorporate a high line next to the high school model. I had to make floor plans of each floor while using a scale. I also used sketch up and finally build my high school and high line. I build the model using fake trees, wood, and foam core. It was a interesting project and made me use my creativity.', 'There is various amount of help from staff and students throughout the entire school. The schools tries to maintain the career base of every student. Staff and faculties always greet and keep everyone on task. Students are engaged to various clubs, activities and sports in the school. The school has connection with companies and STEM related programs.', 'I would like to see more motivational teachers and help from them more than the negativity and harsh acts they put on the students not knowing what the students might be going through personally.', 'The school is a great place for students to transition towards college and life after school. Aside from that the four years there were great from the classes to the other students you meet and the relationships you grow with and with the teachers and the rest of administration.', 'I selected this school because I wanted to specialize in architecture but I realized how much the students around me took this place as a joke. I was motivated my first 2 years here and it was all downhill from there. I had a good bond with a few teachers but this place often lacks the staff to really have this place in order. Winded up regretting going here and giving up on architecture altogether. This place will not give you the high school experience you want. Nothing but bad vibes here.', "My experience in Urban Assembly has been a pretty average experience like the normal highschool scene. There can be more academics within the systematic school cycle for example neuroscience or music. It's highly important that the faculty listens to the students about safety, the food, and the academics because without these items creating a stable environment then the school will eventually become chaotic in such a manner.", "Urban Assembly School of Design and Construction is an amazing school. I have learned many things from teacher and students from all different boroughs. The teacher are there to make sure that students are getting ready from college, so when they enter it's not challenging. My experiences so far are great, and I am proud to be part of the SDC community.", 'My overall experience at UASDC was very nurturing towards becoming an independent college student. The fact that it was high school with a small close knitted community located in the heart of manhattan made it even better due to all the outside amenities around. It also made it possible for students to create a bond with the faculty and staff.  Also the opportunities created for networking in the architecture, art and design field were spot on and helped to gain experience before pursuing a major in college. For someone who is undecided it is even better because it is a community with diverse opportunities to use your talents.', 'The school is small and everyone feels like family.', 'They all try their best to make themselves available and give students every opportunity to bring up their grades. Also it is very easy to contact them through our student emails on the weekends if we ever have any questions or need help.', 'I never see any parental involvement aside from bake sales, but other than that I never any involved with the school events.', 'Most teachers aside from a few are very fun & caring.', "I initially wanted to transfer, but the people I've met changed my mind so I endured the 3 years and am now on my final year.", 'A lot of variety of foods, however, this is only for some days. Sometimes, the same things are given out everyday and it gets tiring.', "Dress code is enforced highly. Phones aren't allowed either; metal detectors are used every morning for student entrances.", 'Plenty of teams but not many people go watch the away games. Sometimes a few stay for home games but students have things to do after school.', 'The school may not be the best, but some of the ambitious teachers here, if not recognized by top schools, would go to waste in my opinion.', 'Chess club, basketball team, weight training, baseball team, football team', "It's good, and it helps the students gain a better understanding. However, I do think a broader range should be offered to us. Whenever we give an idea about a new course, a petition and then a vote is put up. Instead of taking action, the course is usually made 2-3 years after the class that requested it left."]

Instead of taking action, the course is usually made 2-3 years after the class that requested it left."]
column6: ['They could do much better, and it makes me sad to review them this way. There are a few wonderful teachers, including a few staff members that have recently retired. Still, there could definitely be improvements.', "We have a variety of clubs, but they aren't very interesting. The only times people are really drawn to stay for after school programs or events are if the teachers force us to; mandatory events are NOT a way to get students involved.", "I've loved going to the weight room, and going into the gym to exercise. Though, I wish there were more sports for girls. Most of the sports are wonderful, but I feel like they're very close minded. For girls, all they have is Volleyball and Bowling. We can do better than that! I've questioned why we don't have our own football or basketball team, and they said that that was only for the boys. I asked why, and the people I asked just gave me this look and laughed. Ugh. Rude.", "Surprisingly, it's the teachers that are considered to be the least successful that the absolute best at their jobs. For example, my art teacher, performing art teachers, dance teacher, and math teacher do all they can to help their students. However, the people who have been working at the school longer and/or have gained benefits (higher positions, for example) act as if they don't really want to teach. They offer help, but only to their favorite students: the ones they've gathered assumptions about, the one they pity, or the ones they see the most. The ones who have problems at home are often disregarded, and blamed for missing classes. The only reason they're missing class, however, is because of familial problems, personal situations dealing with their mental and/or physical health, or deaths. Still, some of the teachers don't seem to care. I'm thankful for the ones who put their heart into their work, though.", 'No real issue with academics', 'Not a big diversity thing going on', 'The facilities could be better', 'Not many options. Not that great', 'There are only six sports. The equipment is ok. The spirit is kinda low.', 'This school offers a variety of class aside from the general class an AP/Honors classes. Included is a special design/engineering course for those who want to pursue a career in designing/architects. The honors classes are no joke, they will drill you day and night. ', "I would say that the food is average, with well it being cafeteria food. There isn't anything wrong with the food, but students do have the option to go eat outside. Those who can normally take that opportunity to go buy their own lunch.", "The school needs more improvement with college prep resources. While there are some available, it is the students who more often than not have to go looking for the resources themselves. The administration though will help in every way they can, it's just that the resources themselves aren't readily available.", "The school has had problems in the past with cliques and groups, and some students would go out of their way to avoid others. Such is not the case anymore. The school and it's students have become more tolerable to other groups, and now they almost overlap.", 'The school has a standard policy, which is to wear reasonable dress clothes. the dress-code was set-up as if the school administration were preparing you for life in a work environment. Bullying of any sort was not tolerated, and met with swift punishment.', "I made so many memories at my high school. Because it's a small school, everyone gets to know each other pretty well. Eventually, everyone becomes a huge family. The teachers there are willing to put in the effort for students who need assistance outside the classroom. Some of the students however don't place as much enthusiasm, and would probably be the reason why I would consider about going back again.", 'After graduating from this high school, I felt that I was  prepared for college life, but at the same time felt that they could have pushed the students a little more.. It provides students with many option for those who wish to become architects and artists. The guidance counselor helps with every step in the college process.', 'You really feel like you outside the building.', "The food is edible but doesn't leave you as delighted as a homemade  dish would. The variety is decent, allowing both junk and healthy-loving individuals to find a meal that would suit their tastes. For instance, whole wheat sandwiches can save you from hunger while mozzarella sticks can be very tempting. Fruits are available at any time of the year; it's great to discover ripe apples, oranges, pears and peaches in January when you're feeling a bit fruit-deprived. Fruits are surely the best way to culminate the modest school feast.", 'School spirit is always excellent. Basketball, soccer, football and volleyball games always attract a huge, enthusiastic crowd. The facilities are clean- the gym floor sparkling and the locker rooms permitting to walk in socks while getting your apparel ready. Battling the heat during the months of May and June is difficult since air conditioners are non-existent.', 'You will feel very welcomed at this school. Teachers are mentors, approachable for help in academics as well as advice in daily life. Because students respect and admire teachers, they take example from them. Everyone cares for and looks out for each other. If you return after being absent for a week due to an illness you will be greeted very warmly and asked about health incessantly! There are only about four hundred students, yet the noise from cheering and applause they make during school concerts, supporting one another, is heartwarming.']

The facilities are clean- the gym floor sparkling and the locker rooms permitting to walk in socks while getting your apparel ready. Battling the heat during the months of May and June is difficult since air conditioners are non-existent.', 'You will feel very welcomed at this school. Teachers are mentors, approachable for help in academics as well as advice in daily life. Because students respect and admire teachers, they take example from them. Everyone cares for and looks out for each other. If you return after being absent for a week due to an illness you will be greeted very warmly and asked about health incessantly! There are only about four hundred students, yet the noise from cheering and applause they make during school concerts, supporting one another, is heartwarming.']

column1: Plainfield Academy for the Arts & Advanced Studies (PAAAS)
column2: ['I liked how everything was so simple. You knew what you had to do and you chose whether to do it or not. I would like them to move to a new building.', 'There are little to no clubs and/or after school activities. Administration is not helpful at all when student confronts them with a personal issue having to do with policies. Studios are actually enjoyable if you want to be there and some staff are the type of people who help you through life. The school needs to be bigger especially with all the grades it accepts, not having locker rooms is difficult bc it leaves bathrooms crowded and unavailable for the people who actually need to use them.', 'My experience about PAAAS is that I’ve had many opportunities to travel around many places and get to meet new people. What I like about PAAAS is that they prepare you for college and university. It also prepares you what is being expected in life and tips on how to survive in this environment.', 'I spent both my middle school and high school career at PAAAS and I can say I had throughout my 6 years attending the school I can say overall I had a great time.', 'I attended PAAAS since 8th grade, I join the dance program directed by Mrs. Jenkins. Now is directed by someone else, I have not taken dance classes with the new teacher for so long, so I will not comment on the her teaching skills. Overall PAAAS is a good school is low in funding as the performing arts school does not have their own stage, the school food is normal, could be better. As for education, it is challenging but worth it, I personally felt like it prepared me for college. The school is not that diverse. If you are looking for a art program the school is great at introducing people to the arts but if you really want to be a dancer, singer, actor, I suggest to search for a more intense program. I personally enjoyed my time there, even though the school hours are long from 8:00-3:50. At PAAAS you get a sense of community since it’s a small school and everyone knows everyone.', 'I’ve been attending PAAAS since the 7th grade and here i’ve learned so much about life and the way the education system works. PAAAS has motivated me to excel higher in education. At this school I was introduced to a program by the name of Rutgers Upward Bound. And this program helps me with work and studies and prepares me for college. PAAAS does this as well. The teachers at this school helps students unlike most high schools. I would recommend this school to any student who has a talent with the Arts, this school would fit you !', 'This is my 6th and final year at this school and it has its good and bad side about it. The good thing about it is that we have studios that we auditioned to get into and we have the class everyday. I am in piano and I love my teacher. The bad thing about this school is that we are over crowded. The school goes from grades 7-12 and now it will be going from 6-12 in the fall. The school is really small and I have a hard time getting  to class with all of the people standing around. The teachers that I had were great and some I’m glad I never have to see again. There are some teachers who are patient and try to encourage you to do your best while some do not have patience at all. I wish that my school was like other schools that have many clubs and programs but we do not have that. We are a uniform wearing school but we are also an arts schools which is a contradiction within itself.', 'I enjoy how calm and safe this school is. My town doesn’t have the best education system nor is it the best with safety. However my school gives me a better education then most schools in this district. Also there are no fights at my school unlike the other schools around my area. Also the teachers push and actually care about us, they make us strive to achieve great things. The staff is really great as well, they try to be as involved as they can be with students. However I feel as if my school is way too small and too crowded. I’m hoping to expand our space. It’s from 7th grade- 12th grade and it’s  only one floor. I would like to have more expansion. Also I want a lot more diversity in this school. The majority of the population are black or Hispanic, and very very few Asians. I like having a more diverse school.', "I like how different the school is compared to other and similar schools. They give you a chance to delve into your future career through 'studios'. The only thing I am not particularly fond of is the student body. It is a very rude environment that can get under even the toughest, level headed kid's skin. But, hey, that's high school for ya!", 'So far PAAAS is a good school academics wise. Though of course nothings perfect. We were selected as 3rd best school nationally, but as students we lack a lot of resources. Such as a library, proper auditorium and proper gymnasium.', 'The school is a very strict school. They do not joke about uniform. They want us to be prepare in the future when we need a uniform. The school might be hard but I know from experience students work hard fail or succeed.', 'What I really like about p.a.a.a.s is the connection you get to build with each teacher so your not just another name on the roster but actually have a bond with each teacher. Another reason why I do like p.a.a.a.s is the college preparatory the school gives you so your not just learning a subject but also being set up to expand your education no matter where you end up later on in life .', "In the town it's the best, compared to the state I'm not sure. The school and principal expects a lot from the students so it makes the students work harder than other students in the town.", "The clubs weren't as diverse as I would like it. All the after school activities/sports were through the main high school.", 'This school is great, they expect above and beyond from the students. An 83 is honor roll and a 93 is high honor roll compared to the other local schools where an 80 is honor roll and a 90 is high honor roll. I like this because it makes you try harder to get that 83 and stay on honor roll. On top of that you do performing arts and you get two degrees because of it.', "The teachers are very nice and friendly. Similarly to most other high schools the teachers can be annoying, but overall the teachers are nice, they know what they're talking about and they care about the students.", 'PAAAS in my opinion was a great school. People expect PAAAS to be like "Fame" or those other Performing Art movies on television. Honestly, it is all about what you make of it. The academics here are UNTOUCHABLE, and I am glad I did not go to any other school.', 'Teachers at this school are great! When I attended PAAAS, many of my teachers taught lessons by putting real life lessons into their teaching styles. Whether it was math, social studies, or English, the real life lessons helped students get a better understanding of what was being taught!', 'The school PAAAS does not have a lot of dangerous people in it so the security is not as high as other schools and the nurse is here and there if the problem is to big all he does is call your parents to send you home.', 'PAAAS offers a few clubs. The clubs are held every Friday morning and for 30 minutes. In my opinion the clubs are average but if the school had the right resources it could be better.']
