column6: ["PAAAS is an okay school. I met a lot of good people at that school. But school is not for meeting people school is about getting an education. The education quality at PAAAS Is poor. On a scale of 1 to 10. I would give it a 5. I say that because the school is unorganized. In the beginning of the school year some grades wouldn't have teachers into 3 months of the school year. Also some of the teacher hired see teaching as a job rather than a career. Some teacher job end at 4:00 and you will not hear from them until 8:00 am the next day. You have to make the teachers work rather than having the teachers make the students work. Also another con about the school is it is too small. Walmart is bigger than PAAAS. Not to mention it is a 7-12 school. With no sport teams at that. This school needs a lot of improvements.", 'At PAAAS some teachers really care and some teachers are just in it for the money. For example some teachers come early to school and give students time to come and review material. On the other hand some teachers only deal with you during the class period.', 'Overall, I feel safe in my school. There has been nothing so far to give me a legitamate reason to not feel safe.', 'PAAAS really offers some very great extracurricular actuvities. From yearbook committee, to debate, to Tiara club everyone is infatuated with calling their club "The best". I too am guilty of doing so because the club I partake in in my opinion is the best of the best.  I have been apart of the Debate team for four years now. Our club does not just stop at the school. We travel to Princeton University for One-Day Debate Conventons, Parsippany, Woodbridge and the farthest and longest convention we have been to is the three day convention in Washington D.C. The Junior Statesman of America is the debate team organization we partake in which is not a cheap one AT all. We do seek administrative help which then assists us with transportation and funds needed to pay additional expenses that we could not cover from fundraising alone. I use this example to prove the support of the administration for any club or organization. Fundraising does include our own, but we do get help from the Board. There are also clubs like Student Council and the Yearbook Committe that meet up after school for important updates from the Teacher Advisor of the organization. The National Homor Society, FBLA, etc also meet after school for necessary updates as well. These meetings do not just host three or four people. Many come out to join which shows student commintment. All in all, clubs like debate require to meet on the weekends from 9-12 on a Saturday and over 40 show up on time. If this is not dedication and true commitment, I have no idea what is. PAAAS is home to many successful clubs and organizations and as years progress so will the the quality and quantity of each and every one of them!', 'I once heard someone say that high school is what you make it. Attending PAAAS for the three, going on four years I have not came across a more authentic and truthful statement in my seventeen years of living. I was not expecting coming in the school in 2013 the places the school would have inevitably taken me literally and hypothetically. I originally was interviewed for admittance in the school for academics and was placed in Robotics as my double period studio. I knew nothing about robotics and was not sure if it was the right fit for me at all. Instead of backing out, my studio teacher encouraged me to try the studio. Currently, I am in Robotics IV, just recently made it to the FTC state championships as the Deceptibots (#7417), and I found my niche in the studio as the Engineering Notebook Specialist. Alongside with participating in this studio I became a member of the Plainfield Debate Chapter  apart I the JSA organization. From 2014-2016, with encouragement and training from my T.A I was not nominated for the Debate Team Chapter President. Because of this TA, I am now a cabinet member on the new debate chapter (PAAAS) & for the JSA organization as a Chapter of Internal Affairs Agent. All in all, I have been positively influenced by the teachers here which is why I would not mind doing it all again. Creating a bond with certain staff members and teachers made my experience worthwhile. I would not be where I am today without PAAAS. This school is full of talent both academically, artistically, musically, production-wise, etc. Your experience is what you make it in high school and I am living proof of a mighty great one.', 'The teachers and staff at Plainfield Academy for the Arts and Advanced Studies (PAAAS) are very open to help. If one teacher cannot assist a student or anyone in need both academically, or on a more personal level, they will surely direct you to someone who will be of efficient guidance. PAAAS is full of supportive and resourceful staff. Through the use of online references (I.e: video tutorials of a specific Period in History to how to algebraically solve a Matrice.), the teachers here have made it their obligation to appeal to not just kinesthetic learners but visual and/or auditory. All in all, everyone carries them self as a highly certified indicidual teaching their field and has the corresponding credentials to prove it. The teachers are amazing and great at what they do!', 'the students are interesting, all unique in their own way.', 'everyone put in great effort to make the school what it is.', 'MY SCHOOL IS AMAZING! The staff members are outstanding.', 'There are teachers a PAAAS that genuinely care about their students and will go above and beyond to see that student succeed. On the other hand, there are some teachers who were not prepared the level of rigor and academic quality PAAAS requires. Honestly, I believe majority if not all of the teachers want to see the students in this school succeed.', "I wish there were more after school activities to choose from because there's only so much we can do considering the fact that our school day is long and our time to do activities is very limited", 'Honestly if the school were in a more structured building where we had the sufficient amount of space for lockers and classrooms even for a real gym the school would be better in its appearance.', 'From my experience with the teachers I would say they are pretty good to me. Yes there are times where they have their off days but I push through and manage to build a relationship with them to where I can go to them with the aid I need to successfully get through the semester without much struggle.', 'Most of the teachers, at the least the ones I had, were great. They did care about their students. When a student did not understand the material teachers would make time available to meet them even if it meant going to school earlier, missing out on their lunch break, or staying after school. Each teacher had a different styles and some were more ineteresting than others but they knew the material and they tried to find a way the students would understand.', 'Some teachers are only here for the money', "This school is a good school if you want your kid to stay out of trouble. The issue is that the school is small, rapidly growing, and under-staffed. Class sizes are good though and most teachers are willing to help struggling students. School needs to be more organized. Students, evenn upperclassmen, don't have a lot of freedom. Overall, I would still recommend it, it's a safe small place.", "The teachers are very passionate about what they teach, and most of them are very approachable. The students are diverse in terms of background and tastes, and there's a place for everyone. One of my favorite experiences in this school was either listening to my physics teacher (because he's pretty funny) or playing volleyball against underclassmen during lunch. Another thing I enjoy is the fact that the students are so unique.", 'It best for children education', 'The teachers are committed to learning and doing their best for the students.', "The school's building is very limited in space.  This limits the instructional staff that can be hired."]

column2: ["Very small school, doesn't prepare students for STEM majors as much as needed but great arts programs and literature department, school feels like a family which is what they pride themselves on more than anything to create a sense of community.", "Essex is a very small family like school. Over the years i've become very comfortable at that school. The teachers genuinely care about the safety, well being and education of the students.", 'There are many ways to get everyone in the school to come together . Your education and abilities are their first priority.', 'I am a ESA senior and am about to graduate. In this school every teacher looks out for you and helps you to be successful. There is a lot of student involvement in our school about 90% of students are invovled in some type of activity within the school. Also there is a great student to teacher ratio and class sizes. My graduating class is only made up of 87 people which is pretty small compared to other NYC public high schools. I would recommend taking a tour and seeing how you fit with the school!', "I've had a very good time at this school. While yes there are cons like every school, might not like some rules or administration, but it's better than many. Starts at a good time of 9:25 am and ends a little late at 4:10 or 3:25 on some days. Teachers are supportive so long as you show effort.", 'Has great diversity and good teachers that care about you. The teachers care about whether you pass or fail and they actually remember your name. We call them by there first names and that makes the connection that much better. The students can get a bit dangerous from time to time but they try. I feel safe over all. I do wish it had more advanced classes however.', "When I first came here, in the absolute middle of the school year, I was immediately met with students who could care less about my arrival. We call our teachers by their first names which makes for a very personalized learning experience, which I value very much. The wonderful relationships and interactions from my teachers makes up for the mostly unbearable student body. This is also a project-based school, so while we don't take tests regularly, A LOT of our time is spent writing papers.  Another thing to add; there are no letter grades. Instead, there are standards like Honors, Exceeds, Meets, Approaching, and Incomplete. The school building is not very nice, as we don't have access to clean drinking water, but, there are a lot of stores and restaurants around the school that we are allowed to visit during lunch is we make it to school on time. Very laid back and intentional school!", 'My experience at Essex street academy was okay. Definitely wasn’t the typical high school being that the school it’s self was small. I also felt that I wasn’t prepared enough for college. Overall all the teachers at the school really do care about every student.', "It's a small school, everyone knows everyone. Small class size so you have a better relationship with the teachers", 'I was given a lot of opportunties', 'The teacher are always there with a warm and inviting welcome', 'After school for homework help', 'Very easy to get help from my teachers.', 'Teachers really care about their students.', "The teacher's at ESA are extremely friendly and helpful. Teachers often stay after school or come early in the mornings to work with students. The teachers at ESA befriend students by giving them life advice and helping them resolve issues they are experiencing beyond the classroom. ESA has great peer mediation to help students solve problems that they are having with one another.", 'Everybody was involved and that was one way that made the school more like a family because everyone was always around and together.', 'My overall experience was great because I met great friends that I still keep in touch and talk with today. I am in college. I know that if I ever need help I can always go back for help.', "This school was more project based and not testing which in ollege there is a lot of testing so feel there wasn't enough help in that area. I felt prepared for the real world because they always talked about what happens in the real world but showing and helping us not so much.", "The curriculum is very different in ESA. The school doesn't do regents, we do panels (presentations) of the final project of the semester. The learning is very diverse compared to most schools in NYC.", "Majority of the teachers are excellent, each of their teaching is very diverse. It's different in every classroom."]

column1: Repertory Company High School for Theatre Arts
column2: ['Well this school basically has opportunities available and helps students be college ready and develop real life skills. You meet new people and they shape you into a better person and grow social skills. Can be tuff when it comes to grading and work but other wise it is a good school. Just make sure you put in the effort into your classes and you are good to go.', "The community found at Repertory Company High School is, by far, the closest thing to a family a student can experience outside of their own home!The seemingly 'unconventional' high school environment that comes with the territory of being located in 42nd/Times Square and in the building of Town Hall allows students to learn of independence and initiative, as well as the diversity and very flourishing culture of NYC. This school is equipped to educate and train those that are serious about pursuing the arts as a career after graduating and inspire those that are just curious or interested in the concept of performing. The possibilities here are truly endless and the best part is that there are no restrictions or limitations put on students as they travel on their own artistic journey.", "It is an incredible school and it was the best choice i made to audition and go there. It has been a blessing to be part of all the events and get all the opportunities that I've gotten while being there. The teachers and staff have been incredibly helpful with planning my future and making sure i stay on top of my grades.", "What I loved about Repertory was its size. It's small size allows for close relationships to be made not only between students but also between teachers and students. I also loved the theatre program and how there is a piece of theatre for everyone: backstage, onstage, dance, acting, singing, writing, producing, directing, etc. However, Repertory can work on its academics, including teachers and supplies. Teachers are in and out, and the school struggles to find teachers to stay as a teacher for one class, leaving the students at a disadvantage. The school right now doesn't have working laptops for all the students. Though there are a lot of physical laptops, they are almost always broken, dead with no charger, missing keys, not connecting to the internet, etc.", 'I love how close the community of the school is, since there is about 260 students overall, it doesn’t feel like your typical judge school.', 'I love the people in the school and the family oriented. All the students are very close since its a small school. All the teachers are very helpful and are willing to dedicate their time to help students.', 'I love the opportunities that they provide us with. Sports has a low rating because we are a performing arts school that covers many aspects of the arts and are constantly improving.', 'Repertory was nothing like I expected. I expected the high school musical experience. It’s actually like any other school. I wish I would have put myself out more or engaged in more because that’s how you get further than others performance wise. There are upgrades needed equipment wise such as computers that actually work.', 'During my time at Repertory I learned that there really is such a thing as a home away from home. At Rep, every face has a name making your time there that much more comfortable. Teachers and staff are people who want to be there and care about your education. Most importantly, being a student at Rep is about expressing yourself and becoming the person you were made to be.', "The school is pretty good. They have a good curriculum, it's just mainly the students that could be better.  Would recommend if you want challenging AP classes, and advance classes for the arts  are offered as well.", 'Repertory Company High School has an outstanding theatre department and an excellent academic department. The teachers care deeply for the students especially since it’s a small school. I really like it here.', "As a graduating senior of the Class of 2018 at Repertory, my experience has been unique. The school offers many performing arts opportunities outside of school. Also there are a vast amount of organizations that covers the vast amount of interests shown by students. My junior year, I was able to partake in a after school paid internship at the Park Avenue Armory. On the contray, the school lacks organization skills. In addition the communication amongst the staff is poor.  For example, one teacher may plan a mid day trip and other teachers wouldn't be aware.", 'I like that this high school gave us a chance to experience all 3 arts and did not make us as students stick to one choice', "The students are really welcoming, and although there are friend groups, the atmosphere is pretty open so it's very easy to be included. Most teachers are good, and get the lessons across with the exception of a few teachers. Saftey wise there are no metal detectors and were located near Time Square so there's a lot of foot traffic.", 'Repertory is a great school filled with a diverse group of students and staff. Its a small school so the class sizes are smaller, and teachers become more personal and welcoming than any other schools. The school is art based, so performing classes (acting, dancing, singing) are mandatory. They have great connections with groups and organizations based in the arts which help students in and out of school.', 'My class of 2018 has been like a family. Regardless of the problems we had with each other, we have proved to be there for each other when we needed it the most, especially when someone wanted to attack one of our own for petty reasons. We know who we are, and we embrace our differences because the one thing we have in common is the dream to go far in life and are proud of our roots.  What I would change is the way students interact with different teachers because I believe that a respectful relationship should be enforced by the students and teachers. I think it is disrespectful and unfair for students to respect one teacher more than another, just because one can be more "strict" and have a more demanding tone then another one does. We all go to school to learn and when your peers disrupt one particular class daily, it gets you frustrated because the material is not being taught, nor understood.', "Repertory has always been a fun school that encourages students to express themselves and be diverse and honest. I've always loved the school because of the school environment and the opportunities given to students. I wish the staff would speak more on diversity and teach more about real life things like taxes, APR rates, and general things that students leave high school not knowing.", "Throughout my 4 years of attending Repertory, I can say I've grown exponentially in both academic and Performing Arts Fields. The school's small size allows it to pay attention to students and give them all opportunities that come from their partnerships with the many nearby features and companies. I was able to do things like win scholarships for dance intensives, perform on broadway stages, and even fully direct a play of my writing. Where else can you do all of that?", "As a Freshman at Rep, I love it here.There is no bullying. Everyone at Repis the sweetest and really care about your success and happiness. Our administration is very dedicated to well being of the students. We are a small school so everyone knows everyone and it makes life great because you don't feel like a little fish in a big sea you feel like you're equally cared about.", 'I am really proud to be apart of this school. This school has a lot to offer in the arts, all of them from dance, singing, and acting. Throughout the years all 3 of the arts was implemented in my schedule and I love every one of the classes. In dance class, we would learn everything from jazz to musical theater and even to ballet. In the acting category, there are 2 plays every year, one would be a musical and the other would be a play. The shows are all student auditioned and performed. This school has wonderful teachers and faculty that creates bonds with you and will remember your name.']

column6: ["I attended Repertory during my freshman year of high school. I walked into an array of artist; dancers, actors and musicians all welcoming me with open arms. The students at Repertory make the experience of attending the school unforgettable. The teachers make themselves available in the mornings, during lunch and after school to assist students who request additional help with their studies. The productions that the faculty and students work closely together to organize are phenomenal. Repertory does allow their students to find their artistic footing while pushing their students to reach their full potential in the arts. Their methods of teaching in classes such as music, dance and acting prepares these students for the world of theater. At Repertory, you have the chance to make your experience ordinary or extraordinary. It's solely up to you.", "My school might not be the best school in the state but it's very small and all the teachers will know you. I mean we have no nurse and rules change often but we're a developing school so it's understandable. We are entirely dedicated to theatre arts and many of the students want to pursue that but there are some that don't as well which is understandable. It has its ups and it has its downs", 'Repertory Company High School has overall been a pretty good experience. Most of the administration has been in theatre. I would like to see the advisory sessions change and talk more about college rather than student behavior.', "Repertory is a small school, mostly focused on the performing arts. Their partnership with different programs is strong which is good if you want to pursue the performing arts realm. As for academics, Repertory has a small staff which can become difficult for some teachers to worry about one class when they have to worry about another. Some teachers don't even know how to teach or control a class it's chaotic. If you're looking to enjoy the arts, Repertory is a good place; however, the academics in the school are the downside.", 'I had a great experience while attending Repertory. The teachers and staff are very helpful and kind, and most importantly I can say I felt safe.', 'I liked the fact that repertory is very diverse and small where we all are a family. Also the acting program allows me to perfect my craft and progress as a man and continue to do what love. At rep I am able to overcome any problem. I  have develop many different qualities that have made me become the man I AM today', 'This high school is great considering its classes are separate for each department. Also the teachers make it feel like a family. They also understand when you have a situation.', 'this is a very bad school. learning here is so hard. no teachers care about another classes. my four years being here was no fun at all i do not reccomend this school to any students in new york ,its a bad experience.', "I hate this School. The teachers don't care about the students. It could be better but it just won't. The students is here are bullies and fight every day. I feel unsafe when I'm in this school. I just can't wait to leave this school.", "Over the year the school has changed tremendous. For example through my whole 4 years of attending the school I've had several of my teachers leave in the middle of the academic year leaving me at a hard point to contiue my learning of the course. Also making it difficult to take the advance test I planned on passing. Not only this but also our original principal leaving and taking most of the Rep culture with him, school hasnt been quite the same since. This school has it ups and downs but it wasn't the true experience I expect d to revive from a school revolved around the arts.", "Repertory Company High School for Theatre Arts not only helped me in finding myself as a person but made me question my life and what I want to do with it. All schools may have its ups and downs but I feel whats important is how it shaped the individual as a person. I wouldn't be the person today if it wasn't for this school.", 'My experience in repertory company high school was different from students in other high schools. I got to learn about my passion, which was theatre. it allowed me to express myself and build bonds with my teachers over musicals and plays and books. repertory allows its student to learn about the theatre world with a different lens than just an ordinary person.', "What I can Tell about my experience is that there's a widespread diversity of students attending; although everyone is different the atmosphere is welcoming. What I would like see change is more sport opportunities, due to the limited spacing there isn't any sport teams.", 'I love the tight knite community that this school provides. With its location in the center of the theater district, and Times Square, there are many opportunities to be involved in the entertainment industry. Also the small school population gives the warmest environment you will ever find in a public high school. This school truly is one big family.', 'Even do we do have a variety of extracurricular I think we need more sports in our school', 'I love the fact that I chose to attend this high school. The experience is so different and I enjoy everything about this school. I love the fact that we have fun in class and we are mostly free to do as we please.', "Teachers in my school really go above and beyond to make sure every students gets the appropriate education. The teachers like to include real world problems in our learning so that when we are actually in the real world we know exactly how it's going to be.", "The teachers here at Repertory care about their students inside and outside of the classroom. They are very intelligent and well informed while providing students with a chance to learn. However, Repertory seems to have a very sensitive reputation when it comes to teachers and staff members departing or transferring to another workplace, especially in the middle of the year. Because of this students are stuck with newly substitute teachers that have no idea with what they're doing when it comes to teaching styles, communication skills and consistency in grading. I am in high hopes that Repertory will quickly fix this issue, it has become an ongoing issue. Therefore, the overall quality of teachers varies depending on what teacher you have or what subject they teach.", "We don't have a school nurse, the school aide calls the parent and they have to commute to the school to pick up their kid. There's little bullying, the teachers shut it down quickly. We have school safety. The school is safe because we have alarms on the door and they ring off past a certain time when someone comes in or goes out.", 'We always have opportunities to perform on Broadway. Either through LEAP plays, Senior Distinction Projects, Shubert Theatre hookups. The school makes sure we get the right connections to get our names out there.']

column2: ['Ramapo high school is a school that has a high amount of diversity which makes it so that others are able to readily respect and be open to cultures other then their own. However, subjects such as music and art are to often looked down upon', 'Very great school helped me with a lot of love to see a lot of more people involved and more mentors', "Overall, it is a decent school but it's lacking in some areas. The lunch is at best eatable and from the looks of it, I don't think the classrooms get cleaned everyday. The teachers however are very competent (the ones I have had at least), they are always ready to help and they make themselves very accessible to the students.  The school makes a number of sports available to the students, including tennis and golf. The track and football field just got remodeled and it's looking great. The student parking lot is okay but a remodelling wouldn't hurt either.", 'ramapo high school is commonly known as "that" school to everyone. it had a blistering and thriving lifestyle, a wide variety of scholarships and other events were constantly occurring. the sports teams were district champions and everyone wished their children could\'ve gone here. but now the walls are scattered with plaques of great achievements (the most recent being in 1991) serving no other purpose to remind us how much of a neighborhood hasx changed.', 'The school needs a new building or consistent expert repair and maintenance of the existing building. WE NEED MORE RESOURCES SUCH AS BOOKS, COMPUTERS AND SMART BOARDS. THE DISTRICT NEED TO BETTER PREPARE THE STUDENTS FOR EXAMS SUCH AS THE SAT/ACT, REGENTS AND FOR ENTRY TO COLLEGE.The school is over crowded with large class sizes that are not conducive to effective learning. The board should only have residents whose children attend the schools and not private yeshivas.The sports, art and music programs should be reinstated and better after school support to students should be available. We are important and our parents pay hefty school taxes but our education is lacking. Our elected officials should endeavor to assist our school district in the Rockland county area of New YORK.', 'My experience in Ramapo High School was amazing. During my years spent in Ramapo, I took a lot of honors and advance placement classes. Though those classes were tough, I had amazing friends, who were also taking these classes, help me through it. Thus making my experience fun and memorable.', 'GreatThis is a an interesting GreatThis is a an interesting GreatThis is a an interesting GreatThis is a an interesting GreatThis is a an interesting GreatThis is a an interesting GreatThis is a an interesting GreatThis is a an interesting GreatThis is a an interesting GreatThis is a an interesting', 'I have grown so much since i had stepped foot in this school. Teachers are very involved , lack of school pride, food is alright and administration and faculty are really caring.', "The guidance counselors aren't the best when it comes to giving you all the information you need to jumpstart on applying to colleges. Nothing is spoon fed to you, you literally have to put you're best foot forward to receive anything. There are a lot of kids, some classes are crowded. I wish teachers would provide us with more information about college.", 'Ramapo High School has a wonderful faculty and staff, who work very well with students and parents. They are continuously helping to make improvements with academics and the facilities. For example, they recently installed solar panels in the front of the school and renovated the entire track/football field and bleachers this past year. I would like to see greater efforts in meal preparation and distribution given the shortened lunch periods.', 'Although the environment and students in the school may not be the best, the teachers there are amazing! They always stay on top of you to ensure you are doing the best you are capable of doing.', 'Due to accessing grant money, the school is currently improving. However, there have been many budget cuts in the past. So extracurricular activities like art, music, and sports have greatly suffered. I believe this is why many students are apathetic to the school. They have a negative view of the school, which makes the overall experience worse. When there is effort put in, like in pep rallies and Science Olympiad, the Ramapo experience is like no other.', 'I like the teachers but the programs there are limited, the food is ok, and the facility is not staying in good condition', 'The overall experience at Ramapo is average. The thing that i liked about it was its diversity and the people there. You form strong connections', 'Older building; the staff works hard to make the most out of what the school is. The guidance department is really good at what they do. Very fun school.', 'This is my fourth and final year here and while I’m tired of going here, I think there are some things that I’ll miss. This school has a wide variety of teachers and you may not like them all but that’s par for the course. We have a decent amount of AP classes but no IB, which is disappointing. I have faith that the academia here will, with time, improve and produce students who are up to par with their potential college and life counterparts. We are not a bad school and honestly it’s almost impossible to make a statement on us unless you attend. Some aspects of us are even better than the popular private schools the locals send their children to instead. However, I wish that the district board were different and allowed students to have more opportunities in all aspects of the word so that we can break the stigma and get back to being #1.', 'One thing I like about RHS is the way they they teach, there’s a lot of competence in this school they help students with technology. One thing I want to see change to this school is the “night School”. The student need maximum 2 English Teachers.', 'Ramapo High School is a very diversed school, however we are separated by cultures. Also, we lack resources that could’ve have helped us achieve amazing things, including better grades. I love that you can easily be friends with someone there, but I would change the lack of supervision and rule enforcment. I wouldn’t change my high school over any other one, but we could be doing better.', 'I would like to see an easier way to incorporate the rotating schedule so it could be easier for freshman to know the school. They should give more tours out to the incoming freshman. I love the clubs and the electives they have', 'Ramapo has great teachers and overall if you wish to apply yourself they are there for you. However, the student body of Ramapo, or at least the mass majority, do not take advantage of the plethora of resources provided to them. School physical facilities are lacking though.']
column4: ['Ramapo high school is a school that has a high amount of diversity which makes it so that others are able to readily respect and be open to cultures other then their own. However, subjects such as music and art are to often looked down upon', 'Very great school helped me with a lot of love to see a lot of more people involved and more mentors', "Overall, it is a decent school but it's lacking in some areas. The lunch is at best eatable and from the looks of it, I don't think the classrooms get cleaned everyday. The teachers however are very competent (the ones I have had at least), they are always ready to help and they make themselves very accessible to the students.  The school makes a number of sports available to the students, including tennis and golf. The track and football field just got remodeled and it's looking great. The student parking lot is okay but a remodelling wouldn't hurt either.", 'ramapo high school is commonly known as "that" school to everyone. it had a blistering and thriving lifestyle, a wide variety of scholarships and other events were constantly occurring. the sports teams were district champions and everyone wished their children could\'ve gone here. but now the walls are scattered with plaques of great achievements (the most recent being in 1991) serving no other purpose to remind us how much of a neighborhood hasx changed.', 'The school needs a new building or consistent expert repair and maintenance of the existing building. WE NEED MORE RESOURCES SUCH AS BOOKS, COMPUTERS AND SMART BOARDS. THE DISTRICT NEED TO BETTER PREPARE THE STUDENTS FOR EXAMS SUCH AS THE SAT/ACT, REGENTS AND FOR ENTRY TO COLLEGE.The school is over crowded with large class sizes that are not conducive to effective learning. The board should only have residents whose children attend the schools and not private yeshivas.The sports, art and music programs should be reinstated and better after school support to students should be available. We are important and our parents pay hefty school taxes but our education is lacking. Our elected officials should endeavor to assist our school district in the Rockland county area of New YORK.', 'My experience in Ramapo High School was amazing. During my years spent in Ramapo, I took a lot of honors and advance placement classes. Though those classes were tough, I had amazing friends, who were also taking these classes, help me through it. Thus making my experience fun and memorable.', 'GreatThis is a an interesting GreatThis is a an interesting GreatThis is a an interesting GreatThis is a an interesting GreatThis is a an interesting GreatThis is a an interesting GreatThis is a an interesting GreatThis is a an interesting GreatThis is a an interesting GreatThis is a an interesting', 'I have grown so much since i had stepped foot in this school. Teachers are very involved , lack of school pride, food is alright and administration and faculty are really caring.', "The guidance counselors aren't the best when it comes to giving you all the information you need to jumpstart on applying to colleges. Nothing is spoon fed to you, you literally have to put you're best foot forward to receive anything. There are a lot of kids, some classes are crowded. I wish teachers would provide us with more information about college.", 'Ramapo High School has a wonderful faculty and staff, who work very well with students and parents. They are continuously helping to make improvements with academics and the facilities. For example, they recently installed solar panels in the front of the school and renovated the entire track/football field and bleachers this past year. I would like to see greater efforts in meal preparation and distribution given the shortened lunch periods.', 'Although the environment and students in the school may not be the best, the teachers there are amazing! They always stay on top of you to ensure you are doing the best you are capable of doing.', 'Due to accessing grant money, the school is currently improving. However, there have been many budget cuts in the past. So extracurricular activities like art, music, and sports have greatly suffered. I believe this is why many students are apathetic to the school. They have a negative view of the school, which makes the overall experience worse. When there is effort put in, like in pep rallies and Science Olympiad, the Ramapo experience is like no other.', 'I like the teachers but the programs there are limited, the food is ok, and the facility is not staying in good condition', 'The overall experience at Ramapo is average. The thing that i liked about it was its diversity and the people there. You form strong connections', 'Older building; the staff works hard to make the most out of what the school is. The guidance department is really good at what they do. Very fun school.', 'This is my fourth and final year here and while I’m tired of going here, I think there are some things that I’ll miss. This school has a wide variety of teachers and you may not like them all but that’s par for the course. We have a decent amount of AP classes but no IB, which is disappointing. I have faith that the academia here will, with time, improve and produce students who are up to par with their potential college and life counterparts. We are not a bad school and honestly it’s almost impossible to make a statement on us unless you attend. Some aspects of us are even better than the popular private schools the locals send their children to instead. However, I wish that the district board were different and allowed students to have more opportunities in all aspects of the word so that we can break the stigma and get back to being #1.', 'One thing I like about RHS is the way they they teach, there’s a lot of competence in this school they help students with technology. One thing I want to see change to this school is the “night School”. The student need maximum 2 English Teachers.', 'Ramapo High School is a very diversed school, however we are separated by cultures. Also, we lack resources that could’ve have helped us achieve amazing things, including better grades. I love that you can easily be friends with someone there, but I would change the lack of supervision and rule enforcment. I wouldn’t change my high school over any other one, but we could be doing better.', 'I would like to see an easier way to incorporate the rotating schedule so it could be easier for freshman to know the school. They should give more tours out to the incoming freshman. I love the clubs and the electives they have', 'Ramapo has great teachers and overall if you wish to apply yourself they are there for you. However, the student body of Ramapo, or at least the mass majority, do not take advantage of the plethora of resources provided to them. School physical facilities are lacking though.']

column8: ['the schools student body is made up of approx 85% of minority of the haitian community , most of the teachers there do not have the communication skills to teach these students. also the board is made up of members who their own children do not attend or participate in the public school system. there is very limited programs,activities,organizations for the school system due to budgeting and its really hurting the student body in the worst way. Maybe 40% of the teachers genuinely care but without the necessary tools,technology,and backing it is very hard to teach. when there is a problem the people from the top down should be blamed.', "It's the best because of the amount of care they help you.", 'The teachers really care for the students.', 'Many extracurricular face budget  cuts making it hard for them to compete or have proper tools or transportation to complete state requirements to then be top leading in the state', "I enjoyed being apart of the arts program though it is in need of a lot more funding. I also wouldn't choose this school again because in the arts department it is lead by teachers who rely on favorites and do not strengthen the other members of the group as well as they need more funding.", 'The teach staff at ramapo do their job diligently but sometimes focus on the negatives of student rather then motivating them to continue to do better', "I feel pretty secure in my school. If a fight breaks out security is usually right there to break up and there's always an armed and unarmed security guard near the main entrance.", "Personally I like staying after school because most of the people who don't really take school as seriously aren't there. I just wish the quality of the clubs and organization could be higher and for there to be more options.", 'My experience overall at this school was okay. I', "Most teachers do care about the students and take education very seriously while some other teachers just want to get paid. Also there are those few teachers who have no idea what they're doing and no learning is really going on.", 'Due to tensions between the board of education and the actual schools, it\'s hard to have the "full high school experience" here. Clubs and classes are constantly being threatened to be cut. Although these complications, the school itself is extremely diverse and gave me a sense of the real world.', 'I believe that a lot of the teachers are extremely helpful and engaging when teaching but a few lack this ability.', "Ramapo High School is actually a good school, even though we have low funding its the students and the way the teachers teach that make the school look good. In all honesty the teachers actually teach good then there's some teachers that aren't as good. That's the only thing that i don't like about the school, because if there's something a student doesn't get some teachers get frustrated and don't have the patience to help but that's what its all about in order to make the school look good you have to give the students the knowledge.", 'Provides a great education despite the circumstance', "-the school's diversity makes it very unique\r -the bad conditions the school and the district is in unites the students and families like nothing else", 'My experiences have been pretty good', 'the school has many perks as well as down falls but overall its a good school', 'Some teachers are excellent. School board is corrupt. Low parent involvement. Kids are generally unmotivated.', "Some teachers do their best to engage students but I've had a teacher tell my class that he didn't care if we passed because either way he would be getting paid.", 'We had extracurricular but do to budget cuts they were taken away.']

column2: ["The school isn't too bad, i went in with a bad mindset but the teachers were really nice and if you stay with the right group of people you'll be fine. One thing i should say is that the grading process is a little easy compared to the school i went to before, so if you want to be challenged maybe its not the school for you but its not so bad. I'm enjoying my last year here.", 'I am a senior in ACE and the school is the perfect place to be..the teachers are always ready to lend helping hands to students anytime they are need.', 'My experience at the school Is very good. The teachers prepare you for the regents, they treat everyone equally, always there when you need help with school work. What I like about the school Is every opportunity they got to do good for the students they make sure every student participate. I would love for the school to have a vocation for the students like food&nutrition, business, cosmetology, welding, etc.', "When it comes to ACE , teachers care a lot about students. Their emphasis on college readiness is at a great ordeal and out of the small amount of events that occur at this school,  I must say the staff dedicates it's all into making sure these events turn out perfect. Many opportunities available if you are a sporty person if not, maybe you are just a you person. Anyways four years at this school will fly by fast.", "I like that the teachers focuses on each student individually, you feel more important because of that & like the actually care about you. At ACE I feel like it holds me back from receiving a full high school experience. ACE is a very small school because its a school inside a educational campus that houses about 6 other schools. Ace is inside South shore educational campus which is a big campus & used to be a whole school & have a lot of students but closed in 2010 due to gang violence, poor academic performance & an array of other things, so New York city decided to open up 7 smaller schools inside. This makes Ace feel like a forgotten school. There's around 200 students & it feels smaller than that due to spotty attendance from a lot of students so most of the time the school feels very empty & not like high school at all. I don't feel like i'm in high school most of the time i feel like i'm just going through the motions of a 4 year small educational crash course.", "I absolutely love this school. I transferred to this school from another and started  a 10th grader. I've enjoyed every moment that I've been hear and can't wait to start my junior year here. The only thing i wish i can change is that there should be more clubs but other than that i love ace.", "This is a very ambitious school, it's prepare students for the future, it's cultural diverse school, encourage students and also help students for college readiness and the big future ahead of them. Very great school", 'Although the school building itself has a bad reputation,  the school turns out to be a safe school because of the amount of school guards all around the school. All the students come from different places in the neighborhood and it feels like a whole big family.', "My experience at the Academy for Conservation and the Environment was/is fine. My time there so far has been good. I've made alot of friends. Learn alot from my teachers; and I am comfortable. The environment there is motivational and the size is just right; small, but not too small. I have participated in some of the many activities that they have going on there and really like playing sports (basketball), am watching it also. Its my senior year here and I soon leave, but I am definitely going to miss this school", "Some of the teachers in school teaching skills are not that good. Some of their work doesn't make sense or they do not teach good. Some kids barely learn anything or the class would get off topic and waste a period of class", 'The school is a great learning community and they help students stay on track with college.', 'The teachers at ACE are very good listeners and can comprise with students, they grade accordingly to what you deserve and what you are capable of.They are very intelligent and extremely proficient in the subjects taught as well as other, the compare the lessons to real life situations allowing you to be able to relate and will break it down if you are still unsure. No student is left behind despite of his/he incompetence.', 'Parents are readily involve in children learning and tutoring is provided by both teachers and students to help student to get a better understanding and to grasp the concepts more readily. The school facilities are always up to par but may have a few technical difficulties with some smart boards. Computer are available at certain hours and bathrooms are always sanitary.', 'The footballer were the most supported team in the school and i am not really a fan of football. Every student has gym class at least 5 times per week, gym may include weight training, aerobics (for seniors), Dance education and Phys Ed, Miss Rolando is the best gym teacher and trainer you can find, she pushes the student to there limits and beyond and still has the power to be nice, we have regular work out days during the week but on Fridays, we use the Wii to work out. The is also Ms M who is Health Mentor and how a program every week called team battle chef in which student compete to prepare a healthy meal. Other health programs include the biggest lower which was a competition between teacher and students to see who would lose the most weight at the end of the school year, the student dominated!! After school exercise program was on Wednesday hosted again by Ms M.', 'I was a proud member of ACE CARES which was a charity club that performed numerous activity for people in need of help. The Prospect Park Breast Cancer Awareness march was one of our main events in 2012,it was a very good experience as we walk 5 miles to support a cause, we also had an coat and can drive for the winter season i which we collected coats and donated them to people in need.I have a great passion for helping others. I was also a member of the girls soccer team which was unsuccessful because other girls were too lazy to participate, there was also a Caribbean club which was very well need because about 80% of the schools population was from the Caribbean, the gamer club and sustainability, headed by my Carlson were very popular as well. Educational after school clubs include regents prep for all subject and tutoring. The Vikings (football team) were also the champions for the games played against other football teams in Brooklyn.', "As mentioned before the school is like an extended family, people are helpful and encouraging. I am not just saying this to give the school a good review because no one from the school knows that I'm doing this. The day of graduation i cried because my family at school was about to break apart, i realized how much these people both staff and fellow peers meant to me that very day and that i would only get to communicate with them though social networking and the barriers of phone screens and Video chats after this day. ACE is different from every other school in the Brooklyn area because as a united body we stand for each other, encouraging and uplifting each other because at the end of the day we all want the best for the person who sat next to us in chemistry class or the girl who but the new pair of 11s before you got the chance to. I have no regrets, my two years were well spent and truly enjoyed. God gave us one direction and that is moving forward but the pass is significant and can neatly shape the future.", 'I went to the school for two years and i have never experience any extreme security obstruction, regular fight without weapons. there have been hall sweep and practice shut downs.', 'The food is 50% good most time where taste is concerned how ever it is always health conscious, everything is served with a salad, milk and there is water available. The menu changes daily but always have a fruit, salad, protein and carbohydrates which is the main nutrients needed. Popular menus include, rice, chicken, ripe plantains, chocolate milk, an apple/ orange and vegetables. The food is very healthy', 'The teachers at A.C.E prepare student for college, there are a variety of subject  tough and offered at AP and Regents level. Teachers prepare students as early from as the 9th grade for the regents exams and if the pass (65% do) they go on to the available advance placement classes. The school year has 5 marking periods and a progress report session proceeding each. The main purpose for these progress reports are to keep every student on track or to inform parents of what students need to do to pass the marking period hence giving everyone a fair chance of collecting there materials and getting to work. The honor role system and punctuality system are means of encouragement to students stimulating them to work towards a certain goal of having their names being placed around the school for their accomplishments. Mr. Carlson is THE BEST chemistry and Forensics teacher in Brooklyn, his assignments are real and can relate to everyday situations which makes them fun. Organic chemistry is on of the best topic at the end of the semester as well as Ballistics in forensics, projects are issued every two weeks and are expected to be completed in a minimum of two weeks, on breaks we are given projects for almost every class as well.', "The Dean tires effortless to instill a particular dress code which is often times followed, college counselors are very helpful as the work with you everyday to ensure that your life doesn't end after graduation. I am very thankful for Ms. Pushkin as she helped me to decide on the college that was best for me and to get into that college. The office staff are very encouraging as well and will not judge you but will help to  guide u down the right path.There is rarely bullying at the school because most people are friendly, it is like an extended family at The Academy For Conservation and the Environment."]

The honor role system and punctuality system are means of encouragement to students stimulating them to work towards a certain goal of having their names being placed around the school for their accomplishments. Mr. Carlson is THE BEST chemistry and Forensics teacher in Brooklyn, his assignments are real and can relate to everyday situations which makes them fun. Organic chemistry is on of the best topic at the end of the semester as well as Ballistics in forensics, projects are issued every two weeks and are expected to be completed in a minimum of two weeks, on breaks we are given projects for almost every class as well.', "The Dean tires effortless to instill a particular dress code which is often times followed, college counselors are very helpful as the work with you everyday to ensure that your life doesn't end after graduation. I am very thankful for Ms. Pushkin as she helped me to decide on the college that was best for me and to get into that college. The office staff are very encouraging as well and will not judge you but will help to  guide u down the right path.There is rarely bullying at the school because most people are friendly, it is like an extended family at The Academy For Conservation and the Environment."]

column2: ["It's a pretty good high school, the teachers are chill, and fun. The school over all is good. During 9th- 11th grade you will be in a class of students, meaning nobody will have an individual schedule. In 12th grade you will get an individual schedule. We have gone in many college trips to expose of to life after high school, like adelphi (one of my personal favorites) , LIU, BMCC, and more. We also have college fairs and with the help of our wonderful counselors we fill out fasfa forms, college applications.", "My experience there was overall good, except minor problems kept coming up. For example, problems with teachers, and students. Some teachers make mistakes with your grades without realizing it and submit it. Sometimes you'll come across that 1 kid who tries to get to your head... and it can be very irritating since you'll probably bump into them more than once a day. But other than that, I'd say it was a really good school with amazing, helpful programs for every student.", 'I like sunset Park high school, because the teachers are very kind and helpful. They are always looking for new ways to teach and to new ways to improve the school. The school is a safe place where you can express your ideas and nobody will judge you because this school has a lot of diversity.', 'Horrible! I worked there as a teacher for a year. The worse school ever. The environment is sick the teachers are nasty and mean to each other and give or receive no support.there is a lot of discrimination and racism going on. The administration does not care about the students. There are a bunch of teachers close to administration doing some "jobs" in the office, they are " the favorites" getting easy jobs and more pay; while other teachers work hard. Everything is unfair the schedule, the work load and the way they distribute money between them.', 'I like how inclusive Sunset Park High School is. They always try to incorporate different cultures to make everyone feel welcome. Their hospitality is unmatched!', "My name is Jason i am currently attending to sunset park high school I will graduate in the year of 2019, I have to say that for those who want to attend to sunset park high school but you are not sure I have to tell you that is a great school that will give you the hand form the first day you step in to the last day you graduate, The teachers are tend to be your advisors also they will always help you to the most they can, they while help you by giving you advices not just academically but personal, they will give you tips for things such as Reagents, SAT, etc. The teachers become more then your teachers they become your parents at school, they will always smile at you, because they don't discriminate , and not just teachers are like that, deans principal and others will always support you and try to make you feel like you are in a safe school.", 'I enjoy my time here in Sunset Park High School. Is there things I don’t like? Yes absolutely. But I believe if you make the best of what you have, it can be good. This is why I’ve taken many opportunities here. I’ve joined the student leadership team, after schools, and many other clubs. Now I’m helping to make the school better. I just wish we were pushed harder. Given more work, and not be held by our teachers hands all the time. For example; when giving a homework, they try to make it as easiest as possible so people can actually do it. Still, I’ve enjoyed my time here.', 'Sunset Park high school is a very good school and it offers plenty of things . They offer after school programs all the way to college ready programs . One thing I would like to see change is the staff and facility letting students do fundraisers.', 'What I liked about the school was the amount of opportunities you had as a student for internships, clubs and after school activities. There was always something to do in the school everyday of the week. Teachers are generally very supportive and tend to offer any available time they have to help you progress in your studies.', 'Everyone is friendly in the school. Counselor prepares you for College Now. The teacher offers help whenever you need it.', "I liked the community somewhat, I joined a lot of clubs and even joined the volleyball team but did not like the team so sadly I had to quit. I liked the classes a lot but wish that I didn't have to retake classes freshman year. Also they should have offered more AP classes for those who actually want to take it.", "Overall, the school is not like what everyone says. The teachers are great and help push me to my limits of working, and the college courses/AP courses I have taken are pretty good. I've taken two University of Albany classes here for college credit, AP English, AP Global and college Math. The school itself is diverse with all kinds of students, so are the teachers themselves. Afterschool programs are at a pretty good amount, with many of them to help students with work experiences, Life or just fun in general. This school isn't like what everyone says mainly due to the reason they don't actually go here. It's a school with good academics and awesome opportunities.", "My high school career was average. Made a friend, and have lot's of memories with it. I was kind of shy in ninth grade, now I'm a blooming butterfly. Kind of over high school, and now I'm ready to take this new chapter of my life with the people I love the most. Had some flaws, but it made me who I am.", 'what i liked about sunset park was that it helped me become more of a organized student and more mature about how important life is after you graduate if you want to be successful', 'Academics are not challenging at all, but they have a program inside the school that helps students prepare for college and career. I was in the program throughout my 4 years and it helped a lot! Also, you will earn a small stipend! I was the salutatorian when I graduated, and in my opinion, the class materials are not hard at all. There were barely any AP courses when I was there.', "The teachers in this school are very good. They are caring as if you were their own child and they want nothing more but to see you succeed and achieve your goals. Sunset park is the cleanest school I've been in as well.", "My old high school is just like a typical high school, you wake up every morning ready to learn and the teachers are ready to teach you. There's was plenty of times I thought about giving in and giving up but the teachers, administration, and faculty always pushed me to do more and do better. You need that growing up in new york", 'There are very supportive teachers who are there when ever you need it, but you must be proactive. Very friendly staff who want to see you grow. I would like to see more diversity in the school. And I would like to see more parent involvement.', "What I like about Sunset Park High School is that the teachers as a whole try to push you into doing better in and outside of class. If it's on working on your punctuality, organizing skills, thinking skills, and writing skills. They also create a safe environment where you can feel comfortable and be able to stay focused to do work.", 'Teachers were awesome. They cared about your grades and you as a student. Very friendly. Students (not all) were interactive and talented.']

column6: ["At first, I was against being in this school because of the rumors surrounding it. However, after one semester being there, I started to really enjoy it. There were many fun club actives that I didn't get a chance to be in in middle school, and the teachers were really welcoming and would do their best to make sure that you would pass the class. Not only that but Sunset Park High School is improving in education as well. Now there are more AP classes available for everyone. Not only that but they would have Saturday academy to help students who need extra help in classes. Sunset Park High School has improved greatly throughout the years. What I would like this school to change though would most likely be the school lunches because sometimes they aren't really the best.", 'Sunset Park High School offered me a wide variety of choices to choose since now we have electives classes more College Now options that are offered here in the school and outside and with many clubs to choose from everyday.', "I honestly thought I wouldn't survive the environment in this school but I got through it. I managed to make a great group of friends who provide me with the right support. Also, having great teachers who understand me. But, academics still have some room to improve.", "This school has its benefits and its flaws. I would say that the flaws outweigh the benefits. The school can offer people a good support system that will help those struggling in school. However, after that, they just stay there. The school has not pushed for students to be high achievers. We recently got AP classes, but since no one was prepared properly for an AP caliber class, people are struggling through the class. The school will hold your hand and stop you from going higher than you'd like.", "Teachers and staff are super in the aspect of both being your teachers and once being off the clock. We've had many teacher Vs Students competitions and it only shows how close we are with each other. I would have been happier if our P.E classes were longer and our after school programs offered more sports. But I don't blame them because the school just reacently jumped into the map. ", 'Amazing school, teachers are very caring and friendly. I personally enjoy the enthusiasm that employees have here. They are always willing to lend a hand and grasp it tight so that you are able to obtain the grades you deserve.', "It's a pretty good school the teachers are lovely, and it's a really diverse school. The school offers a good amount of sports and it's like finding a second family when you join a team. I say this because I'm the first girl in my soccer team to be in the team 4 years, the amount of years the team has been playing. ", 'Throughout the years studying in this school I have learned a lot by the teachers. The teachers that I have encountered were always respectful and nice. Teachers and staff will always tells us that their goal is to help us be successful in life. But some things I hope they will change in this school after I graduate is being able to get more AP classes for the upcoming generation to help them get a stronger academically. Also I hope they fix their schedule situation by letting the students choose how they want their classes to be sorted and how many classes they may want to participate. But overall it was a good experience in this school.', 'I enjoyed the afterschool programs that I took a part of there. Whenever you needed help academically they would be there to help, and were well with helping a senior decide what college to go to. ', 'The academic work at Sunset Park is not hard but it does take time and effort. The curriculum is well established and is reasonable with the teaching standards.', 'There is a relative low diversity in the school having the majority of the population hispanic or latino. There is relative low competition, but the on e there is is very challenging with the people involved.', 'There is an ample amount of extracurriculars in the school that are available from Monday through Friday, there is an affiliation in our school with Center of Family Life we are able to use them as resources.', 'At Sunset Park I am able to experience the different culture, during the school year we are able to come together and bring food from our heritage and experience different food and music.', 'The teachers at my school are respectful, approachable and always looking for a way to help you in anyway possible to help you succeed. Their teaching methods are effective and engaging.', "The policies id health and safety are pretty great in the school we have security guard everywhere protecting the building and constantly asking us to go class also ID's where required always in order for yo parents to pick you up and the nurse office was always there to help you out or give you advice", 'The extracurricular opportunities at this school are the best one is for example vocal troupe where each year we participated in the Life line show and helped us to meet others in the group who loved to sing other programs were also step up which prepared seniors for college expereince', "My four years in this high school were the best it's here where I grew as a person thanks to the programs they had each year for upcoming freshmen to seniors for example this last year I was involved with this club/group step up that helped us a lot to be prepared for our college experience we had trips to colleges that helped us have a better understanding of what we wanted to do .", 'The teachers in Sunset Park High School have a fun way to teach , for example in each class for example government/Economics we tended to do projects for us to have a  better understanding of what we were learning .', "Overall, it is generally safe. There are deans and security officers patrolling the hallways during classes. I have almost never felt unsafe in this school. There are fights that happen but not too often (but seriously, what high school doesn't have fights?)", 'There are plenty of clubs to join among them being LGBT Club, Art troupe, Dance troupe, Music club, Debate Team and many more!\r There are AP courses available such as AP Spanish & AP Computer Science Principles (which I highly recommend) with more to be added in Fall 2016\r There are sports played at the professional level (PSAL) including Basketball, Volleyball, Badminton, Softball, Soccer, Baseball, Wrestiling']

column2: ['Coming from a Public school to a Charter School Great Oaks Legacy Charter School took time for me to get use to.Great Oaks has a helpful system in order to help students with struggles as well as their academics.Great Oaks has helped me as a student from freshman year to my now senior year become more consistent with academics.', 'I love how the school is a second family to me. The Teachers do this best to teach the classes and get to know the students strength and weakness.', 'what i like about great oaks was that they care about your education and really want to see you succeed in life. but when it comes to safety and discipline they lack in it.', "Overall, this high school could do better with the tutors they let in. Most of the tutors I met in this school didn't want to do their jobs. Some of them just sat there; while on their phones, and didn't want to help the students. Others; however, were always there to help.In terms of health, our food was spoiled; milk for example. It had a funny taste, and sometimes you could find a hair or two in it. There were times when the food was great but it still made people sick.I'm terms of nurses, our nurse was not caring. Going to her office; she yelled at you, didn't want to give you medication, and gave you an attitude. Teachers. The only category that was good. Our teachers care about their students and work hard to teach us everything necessary.Students face bullying by their classmates but isn't taken seriously by the administration.I would like to see this school improve in their academic support, food services, health care, and take bullying and discrimination seriously.", 'Great Oaks Legacy Charter School have the majority or the minority in their school but still refuse to relate to us. Unfortunately, the expectation that we all have to go to college is so high that it takes the fun out of it. This school definitely doesn’t prepare students for college or the real world. Some of the administration have inappropriate relationships with students that cannot be spoken about. The rules definitely do not apply to every student because there is constantly favoritism. Let’s not speak about how someone got shot outside the school and failed to notify parents of the situation. This school needs to do a lot better and it needs to start by having equality and better expectations of students. Not everyone wants to go to college, so prepare them for their next step.', 'What I like about Great Oaks Legacy Charter School is that they always push and encourage you to put forward your best effort.', "Something i like about Great oaks is how involved your teachers are in trying to push you for college readiness and to push you beyond your limits.  Yet on the flip-side one thing i don't like is how overly strict the school is. For instance you can get a cellphone referral for having your headphones showing or for wearing some sneakers with a few accents.", "When i first came to  Great Oaks i didn't know what to expect as a student. Coming from my previous school i thought it would be the same experience both academically and behaviorally. I attended Great Oaks Charter School for about eight years now and all i can is that they have exceeded my expectations until this day.  Since my first day of attending Great Oaks school they have provided me strong academics and college readiness skills which has caused me to not grow just as an individual but as a whole. They've pushed me since day one to be the best version of myself which i believe i have exceeded.", 'I like the tutoring system which allowed students to have easy access to help with homework or even school work that became challenging. The only thing I would like to see change is the sports focus of the school. I feel as though there should be more sports and activities available.', 'My experience at this school is wonderful. It is a great environment where every student is given the best opportunity to excel in their classes. The administrators and staff are great and the overall school environment is welcoming.', "My experience with great oats is nothing  but love and joy,the teachers  keep you up dated with my child's work.", 'A lot of students have complained about this school but from my first year here it’s been pretty good. The teachers can be strict at times but they’re pretty good at teaching. I can admit that I have learned a lot from this school academically. As far as the food, it could be better but it’s not that bad especially when you’re very hungry.', 'bad.all bad. and some illegal. there are almost no redeeming qualities about these schools . Only positive would be the tutors that struggle through because they have a concern about the student that the administration does not.', 'My experience with this institution was a brief one but in that space of time they exhibited the willingness to help students of all educational backgrounds learn effectively at their own pace.', 'I like the amount of diversity the school has and how they want all their students to succeed. But, the school is pretty strict as well as their "Points system" which involves negative and positive points. Which I believe is unnecessary for a high school and especially for high school students.', "Overall its basically the same academics as any school , just not that much space to fulfill those academics you'd rather do instead.", "There's not that many of the e.c that you would want to have", 'The school is very pressuring  when it comes down to school work and being a "good scholar", but overall it is a decent school.', "Majority of the staff are helpful and want to help those who need it the most, but some of the staff don't understand how to properly approach a student who may have emotional distress occurring, so it leads them to pushing them out of their class or session instead of personally allowing the student to express or walk out their problems.", 'This school will have you ready academically by the time you go to college.']
