Let’s not speak about how someone got shot outside the school and failed to notify parents of the situation. This school needs to do a lot better and it needs to start by having equality and better expectations of students. Not everyone wants to go to college, so prepare them for their next step.', 'What I like about Great Oaks Legacy Charter School is that they always push and encourage you to put forward your best effort.', "Something i like about Great oaks is how involved your teachers are in trying to push you for college readiness and to push you beyond your limits.  Yet on the flip-side one thing i don't like is how overly strict the school is. For instance you can get a cellphone referral for having your headphones showing or for wearing some sneakers with a few accents.", "When i first came to  Great Oaks i didn't know what to expect as a student. Coming from my previous school i thought it would be the same experience both academically and behaviorally. I attended Great Oaks Charter School for about eight years now and all i can is that they have exceeded my expectations until this day.  Since my first day of attending Great Oaks school they have provided me strong academics and college readiness skills which has caused me to not grow just as an individual but as a whole. They've pushed me since day one to be the best version of myself which i believe i have exceeded.", 'I like the tutoring system which allowed students to have easy access to help with homework or even school work that became challenging. The only thing I would like to see change is the sports focus of the school. I feel as though there should be more sports and activities available.', 'My experience at this school is wonderful. It is a great environment where every student is given the best opportunity to excel in their classes. The administrators and staff are great and the overall school environment is welcoming.', "My experience with great oats is nothing  but love and joy,the teachers  keep you up dated with my child's work.", 'A lot of students have complained about this school but from my first year here it’s been pretty good. The teachers can be strict at times but they’re pretty good at teaching. I can admit that I have learned a lot from this school academically. As far as the food, it could be better but it’s not that bad especially when you’re very hungry.', 'bad.all bad. and some illegal. there are almost no redeeming qualities about these schools . Only positive would be the tutors that struggle through because they have a concern about the student that the administration does not.', 'My experience with this institution was a brief one but in that space of time they exhibited the willingness to help students of all educational backgrounds learn effectively at their own pace.', 'I like the amount of diversity the school has and how they want all their students to succeed. But, the school is pretty strict as well as their "Points system" which involves negative and positive points. Which I believe is unnecessary for a high school and especially for high school students.', "Overall its basically the same academics as any school , just not that much space to fulfill those academics you'd rather do instead.", "There's not that many of the e.c that you would want to have", 'The school is very pressuring  when it comes down to school work and being a "good scholar", but overall it is a decent school.', "Majority of the staff are helpful and want to help those who need it the most, but some of the staff don't understand how to properly approach a student who may have emotional distress occurring, so it leads them to pushing them out of their class or session instead of personally allowing the student to express or walk out their problems.", 'This school will have you ready academically by the time you go to college.']

column1: Young Women's Leadership School of Brooklyn
column2: ["I absolutely recommend this school!. From the festivities to the AP classes the school provides, and the friendly environment one can be in, I definitely wish many other young ladies would be interested to spend their adolescent learning years here. You will have a blast and won't regret a moment at TYWLS. We are diverse and you will find your place to fit in. There are several clubs you can get involved in during your middle and high school years because here you will discover your inner passions and be prepared for your way to college.", "TYWLS is for students in the neighborhood who strictly academic based careers, there's a large cultural background and a LGBTQ+ community, but not a lot of group activities to participate in, nor many extracurricular clubs. The teachers are exceptionable, but sometimes unorganized. Not a lot of trips are planned, and when they are, it costs money for the students to attend.", "I've been attending this school since 6th grade and now I'm a graduating senior. They have a good college program called CBI that works with every grade at some point. Sports isn't the best, but they are slowly coming. Right now we are PSAL with a track team. Every school has its flaws, but remember that TYWLS is still pretty new. 2018 makes it 10 years since it has opened. Try it and if it doesn't match your fit factors then transfer out.", 'The school is very involved in making sure students have the opportunities to succeed. Preparing us to be independent, go to college and plan a good future for ourselves.', "This all-girls school is very different from other schools. The small population size makes it easier to create a community and get to know one another. This is crucial because of the fact that it's a 6-12 school, so it encourages younger scholars to mingle and ask questions on what to expect when moving on to high school. Not only are the younger students supported by the older students, but also the older students are supported by the teachers who push for college ready scores. The school has limited space, but does well with making ALOT of clubs and making space for newer ones as well. From its top class dance studio to the prestigious science lab, it has something for everyone. Although, to be honest the shared building with the elementary school is the only thing that troubles me. I feel that if only this school had its own building it would be able to thrive even more. But with the good must come the bad so it's acceptable.", 'Young Women’s Leadership School of Brooklyn was a safe and wonderful foundation for me to prepare for college. If I needed help my teachers were always ready to help and compromise with me.', "Attending The Young Women's Leadership School of Brooklyn has impacted my life in so many ways . From attending this school I have learned that it's ok to be a women who's intellectual and who knows what they want in life. TYWLS of Brooklyn also offers help with work whenever it is needed and never shys away from trying to help students more especially in academics.They also have a wonderful Dance Ensemble  program (which I am apart of) that help show the diversity in the school through dance. Also everyone is so supportive  and you really become like a little family with everyone in the school and like family not all days are perfect with them, but you love them because they're  there for you.", 'TYWLS of Brooklyn is a great school. They have a few setbacks such as their lack of sports and club and activities. However, they really prepare students for college. They introduce college as early in 6th grade. They really want kids to be prepared for college.', 'hat the high school is for girls to learn and success to college.It help education and opportunies to take course that can help girl in college and able to go the understanding of going to college, able to reach the top college.The changes is able to have Ap courses before going to college and a college counselor to help us Financal aid and apply for sat and act also sholarships.', 'The school is a really good school. They begin making the students college ready starting from 6 grade. The teachers are always there if you need help academically or personally, and are really close to the students. A lot of the girls get kind of thrown off at the fact it is an all girl school and might be uncomfortable because there are no boys but, once you start getting used to it, you can actually see the school for what it actually it.', "As a young hispanic female, coming into an all girls school, I had these crazy bizarre thoughts that it would be weird and not beneficial because it just wasn't normal. However experiencing these last three years I've come to find and know myself. I'm this crazy new person that is awesome, because of joining the Environmental club and being able to join these challenging AP courses. I like coming into school feeling like I know everyone (even if I don't), no one was more or less, everyone is equal. And that's what this school is about, empowering women, because women are empowering, and because women deserve to be equal as men. Thankyou TYWLS of Brooklyn!", 'I really enjoyed my time at Tywls and I plan to make the rest of it great. They push you to work hard and do your best and motivate you to challenge yourself and go beyond your comfort zone. My sisters here at TYWLS they are very loving and supporting and want the best for you. The teachers do everything in they can to make sure the students have all the materials and ensure that needs are fulfilled.', 'This school has five AP classes for 11th and 12th graders, but an essay is required.', "The assistant principle was pretty caring. When I got sick one time and I couldn't go back upstairs, Ms. Jacobs came down to help me. The high school guidance counselor is very generous. She is willing to have a office open throughout lunchtime so students can heat up their food. She also enjoys getting help from other students when it comes to planning trips.", "I really enjoyed participating in the guitar concert that was held for two years at the school. My music teacher really pushed me to perform. He would give me advice on how to pretend that the audience was not there so that I won't be nervous.", "Certain teachers are really engaged with their students. My statistics teachers liked to share her story on how she moved to America to teach math. She seemed like she really wanted her students to have sympathy for her. My economics teacher on the other hand needed to get more a back bone. Every now and then he would still let the girls in the back of the classroom chatter while he would try to teach the lesson. Stopping the class didn't help, he was afraid to throw them out.", 'The popular classes are physical education, journalism and career and exploration. The teachers that teach these topics are very calm and talkative. Talkative in a good way meaning that they get into depth on what they want the students to do in order to do it right.', 'The worst thing about my school would be the bathrooms and the fountains. The fountains have stains from when kids place substances on it and the bathrooms tend to smell occasionally. But, the school has two security guards that we located on the first floor at the front desk.  The security guards notify students parents as well as guest that are entering the building that they need there IDs or social to continue into the building. I feel very safe with that policy.', "I attended extracurricular activities during, my time with SASF in my school. It was fun especially when they allowed students to attend trips that involved students such as myself to be competitive and outgoing. But, I'm a senior now so my school doesn't allow me to attend SASF due to my school not receiving a lot of funding so seniors barely are given the chance to do extracurricular activities.", "At this very moment, I'm going through my college process and gathering information about the school that I'm attending. My teachers and I have been going through times that brought stress, anger and utter sadness due to everything piling up. The teachers that I confide in have ensure that I will make it and that they are here for me whenever I need them."]

column1: Hudson High School of Learning Technologies
column2: ['My school added more AP classes for students to take. They recently add college classes such as Calculus. They have different clubs you can join. We share the building with six schools so, some of the sports have members from different schools in the building. However, I wish they would have a more flexible and convenient schedule. The whole school basically follow the same schedule. They force you to take unnecessary classes. I also wish the education would be more challenging. I didn’t really get a lot of homework and essays to write. A lot of the teachers are told to teach subjects that they never taught before.', 'Some of the teachers are willing to help you move on for a better future. Some things I didn’t like is that most students have a fixed mindset which makes the school have negative look since most are failing, or dropping out, which we need classes that could them improve on their academics, for example, SAT prep, or mentoring class. I want teachers to push everyone not only those who are doing good since everyone should have a chance to show they are able to improve. I want the school to stop forcing students to take AP classes if they want to do then they could it, otherwise no.', 'This is a very good school. The teachers care about their students. They have AP courses for students who want to challenge their themselves. They also prepare you for college during your freshman year by taking students to college trips. Hudson high school of learning technologies have electives which students get to choose their desire class which can help your GPA.', 'Hudson’s the best high school you can get in to,have the best teachers in there,they will motive you though anything you need help with.what I like about Hudson is that we half days every Wednesday and we have kickboxing class and also lot of ap class to get you prepaid for collage .', 'What I like about Hudson High School of Learning Technologies is there are great teachers and they want to see you succeed. The teachers help in any way they can to make sure you understand what’s going on. Something that can change is the rules. I feel that the higher class people are too lenient with the rules. Sometimes the students get too out of control for the teachers and the work/lesson will not get done like it is supposed to.', 'One of the most understanding schools in the East Coast. Friendly students that are open to all perspectives. Lots of programs and internships available for all career paths. Teachers are one of the most supportive people around you.', 'Hudson highschool of Learning technologies is a very welcoming school. Opening its doors at 7:45 students who need extra help with work or wish to know or help their teachers can before the first period starts. Hudson offers a wide variety of programs and contsantly push their studentsz to work and try their hardest.', 'it is a fun  experience, you get to learn alot of new things and the school is generaly a good and fun experience', 'Based on my experience, I like the fact that the school has an elective class in which you get to choose a class of your choice and interest. I feel like that is important because students have the choice to have a class of their own choice that they like and enjoy. Changes I like to see is that the school should offer more AP classes for students.', 'I think for it being a school that was only two years old when I joined there is so much more that can be done within the school, it has the potential to become something great.', 'The teachers engage all students in the lessons they go above and beyond', 'Parents are barely involved with the school.', 'Not very challenging but very nice teachers.', 'The Nurse is very busy since it is a School Building Wide Clinic', 'My Favorite Extracirricular in Hudson is Hudson Guild, Hudson Guild is An Performing Arts Afterschool for young actors and Actresses. I have been in Two Hudson Plays and I loved it. The Commitment and time is very hard but Everything is worth it in the End .', "My Favorite Experience in Hudson Has been Hudson Abroad and The Travel Club. Through the success of Ms.Hargrave and findings and Donations and many more, We were able to go to Paris and Barcelona for Half The Price While learning new languages and cultures, how to save , and real world planning like Trips and Go Fund Me Accounts. That has been my favorite and enforgetable experience in my School Years and I can't Thank Hudson for the opportunity I had.", "The Teachers At Hudson HSLT Are very causal and understanding. Everyone is very knowledgable and understand technology so it's not like a young old fashioned school where few teachers do not know how to work laptops or anything. Many of the teachers are very understanding and you can always go to them when you have a problem or need advice or help in something. Hudson Staff is very Different and Out going and Optimistic.", "The school safety staff are everywhere, ready for anything coming their way.  The safety in my school is great, I can't speak for the rest of the schools located in the school campus. As far as I know,  the nurse is always available to anyone.", 'The school offers a lot of clubs/organizations. The school has a robotics club, chess club, dance, theater, our house,  the dream team/the future project,  we the change, comic book club, national honors society, etc.', "In this school it is very easy to create long lasting friendships regardless of age, race, etc. I can say I get along with a lot of students from different grades. I've always spent more time in school then I should since tenth grade.  I've become involved in more school activities since my past schools. The school is like a huge family,  I mean it's a small school and you end up recognizing everyone's face by like the 3rd month after school starts."]

Many of the teachers are very understanding and you can always go to them when you have a problem or need advice or help in something. Hudson Staff is very Different and Out going and Optimistic.", "The school safety staff are everywhere, ready for anything coming their way.  The safety in my school is great, I can't speak for the rest of the schools located in the school campus. As far as I know,  the nurse is always available to anyone.", 'The school offers a lot of clubs/organizations. The school has a robotics club, chess club, dance, theater, our house,  the dream team/the future project,  we the change, comic book club, national honors society, etc.', "In this school it is very easy to create long lasting friendships regardless of age, race, etc. I can say I get along with a lot of students from different grades. I've always spent more time in school then I should since tenth grade.  I've become involved in more school activities since my past schools. The school is like a huge family,  I mean it's a small school and you end up recognizing everyone's face by like the 3rd month after school starts."]

column2: ['I really like my school and this school help me with everything. The teachers are nice and I am close with my teachers and they help me with anything when I ask them, and they are happy to help me.', "Something I like about Lincoln High School is how comfortable all the teachers and staff made me feel coming to this school. Every teacher I've had has helped me in every way possible. It was either to pass my regents or helped me with my college stuff. The only thing I would like to see change is the food.", 'I wouldn’t like to change anything, I like the vibes when you come in, how the administrators treat you & how the students  safety is their priority and they also have Very good teachers.', 'Lincoln is filled with opportunities and is a great experience. If anyone come to this school you will feel welcomed', 'I like how the ninth grade teachers are dedicated to their students and helping them achieve. I wish I had this consistency as I continued on throughout my high school experience. I often time felt neglected by my teachers and didn’t really receive any challenging work.', 'It was a decent high school. Not much activities to be involved in. The teachers were amazing and definitely help guide the students. I graduated in 2010 so I am not sure if the school has changed since then.', 'It was a nice school in general, but the administration needs work. Little to no parent involvement. 3 people in the PTA.', "Lincoln High gave so many opportunities I couldn't miss out on. Their best known for the Business Academy and the Scientific research program. Winning first place and running up in multiple competitions.Great school!!", 'Lincoln High School is not the best school for your child. The education that I received here was subpar. Rarely, you will find teachers who actually care for your child. But I can positively say that not all of the teachers will waste your child’s talents. There are maybe four or five teachers that I had who inspired me to learn and take advantage of resources outside of the school, which have been very useful in increasing my level of college readiness. So, take a chance on this school only if you must, but just let your child know that with any opportunity that they receive—whether it’s high or low quality—they need to work hard to prove themselves. Lincoln High School will not challenge your child much, but they can always challenge themselves to learn beyond classroom material and make themselves stand out on college applications.', 'Lincoln high School is a very good school with a lot diversity and he also give you everything.  Everything you need to finish your high school year or to intended college. They also have a lot  of intersting activities known as football baseball and others good stuff.', 'The teachers really care about students and preparing us for the future. I really love the Accounting class because it teaches you how to save money and how to invest it.', 'I’m a student at Lincoln High school and since I’ve been attending every year the academics and everything has change so much better.', 'My experiences with Lincoln High School was tremendously outstanding. Throughout my 4 years of being in that school I’ve had have nothing but success. The teachers and staff are the most helpful people out there and does nothing but stay on top of you to make sure you’re doing right. They are also very helpful with the college process. Although it is a difficult time for us, the administration and guidance counselor make it a easy and stress free process.', "Not the best school ever. My sisters attended this school and I volunteered there. I'm not sure how good is this school compared to YPS but I give it 2 stars", 'My experience here was awesome, is a school full of environment happiness and great thankful people .', "I like how Lincoln High School sets up the different grade levels with vice presidents. There's always a staff member willing to help you out. I also love how the teachers stay on top of you to finish important work for the marking period to pass. The school highly expresses the importance of having all your regents done, so you can graduate on time.", "this school makes me want to die. the staff is awful and the students are even worse. they're tacky and irritating. we have about 3 whole sports in this school and they arent great. our coaches are lazy and make us play volleyball with an old ripped up ball, then proceed to fail you when you decide that you want to play. the bathrooms smell like a sewer and sometimes the toilet water is so hot it burns my skin. the mirrors are foggy and i cant even see myself in them. for lunch one day, we had tuna and brown soggy lettuce with animal crackers on top. starving everyday isnt something i want to do but in fact its something i have to do. our teachers are awful and even if youre in ap they dont act like it. they give you do nows just to waste time and i leave class usually learning NOTHING!!!!!!!!! to conclude, i would rather be uneducated than to have to ever step foot in lincoln again", 'The school is located in a great area. The administration is super helpful and want to see all their students succeed. ', "They're teachers who do care about the students and their well beings but they're teacher who don't care about our education.", 'The academics programs are very test driven. We are often taught only what we need to know for the test.']

column6: ['The student culture is pretty easy going. However it is just as insecure and drama filled as any other high school.', 'School is pretty safe with a few problems here and there.', "Extracurricular share there but there isn't a lot of money available for them to do much.", "My overall experience was good. Although there wasn't a lot of money to get things that the school needed.", 'Most teachers do genuinely car about the students they teach but more often than not they only teach what the student needs to know to pass the test.', 'The teachers really go above and beyond to assure the education of their students.', 'There is little to no peer pressure, very avoidable when there is. There are no issues or challenges in ethnicity/racial diversity, as everyone in this school is opened to every and all cultures.', 'Every security guard is up-to-date with everyday activites and assures the safety of students and faculty in the school.', 'Sports activites that anyone is more than welcome to participate, yearbook committee, and activities that fall under your program (such as choir for those in the arts program).', 'Some of my favorite experiences were those during soccer season. I found myself making friendships that have lasted till this day, and I know will last a lifetime as well. I also knew I can rely on my teachers to help me out with homework or labs during the weekends.', 'The teachers at Lincoln High School really dedicate their time to their students and put their all their interest into making sure they get the best education they possibly can, by making themselves available outside out their classroom hours, and even on weekends.', 'I feel very safe during the school day', 'Its a very helpful schools', "There are many extracurricular activity opportunities at Lincoln. From Softball,  Baseball,  Football, The Key Club, and the Choir to the African American Club and Latino America no Club. Lincoln is good at accommodating it's diversity. These clubs and sport have been up and running for a long time and have always been successful", "Lincoln has made me a very outspoken person. My favorite experience was my chemistry class, I never even liked science before that. My school has many unique things about it like Cafe D'Artist. These shows on the Thursday's of every month are like a breath of fresh air. It's a time to sit back and acknowledge the raw talent within the students.", 'Lincoln high school is a very safe and fun learning environment. I love Lincoln because it has a special environment for every personality possible. With different teachers from different countries and cultures,  no one feels left out. Our unique celebrations like International Night give people  like me a chance to express themselves.', 'health and safety policies are very good', 'anyone and everyone can be apart of after school activities', 'all the parents care about their kids and their friends also', "the teachers are available at all time to help you out with homework's"]

column2: ['As a high school senior at Dreamyard Preparatory High School, I really admit that this school is a one of the great art schools in the Bronx. Throughout my  entire high school year, I gained a lot of experience such as communications skills and the ability to be independent. One thing I admire about this school is that it really encourages individuals and students to be able to express their thoughts and be open minded as possible. I honestly think this school is a great fit for any individual who is trying to broaden their skills and be successful.', 'What i like the most about Dream yard, is the diversity and the different backgrounds that staff, teacher, faculties and students bring to the environment.', 'I believe that DreamYard is an amazing school for students who want to find themselves and explore more about their likes and dislikes. For instance, if you’re an artist or interested in art, whether it’s dance, theater, music or visual art, students would learn to excel in each category, due to the fun loving and extremely experienced teacher. However, if you’re interested in things non- art related, there are clubs that are student driven, such as Anime Club, Mouse Squad,  Bowling Club, Video Club, Cheerleading clubs and much more.  This school is mainly into arts, but many of the clubs mentioned are very inclusive. Although, when it comes to the academic side, there are many classes with supportive teachers who push you every day to do your best.  Also, we now have AP FOR ALL!!  Therefore, this would be the perfect school for anyone who wants to access their creativity side and take rigorous courses to be LIFE- READY!!', 'My Experience in Dreamyard wasn’t the best but they are very supportive. If your really into Art Dreamyard is the best choice.', 'I like how the community feels very close and how the teachers build a close relationship with students in order to know how to help them get better. There is also no separation between grades, so everyone socializes with everyone. One thing I would like to see change is a cleaner space, like the bathrooms.', 'Dreamyard Preparatory School is an amazing high school located in Bronx, NY. Dreamyard is a performing arts school that exposes theater, musical theater, dance, art and music to its students. They have annual plays that are exceptional, moving and wonderful. Last year was The Lion King and I heard that for the 2017 year it would be Rent. Overall it is a wonderful school that has a very supporitive environment and I would reccomend this school to anyone who wants to learn in a judge free zone.', "Dreamyard at first was annoying I didn't like it but as time went on I met some amazing people and friends. Dreamyard is the school to go to.", "Dreamyard Prep is a great school that has many opportunities. I am currently a High School senior at this school and the teachers and students here have made me feel like i'm apart of a family. I really love the way the curriculum is taught at this school. When I graduate, I know I'm going to be prepared for college.", "There's a ton of different clubs and if you don't like any of them. You can create your own.", 'It was the four years of my life! I freaking loved this high school!', 'Dreamyard Prepatory high school is very safe. We even include our security agents in school wide community building events, we a truly here to learn from each other.', 'Dreamyard Preparory School allows the opportunity for students to create different clubs that may not be available. For example, I participate in Book Club, Mouse Squad, and even had an Mosic Club that the students started. Ofcourse there are more but these are the clubs I know most.', 'Dreamyard Prepatory School is a community, with around 300 students everyone knows each other. My favorite experiences include opportunist to build my community and learn Fordom each other. If I could do it again, I would definitely pick Dreamyard.', "The teachers at this school go above and beyond what is asked if them. I'm not saying they hold students hands but they guid them in a way that the students can start to learn for themselves. For example, teachers stay after school to answer questions the students may be struggling with. They also are very active in helping students start clubs or after school actives that may be given. It's a place where you can grow without feeling like your doing it alone.", 'It is very challenging because some students believes that they dont fit in the school because of their culture', 'The academics is good.Everyone comes on time to study', 'The school was very small when I started and I was able to get to know everyone, and the professors, on a personal level.', "At the time I went to Dreamyard, the school was still developing. I don't know how much it has improved now, but when I started there was a lack of courses such as chemistry, geometry and other courses that typical high school students take.", 'My school is very safe due to the security cameras that they have at school', 'Dance\r Art \r Music\r Theater Design\r Students are highly committed']

column2: ['As a student who attended John Adams High School, I had a great journey from freshman to senior year. When I first started attending I had the constant assistance of counselors and teachers. They provided me with such great advice that it helped pave an excellent academic path for the upcoming years. I was also advised to participate in extracurriculars, not just make my college applications more competitive but also to improve my experience at school. The sports and other extracurriculars helped me become a better person socially and deal with a wide range of problems that eventually helped me mature and set myself right for my future. I came into John Adams as a boy and left as an educated young man.', 'This school is rrally bad. The STEM program is by far the worst one yet. All the teachers are bad at doing their job and they have no respect for one another', 'The teachers are friendly and will help you with any school work even if you are not their student. The school also helps you prepare for college.', "It's alright, but it gets very boring. Add a better weight room, clean the bathrooms, and update the locker rooms", 'It has all the resources which a student needs to succeed. The faculties are very very friendly and helpful. The school offers a lot of SAT prep-classes and CollegePrep classes. It also offers CollegeNow classes through which students can gain college credits while studying in high-school for FREE!', "The one thing I love most about John Adams High School is that they have the Air Force JROTC program. It's a program that helps young students at an early age to develop leadership skills and improve their character. After I joined the program, I was able to improve in my academics and go from a 75 to an 86 average student. In addition, I became part of the National Honors Society and the JROTC program helped me improve my leadership skills by getting involved in community service and participate in color guard ceremonies.", 'They have all the stuff to help a student. For example, the college now, after-school program, sports team, all good and helpful teacher. They are also friendly. Good counselor and assistant principle.', 'John Adams has a long way to go, but if students and teachers can collaborate they most definitely have the ability to create an amazing school. Disrespect and drugs are a problem in the school. The school is mostly made of minorities and is incredibly diverse. Clubs, activities, tutoring and events are frequent in the school. Despite common hostilities or apathy, it is very common to see students and teachers helping each other out. There are special people there.', 'I believe John Adams High School can be a place of greater learning IF you are able to be a proper student. The children make the school and the school make the children. John Adams provides incredible tools to help students from all walks of life.', "Honestly, i have a great experience in JAHS.Because,over there i met tons of people and it was like great diversity.People from different countries come all together and discussed about the issues of global economy. Then, i also work with many groups.For example:Global Kids,Liberty partnership program,fusion club and many others.I and many other people on global kids discussed about globalization,global warming and variety of different topics.Then, on LPP we work on the college prep,SAT prep and many other things.Then i also so artwork on the fusion Club.Then,i'm also in the newspaper Club.I talk about the various topics to discussed on and come up with a solution.", 'I like the programs they have with eight different small learning communities. They have ib which is international baccalaureate which is combined with two SLC they are STEM and Pre-med. Also they have many different sports teams and clubs.', "Overall, my experience attending John Adams high school was okay. There are some areas that the school has to work on as a staff, and as a community. I would start off by saying that John Adams high school, has amazing programs such which would help students in their college career. Their programs are very college based, which a lot of New York City high schools don't have. Which gave the school some positive aspects , but with that comes room for growth. Some things  that they need to work on, is security walking in the doors in the morning felt like a prison. They had so much of airport security and didn't feel like a school. Another issue they need to work is the faculty. I think the faculty is too focused on the statistics of the school, and not students which I feel there isn't a community in the school. One last thing would say that would make John Adams a better high school, is to have a community forum, with the students, teachers, and parents.", 'Teachers there are willing to help you no matter what the situation is. Everyone seems to help and the students are kind too.', 'The school have very interesting programs and the teachers are always there to help. The environment is ok but the most good thing about the school is their IB programs and the after school programs like Global Kids.', 'At John Adams High School, I learned a lot of things, whether it was a quadratic formula in Algebra II or how to splice a sentence in English class, but the most important thing I learned was the importance in being different. This school taught me that the color of my skin was an asset, and helped me succeed to be the successful Asian-American man I am today.', 'John Adams High School has such a diverse community. Being apart of that community makes me feel at home. John Adams is one big family, and we support each other in every way. Staff and teachers make sure we are doing what we need to do to graduate. They lead us in the right path to success. Being apart of John Adams has taught me that anything can be achieved by hard work and determination.', 'I like how our teachers really have a grasp on what they are teaching. So they know their strengths and weaknesses. Though I wish our teachers would consider our abilities with their own teachings.', 'I like that the school has a wide diversity. One thing that needs to change is teachers giving more encouragement to their students.', "John Adams is an excellent high school for those who are driven to learn and succeed in life. It gives us a way to learn and give us knowledge,providing a way for us to be a diligent in the real world. They provide students many programs to join in that gives us a certain interest. Most of the programs prepares us for college which is the next stage of becoming closer to our careers. Throughout my experience in this school, I would have to say i changed a lot throughout the years. I've become more dedicated to my work and more responsible towards everything I do. Overall, this high school so far has given me the best experiences that i couldn't ever imagine.", 'John Adams High School is excellent high school. It prepares students for college. It gives real-life situations to deal with. Many opportunities for students to prepare for upcoming exams, regents, SAT, etc']

It also offers CollegeNow classes through which students can gain college credits while studying in high-school for FREE!', "The one thing I love most about John Adams High School is that they have the Air Force JROTC program. It's a program that helps young students at an early age to develop leadership skills and improve their character. After I joined the program, I was able to improve in my academics and go from a 75 to an 86 average student. In addition, I became part of the National Honors Society and the JROTC program helped me improve my leadership skills by getting involved in community service and participate in color guard ceremonies.", 'They have all the stuff to help a student. For example, the college now, after-school program, sports team, all good and helpful teacher. They are also friendly. Good counselor and assistant principle.', 'John Adams has a long way to go, but if students and teachers can collaborate they most definitely have the ability to create an amazing school. Disrespect and drugs are a problem in the school. The school is mostly made of minorities and is incredibly diverse. Clubs, activities, tutoring and events are frequent in the school. Despite common hostilities or apathy, it is very common to see students and teachers helping each other out. There are special people there.', 'I believe John Adams High School can be a place of greater learning IF you are able to be a proper student. The children make the school and the school make the children. John Adams provides incredible tools to help students from all walks of life.', "Honestly, i have a great experience in JAHS.Because,over there i met tons of people and it was like great diversity.People from different countries come all together and discussed about the issues of global economy. Then, i also work with many groups.For example:Global Kids,Liberty partnership program,fusion club and many others.I and many other people on global kids discussed about globalization,global warming and variety of different topics.Then, on LPP we work on the college prep,SAT prep and many other things.Then i also so artwork on the fusion Club.Then,i'm also in the newspaper Club.I talk about the various topics to discussed on and come up with a solution.", 'I like the programs they have with eight different small learning communities. They have ib which is international baccalaureate which is combined with two SLC they are STEM and Pre-med. Also they have many different sports teams and clubs.', "Overall, my experience attending John Adams high school was okay. There are some areas that the school has to work on as a staff, and as a community. I would start off by saying that John Adams high school, has amazing programs such which would help students in their college career. Their programs are very college based, which a lot of New York City high schools don't have. Which gave the school some positive aspects , but with that comes room for growth. Some things  that they need to work on, is security walking in the doors in the morning felt like a prison. They had so much of airport security and didn't feel like a school. Another issue they need to work is the faculty. I think the faculty is too focused on the statistics of the school, and not students which I feel there isn't a community in the school. One last thing would say that would make John Adams a better high school, is to have a community forum, with the students, teachers, and parents.", 'Teachers there are willing to help you no matter what the situation is. Everyone seems to help and the students are kind too.', 'The school have very interesting programs and the teachers are always there to help. The environment is ok but the most good thing about the school is their IB programs and the after school programs like Global Kids.', 'At John Adams High School, I learned a lot of things, whether it was a quadratic formula in Algebra II or how to splice a sentence in English class, but the most important thing I learned was the importance in being different. This school taught me that the color of my skin was an asset, and helped me succeed to be the successful Asian-American man I am today.', 'John Adams High School has such a diverse community. Being apart of that community makes me feel at home. John Adams is one big family, and we support each other in every way. Staff and teachers make sure we are doing what we need to do to graduate. They lead us in the right path to success. Being apart of John Adams has taught me that anything can be achieved by hard work and determination.', 'I like how our teachers really have a grasp on what they are teaching. So they know their strengths and weaknesses. Though I wish our teachers would consider our abilities with their own teachings.', 'I like that the school has a wide diversity. One thing that needs to change is teachers giving more encouragement to their students.', "John Adams is an excellent high school for those who are driven to learn and succeed in life. It gives us a way to learn and give us knowledge,providing a way for us to be a diligent in the real world. They provide students many programs to join in that gives us a certain interest. Most of the programs prepares us for college which is the next stage of becoming closer to our careers. Throughout my experience in this school, I would have to say i changed a lot throughout the years. I've become more dedicated to my work and more responsible towards everything I do. Overall, this high school so far has given me the best experiences that i couldn't ever imagine.", 'John Adams High School is excellent high school. It prepares students for college. It gives real-life situations to deal with. Many opportunities for students to prepare for upcoming exams, regents, SAT, etc']
column6: ["They have good extracurricular activities however not everyone knows about it because they don't announce them as they should", "Overall I've had a couple good times in the school, so I wouldn't say it's the worse but there were times when I wish I fm didn't go there because kids, teachers, or sometimes even security guards", "Some of the teachers can be caring, as you know in every school has at least a couple decent teachers. Other teaches make it clear they're just there to get paid & really don't care if you learn or not.", 'The teachers are able to control the class and get students to work and learn.', 'Very poor academics offered at this school.', "I don't think is a safe school at all. Poor system, school have no control over bullying and drugs.", 'I never ever will choose this school again.', 'There is no serious danger.', 'This school is very rich in culture.', "It's average except for the college now and AP classes.", 'This school raises many great athletes who may never get the recognized for their ability. Clubs and activities are underated.', "This school certainly isn't the best but it is improving. With more support this can be a great high school for all the talented and intelligent individuals it houses during school hours.", "Many teachers are good at their job, however they are forced to use methods by their departments that aren't quite effective. Most of the teachers know what their doing and can help you if needed.", 'Our school health services have everything available from ibuprofen to birth control', 'The students that are apart of a sports team or club take their membership seriously and are involved when it comes to their team or club.', 'i have to say that even though i really want to graduate from this school, i have had a lot of great memories that i would want to relive.', 'Most teachers at john adams have favorites and if you need a favor you need to be within their good graces to get it done.', 'There are so many extracurricular activities that it is hard to choose just one. There are so many clubs for all types of people and there are also many sports to choose from.', 'This school has some excellent classes and clubs.', 'Each teacher has a unique teaching style but they are all effective.']

column2: ["It was ok, it was really work intensive in most of the classes something I did not enjoy but did understood. I think more than ever newcomers can benefit from the program due to having more qualified teachers than when I was in 9th grade. I'm glad the school was improving year to year while i was studying.", 'This school is a good fit for recent young immigrants to become proficient in English. As an immigrant myself, I became proficient within a year of attending this high school.']

["Hyde Leadership Charter School offers AP Classes, diverse afterschool programs, and good Arts programs. The teachers in Hyde are very respectful and they really care about the students. They take everyone's learning situations into consideration.", 'It is a good school that helps you prepare for life after high school and actively pushes their students to attend college. It allows students to take hard classes while also giving them the tools and resources needed to succeed.', 'The high school is starting to feel like a public school. The freshman think they are grown and no one is taking control. As a senior, teachers help us with our college process.', 'Hyde Leadership Charter School has honestly been a life-changing experience for me. The small size of the school has its many pros and cons. For one, there is definitely a tight-knit community in Hyde. Students love to hang out with their teachers and talk to them during office hours or even during their lunch period. The opportunities are also abundant since it is a small school so it is easy to hear about these opportunities. In addition, the school facility is very clean compared to other schools in the South Bronx. It is a school that many students begin to appreciate over their four years there. I love being apart of the Hyde community and hope to come back to help my school succeed even more.', "I've been here since the fifth grade and I've had the best time. The academics are great and the teachers help and care for the students, unlike most schools. They take time out of their schedule to stay after school for any kid even if it is just one child. The food could be better, but the overall environment is airy and mutual.", 'I really dislike this school. The students are terrible. Teaching methods are terrible. My grades are terrible. I’m very lonely. I get bullied for my skin. But some people are pretty nice to me. The lunch is unrealistic. So please, do yourself a favor, and DONT come here. Plus it’s very hood and almost every child here (YES!!! including ELEMENTARY children) curse. So watch out and right now I’m in 8th grade and I hate this school and it’s a lot of work.', "Hyde Leadership Charter school is an extremely supportive and pro cultured school. Hyde Leadership is located in one of the poorest boroughs in New York City, but that has never stopped the school from taking into account every individual student's journey through life. For 12 years, this school successfully makes every accommodation within their jurisdiction, to make sure that every student is in the right place to pursue their education and prepare for their future. Hyde Leadership represents the impoverished children of color within my community, our school's culture is the pedestal for our voices to be heard in higher class societies. I would like to see my school spread their culture on an international level.", 'Hyde has really supportive teachers and a lot of resources to ensure that students are successful. Students are constantly pushed to be at their best in school and outside of school.', 'My overall experience at Hyde Leadership Charter School was a good one. I genuinly had help and support from the staff members when it came to applying to colleges and much more. I attended this school for 6 years and I would say that this school helped shape myself and other students.', 'Hyde Leadership Charter School’s mission is to develop the deeper character and unique potential of each student. I feel like it dose a great job doing that. Using the Hyde process of Family-Based Character Education.Hyde unites students, families, and teachers in helping each child achieve his or her best. They make sure that ever student can have a great future. I love how we are a community and we look out for each other and help each other. Hyde Leadership Charter school is an amazing school.', 'My experience at Hyde Leadership Charter School was enjoyable for the most part. I enjoyed going to school in the morning, greeting my teachers and administrators. I really enjoyed the leadership and community service opportunities provided to me through Hyde. This helped grow my leadership skills and made me a more outgoing student and person, willing to address injustices I encounter.', 'i have been in Hyde for 10 years and i think that Hyde has gotten worse but i think that it still hold it character but the food need to improve and there should be more sports introduce and languages to expose the student into new opportunities.', "I think Hyde is a very good school compared to the other schools in this area. The teachers are very helpful to the students and stay after school and during lunch to make sure they are doing well. The college office is very well organized and supportive and they make sure that we all go to college even if we don't know exactly what we want. They start college prep in junior year and everyone does it together so everyone goes to college together. The school is also very focused on character and students being good people and having the values like integrity, humility, leadership, curiousity and courage.", "I like how the school is oriented about building character and bonding families. It is a school that always challenges its students to be at their best and never give up. They have retreats where students and their families go to have fun and reflect on any issues they have and build a better relationship. I can't think of anything that I would like to be changed. The school is good overall I don't see any issues.", "Not good school. Terrible principalcelia sosa. I didn't learn anything. Waste of my time. It was unfair how they punish students and the teachers are blamed for the mistakes of others ", 'Great teachers. Safe environment. Children are willing to learn. They help with the College process and help find ways to assist you.', "My school believes in their student to have integrity every single day when they come to the building. That's why we don't have metal detectors or armed securities.", 'In my school there are many extracurricular opportunities for all their students, from dance club to many community service opportunities.', 'My school may be difficult, but it is becuase they believed in the unique potential of all their students.', 'The teachers in my school are all very outgoing and helpful when help is needed. They also are the tye of people that you could relate to.']

column6: ['The teachers in my school are very well educated and very helpful, but sometimes getting information across to students is a bit confusing.', 'At Hyde, one of the things the school is known for is its school meetings which are held weekly for all students in the high school and there we discuss topics like the ones stated above. In these meetings students engage in conversations with staff about things happening in the world or our school environment.', "Unfortunately this is a lacking area for the school, Hyde's scheduling for students of very jammed packed with classes either students need or time that needs to be occupied, but clubs aren't part of our school day time. There were once dance clubs for anyone who wanted to join but that was held after school and didn't last a whole school year.", "Hyde leadership charter school is not a bad school whatsoever, but there's a lot of things that can be changed to make it even better. For example, the environment needs to be treated as a place of learning and growth not discipline and penalty. Some of the rules and guidelines that are established are too extreme and often times unfair.", "I'd like to say that all teachers are amazing to be around when teaching but unfortunately that is not the case, many teachers are the complete opposite of their colleagues and have a very disagreement style of teaching and delivering lessons. There's a few teachers who just don't have the same connection to students like the rest of the staff and this is what brings down the learning environment.", 'The teachers here are always there to help.', "Hyde as a very comfortable atmosphere where students can be themselves and build relationships with teachers and administrators. Because ths school is small, it's easier to get to know different people and Hyde is its own community/ family.", 'Hyde Leadership is a place in which you will find your unique potential. Coming into this school you will always have a second home. This school is even open on Saturdays for students who need support or simply for a place to complete work, talk to teachers and etc.', 'Overall the school is okay, it just that every year you might receive a new teacher and the rules change every year.', 'Without attending this school I would not have been able to flourish in college and be outgoing. They brought me out of my shell.', 'everyone is different  and has there own group', 'We do have a nurse for emergency purposes', 'Teachers in this school care about students no matter what and always help  us with the work , stay afterschool often,', 'I hate it but it helps make  all the students be in dresscode', 'Laptop cart which everyone can use, however some  dont work at times', "Teachers often stay after school to help students and always correct us when something is wrong,  they are more open and tell us a little about there personal life's.", 'Vending machines snacks and drinks, lunch is healty.', 'I think this school is great with obedience and providing consequences.', 'I think more teachers should be available during after school hours.', "There isn't enough interesting clubs, at all. "]

They brought me out of my shell.', 'everyone is different  and has there own group', 'We do have a nurse for emergency purposes', 'Teachers in this school care about students no matter what and always help  us with the work , stay afterschool often,', 'I hate it but it helps make  all the students be in dresscode', 'Laptop cart which everyone can use, however some  dont work at times', "Teachers often stay after school to help students and always correct us when something is wrong,  they are more open and tell us a little about there personal life's.", 'Vending machines snacks and drinks, lunch is healty.', 'I think this school is great with obedience and providing consequences.', 'I think more teachers should be available during after school hours.', "There isn't enough interesting clubs, at all. "]

column2: ["I've learned many things from this school it made me think smarter not harder also made me focus on my work to put more effort from what I was doing previously", 'I’d like them to change many key factors about how they teach today’s students. To work on creating a better grading system that creates less vulnerability for other stuents in my school as a whole. I’d like for them to give more relevant homework to keep students on task with keeping their grades at a high standars', 'I liked the teachers personality. They are easy to talk to. I would like to see change is the crowded hallways. Good that they are changing/rebuilding the school.', 'Good Experience So far@&&@@&&&@@&&&&@@&&&@@&&$&&$$$$&&I will recommend this school to anyoneIt’s a 100/100Well at least for me', "I've been in family for four years and i can honestly say its a one on one school. they deal with you personally and understand everyone goes through their own obstacles. they attempt to overcome it together.", "My experience overall was amazing. I've learned MANY life lessons , and plain became a better person that I was when I first entered this school. The teachers are great, friendly , the students can be a little tough to deal with despite much drama going on; last the overall friendly environment is just great.", "When you first start school here, you'll be judged by the things you say, wear, and do. \r But after a while you won't notice it anymore. There are very few people you can be friends with bc of the small school there is. the school is okay and you can survive 4 years there if you keep to yourself.", "I grew up in this school. Most of the teachers know what they're doing and because it's a small school, they have more of a connection with students who choose to allow one to be formed. They generally care about the students beyond the classroom which only pushes them to support them further in their studies and in life afterwards. Some of the teachers are matters at their craft and at teaching it due to their passion for the subject they teach. On the other hand, some don't really know how to teach what they know, so those are most likely the subjects you'll do worse in. You're going to hate math due to the fact that you'll be ahead of math yet may not understandans you'll be pushed to excel in math when you don't understand it because the math section of the curriculum is unorganized. Actually be responsible for your work because even though the teachers work hard to help you graduate, they can only do so much for a lazy student.", "So far I can't tell if thing will be better in 11th grade or 12th grade but so far the experiences haven't been too bad. I like the good days/times I have at this school, which is usually when I'm having a basketball game in gym or a good conversation and rounds of laughter with peers. The bad experiences come when my peers play pranks on me regarding my property, physically horse around too much, and I when I have comprehension problems with the teachers.", 'The food is decent. It\'s not terrible but it\'s nothing to boast about. Sometimes they offer chopped up "mystery meat" though many of my peers tell it\'s chopped turkey, I\'m not convinced enough. A lot of students eat the fruits they offer along with just PB&J. The chicken tenders are typically pinkish and the burgers are tough and dark green/gray or pinkish. Ices are rare which is frustrating because we all like them very much.', "If you (mostly along with the majority of the class) are late to your classes often, you will very likely have privileges taken away.\r Also, the cell phone policy is strict so you most likely want to keep your smartphone in your pocket. Fights are punished  by mostly staying in offices for most of the day, but I'm not too clear on that as I haven't been involved. Also, parents do get called often if a student is being disorderly.", 'Our school teams are called East New York Family Academy Eagles. Our Girls Basketball and Volleyball teams are good, as well as our Boys Varsity Basketball team. Our Boys Volleyball team and Girls Tennis team have not played any games so far, and our Boys Junior Varsity Basketball team is terrible. The coaches however do put an emphasis on practice.', "Many teachers sometimes don't teach in depth about assignments and put out work and a lot of it. They get angry when we don't finish, as well as not even care if we don't understand it under the perceived notion that we are being lazy because we have the Internet. Sometimes I genuinely need help on an assignment due to poor instruction, but the teachers answer vaguely or perceive you as being ignorant. They only time they assist me one on one (in a mediocre manner) is during lonely lunch periods where I'm usually alone in the trailers with the teachers while my classmates are eating lunch or playing in the gym.", 'My School offer all the requirements that you need in order to graduate high school. \r &Topics: Living Environment, Earth Science, Chemistry, Integrated Algebra,  Algebra 1 & 2, Geometry, Global History, US History, French, Spanish, and English Language Arts. \r Students in the school are now exposed to AP Courses: AP US History, AP English, & AP Environmental Science. \r My School also has a GYM Class and after school activities. For example: Boys and Girls Varsity Basketball and Volleyball, Tennis, and Swimming', 'Some teachers are really committed and give something extra and others just do what they need to do.', 'There is not much diversity, there are few students that come from different countries and this is gradually increasing.', 'We have many outside and inside resources available. Because the school is  generally small we have to use a lot of outside resources.', 'There are not many teams and people that are actually dedicated.', "The school is a great school, All it needs is a bit more variety in certain areas. There's nothing really bad about it, its high school so of course there are going to be certain trouble makers here and there. However, my experience from middle school until now has been a pretty good one.", "I'd give it a better rating, but it depends on the student. The workload would be more manageable if students knew how to plan their time etc."]

I've learned MANY life lessons , and plain became a better person that I was when I first entered this school. The teachers are great, friendly , the students can be a little tough to deal with despite much drama going on; last the overall friendly environment is just great.", "When you first start school here, you'll be judged by the things you say, wear, and do. \r But after a while you won't notice it anymore. There are very few people you can be friends with bc of the small school there is. the school is okay and you can survive 4 years there if you keep to yourself.", "I grew up in this school. Most of the teachers know what they're doing and because it's a small school, they have more of a connection with students who choose to allow one to be formed. They generally care about the students beyond the classroom which only pushes them to support them further in their studies and in life afterwards. Some of the teachers are matters at their craft and at teaching it due to their passion for the subject they teach. On the other hand, some don't really know how to teach what they know, so those are most likely the subjects you'll do worse in. You're going to hate math due to the fact that you'll be ahead of math yet may not understandans you'll be pushed to excel in math when you don't understand it because the math section of the curriculum is unorganized. Actually be responsible for your work because even though the teachers work hard to help you graduate, they can only do so much for a lazy student.", "So far I can't tell if thing will be better in 11th grade or 12th grade but so far the experiences haven't been too bad. I like the good days/times I have at this school, which is usually when I'm having a basketball game in gym or a good conversation and rounds of laughter with peers. The bad experiences come when my peers play pranks on me regarding my property, physically horse around too much, and I when I have comprehension problems with the teachers.", 'The food is decent. It\'s not terrible but it\'s nothing to boast about. Sometimes they offer chopped up "mystery meat" though many of my peers tell it\'s chopped turkey, I\'m not convinced enough. A lot of students eat the fruits they offer along with just PB&J. The chicken tenders are typically pinkish and the burgers are tough and dark green/gray or pinkish. Ices are rare which is frustrating because we all like them very much.', "If you (mostly along with the majority of the class) are late to your classes often, you will very likely have privileges taken away.\r Also, the cell phone policy is strict so you most likely want to keep your smartphone in your pocket. Fights are punished  by mostly staying in offices for most of the day, but I'm not too clear on that as I haven't been involved. Also, parents do get called often if a student is being disorderly.", 'Our school teams are called East New York Family Academy Eagles. Our Girls Basketball and Volleyball teams are good, as well as our Boys Varsity Basketball team. Our Boys Volleyball team and Girls Tennis team have not played any games so far, and our Boys Junior Varsity Basketball team is terrible. The coaches however do put an emphasis on practice.', "Many teachers sometimes don't teach in depth about assignments and put out work and a lot of it. They get angry when we don't finish, as well as not even care if we don't understand it under the perceived notion that we are being lazy because we have the Internet. Sometimes I genuinely need help on an assignment due to poor instruction, but the teachers answer vaguely or perceive you as being ignorant. They only time they assist me one on one (in a mediocre manner) is during lonely lunch periods where I'm usually alone in the trailers with the teachers while my classmates are eating lunch or playing in the gym.", 'My School offer all the requirements that you need in order to graduate high school. \r &Topics: Living Environment, Earth Science, Chemistry, Integrated Algebra,  Algebra 1 & 2, Geometry, Global History, US History, French, Spanish, and English Language Arts. \r Students in the school are now exposed to AP Courses: AP US History, AP English, & AP Environmental Science. \r My School also has a GYM Class and after school activities. For example: Boys and Girls Varsity Basketball and Volleyball, Tennis, and Swimming', 'Some teachers are really committed and give something extra and others just do what they need to do.', 'There is not much diversity, there are few students that come from different countries and this is gradually increasing.', 'We have many outside and inside resources available. Because the school is  generally small we have to use a lot of outside resources.', 'There are not many teams and people that are actually dedicated.', "The school is a great school, All it needs is a bit more variety in certain areas. There's nothing really bad about it, its high school so of course there are going to be certain trouble makers here and there. However, my experience from middle school until now has been a pretty good one.", "I'd give it a better rating, but it depends on the student. The workload would be more manageable if students knew how to plan their time etc."]

column2: ["Very good school I'm currently a senior and it has been nothing but great expierenceces and growth. I have been learning to prepare for college and it's tough but I keep the mentally of staying focused and working hard because at the end it's success", "Terrible school because it a very racist school and I didn't learn anything except for one class each year. Great for sports but terrible someone who wants to learn.", 'The teachers are very nice  and  helpful.   They make sure that you are doing your work all the time . They also make sure that your doing good in all your classes.', 'I believe that Unity Center For Urban Technologies is a school with much potential. The school offers many sports activities, the teachers care and are very helpful, and the guidance/college counselor is extremely helpful to the students and setting the right path for college.', 'We have to go through the scanners every morning and you are not allow to walk right in unless a staff member from your school is down stairs to allow kids to go upstairs.', 'There really isnt any. But what some others and I did was ask our IT guy to stay with us and allow us to make our own clubs such as chess, Drone productions and music.', 'This school is suppose to be Unity Center for Urban Technology but we do not be using technology really unless you use the computer to do research. I would not choose this school because teachers  have been leaving for other jobs leaving us with substitute teachers in which I feel has interrupted my learning opportunities in particular subjects like Trigonometry for example.', 'The teachers at my school try to strive for the best for us but have a short temper ,there teaching ways are decent for the most part and they try to make sure everyone is on track but sometimes when they grade things it takes a week or more than 3 days sometimes.', "Some teachers have pretty decent teaching skills. Others don't care.", 'It could be better and could improve.', 'This is a great school in a social accept but academically it needs to improve.', 'Some teachers seem as if they do not care to be there and some are great teachers who actually care about the wellbeing of their students. The teachers are okay and have room for improvement.']

['I transferred to this school to finish my high school education and it was greatly relieving! I had 8.5 credits when I came to this school and after 2 years, I came out with 44 credits!', 'Best school helps graduate faster and I feel like I’m learning a lot. Thanks to this school I have been able to go closer to graduating and getting my high school diploma', 'Mott Haven has been overall amazing to me since the moment I went in for their open house. All of the teachers and staff have been nothing but helpful and motivational. They truly push for their students to succeed and will do anything to help them.', "This school keeps it's students and staff safe. There are procedures in place in case of an emergency.", 'There are so many programs and clubs available to choose from.', "I would choose this school all over again if I had to because it's given me a second chance at an education and its much better than my previous school. The staff truly care about the students and reward them when they've done well.", "The teachers at this school are very dedicated and connect well with the students. They are very understanding and helpful. Their lessons are entertaining and informative. I couldn't imagine better teachers than the ones at this school."]

['It was safe, we did not see a lot of fights in the school. More extra curricular activities and to end school earlier. Also, better technology for students when working with working with computers since its a school based on technology. Another thing is to not teach students literature and writing skills with programs on the computer but make it human although it is technology school.', 'The most thing I like about academy for language and technology is that they prepare every single student not only to be able to be prepare for college and future but also to became a better person. Also I have to admit that my school is such as a resposable system that take care of every single student , and they make sure they always on track. One thing I would like to see in my school is more hours of music perform.', 'The staff at Academy for Language and Technology have helped me since the moment I started 9th grade. Teachers are awesome when it comes to teaching and explaining the material. This school offers support and resources to help us build our future, for example, the counselors are always there to help us on our path of applying to college; they make sure we have everything we need to be prepared to the next step of our life. At my school they also have partnerships with different organizations that provide internships during the school year and summer. This was very important to me because I have participated and worked in these internships in the past two summers. Academy for Language and Technology also connect us to what we call Jumpstart or Collegenow, which is a program that allow us to take college classes after school two days a week. Overall my experience at ALT has been the most incredible experience of my life.', 'The Academy for Language and Technology is a good High School. The teachers always try their best to make the students succeed and the staff make the school a safe environment. It also helps students who recently came from their native countries learn English as a second language.', 'such a great school It is safe amazing teachers lot of integrity during my four years I learned so much this school teach student seven values that help each student to be honest Humble and capable to do anything, I think this is the best school in New York City', 'There are some Extracurricular activities like baseball, National Honor Society etc.', 'It is a great school. Teachers are very caring and help students if they need extra support. I really recommend this school.', 'Most teachers are well prepare and care about students, they try to engage all of them specially math teachers.', 'This school  is really safe; the personal safety and staff including the principal always make sure that will be okay under the school.', 'This school provides different groups and organization in which students can enjoy some of them are Y-plan in which the students role is interact with the issues in our community and find a solution to solve them; Student Government in which the students role are  planing activities for raising money for seniors, also trips, and activities that may help us in our future.', 'Most of the time my school is clean and organized. It makes the student feels very controllable.', 'Some activities are great help for students, but they should introduce more engaging activities to motivate students such as arts.', 'Has been a great experience. I have learned a lot of things which has gave me knowledge to prepare myself for the real world out there.', 'U.S American government- an excellent teacher.', 'this school emphasizes the need to go to college and prepared the students to attended to college. after graduating from this school I feel really prepared for the "real world". because in school I learned values as; loyalty,respect,justice,humility,integrity, honesty and resilience. this values are those who going to help me to be success in the life or real word.the school provide a lat of options to the students, but fail or quit is not on of them. "you go to college or go".', 'all the teachers are very professional and respectful with all the students,all teachers know the name of each student, and  are well experienced teachers. give clear and precise instructions for students to follow, through aim and do now in tho boat students can realize what is the goal to the lesson and what should know at the end of the lesson. they give handouts to the students to support they Knowles and evaluate what the student learn. ', 'All students are monitored very closely,The administration and police always take these threats seriously. if a student has a suspicious behavior is reported immediately to the principal. the security in the schools is in every where, for that reason is not possible been victim of bully. the school nurse is  really good and can handle most issues. this is the best school of the country. ', 'the food is not so good, the rice and pizzas are horrible. vegetables i are good,My advice: Bring your own lunch.  ', "the students aren't allowed to wear airings, sneaker , pants skinny, tattoos and long hair on men. Students aren't allowed to wear tank tops or V-neck shirts. All students must wear the school uniform; Black or brown shoes,gray long trousers, blue shirt, gray tie and navy blue jacket. Any student who refuses to wear the uniform is suspended.  man or woman(without excision). ", 'students are offered extracurricular classes as: sociology, calculus, biology, music, online courses on app ax and economic. but they teach the regular classes that the state require to the students can graduate from high school.  ']
