column1: Urban Assembly School for Collaborative Healthcare
column2: ['I like how the school is always concerned about their students college readiness. Academic side of the school is on point.  But, the rules and regulations is too much. It’s a uniform school but, even though you wear uniform and you wear a cardigan on top you are not in uniform. The administration is not that friendly you have to fight for your voice to be heard. They need a good professional college counselor and more interaction with the students who is not doing very well academically because those students doesn’t get recognized easily.', "My experience at Urban Assembly for Collaborative Healthcare(UASCH) was average. There isn't many activities or afterschool clubs to join, so its mostly just sports.", "Urban Assembly was a school you could call home at times. They had the resources but didn't know how to apply it at times.It help me make better safety precautions, and fire safety rules and awareness about my surroundings. It made me seee the world in a different view.", "There were plenty of supportive teachers and staff members there that helped me out through every year in that school. There are plenty of opportunities and clubs to join and things to do there so you won't be bored. Additionally, there are so many great teachers and staff members every student will find at least one staff member they like. Plus there is a diverse group of students and many different types of people there which will bring you into a friendly and good environment", "UASCH is currently one of the newest high school in NYC and is having its first graduating class at 2018. UASCH staff members really care about the student's welfare and want to see the students succeed in their academic career. The staff are supportive and informative about new activities or trips happening in NYC. UASCH is located in Franklin K. Lane Campus with four other high schools. Although the campus is big, UASCH is a small high school located on the first floor.", 'The school is a sea of comforting and friendly faces. The culture of the school developed over its first four years of existence has been incredible and irreplaceable. While the school isn’t perfect and some aspects of the school system need to be adjusted, the overall experience is something that I will never forget.']

["It's a very good school because you get to experience things with different perspectives. There is a lot of diversity and that is one of the major thing that represent this school. Everyone speaks a different language and that is great because you can get to know others people from other countries. We get an internship in the 11th grade and we have an iMentor program, which is great because you can talk with adults and get their experience they got in college and with that they can help you find the best fit for you. One of my best experiences at this school is that I got to make friends, explore my options and learn. One thing that teachers always teach us is to respect one another because we all struggled, for example my struggle was the language but with the help of my teachers I got ahead.", 'I like how assorted my school is there is understudies from numerous countries. I might want to see some american children students in this school. I have great experience on this school which I nearly been going to for a while so I have picked up my English a considerable measure better since I begin heading off to this school. This school is better than average for who originated from other countries and there age adequate to go secondary school yet old for middle school I prefer them to go this school. Because this school is good for language learners.', 'I like that there are students from many backgrounds. Teachers are kind, and you get the help you need as an international student.', 'Always felt safe and secure', 'There are many good programs available', 'This school helped me to be successful and confident', "I've only had good experience with my teachers.", 'Everyone is great. I think the school is safe as a result of the metal detectors and the numerous police officers at school.', 'At IHSL, we have so much to do. Students like myself end up going to too many organizations and clubs. Not only do we have our own clubs (student government, newspaper, ambassador), our program coordinator always send us information about a bunch of extracurricular activities outside of school (Girls Write Now, Liberty Partnership at Kingsborough, etc).', "IHSL is a fun place to go to school. I get to learn something new everyday and the environment is healthy and fun, yet educative. When we have feast day, people bring food from their own country and dress up traditionally--it's amazing!", 'The teachers are great. They are very friendly and caring. The always try their best to teach us something new everyday. The only problem I have with the teachers is that they do not give a lot of challenging work.', "I love my school . One thing every student want from  their teacher is to understand them and explain them clearly ! In my school teacher are really nice and they try their best to explain us even tho we don't understand that much English . I m graduation form my high school international high school at Lafayette after 2 year and if I had option to stay in high school forever I would chose international high school at Lafayette . It's really hard to describe my school because it's the best ! All student are friendly  and the most thing is that they don't judge people. I really do love my school .i m proud to be a student of (IHSL)", 'I like the all the class', "I've been stayed for afterschool to get my homeworks done and to get an extra help", 'I. Think i am prepared velly for my future', 'School police are very stickt and they dont let anything and anyone goes in or out without a reason. So they are all awake and careful.', 'Every students came from different countries and have different religion. They all are nice to each other.', "We don't chance to get involved in different sports.", 'In our school this option is somewhat available. ', 'Food in the cafeteria sometimes good, but most of the time junk food. ']

column2: ['Most of the teachers are very nice, I enyoy studying there, as a Spanish speaker that don’t know a lot of English we got help with the language.', "I would love to see more active communication between students and staff. During my time in the student's council and National Honor Society, I have found that the students with the biggest change from 9th grade to 12th are the students who develop a connection with the teachers and staff.", "High School for Energy and Technology (HSET) is really a good school. I like everything about this school. This school is awesome. This school's teachers are so helpful, they always help me out when I need help. School safety is really strong that I always feel so safe.", "In this school you'll experience the ways of the electrical field and boost your knowledge of circuits boards and osha regulations. This is the schools fifth year since it has began and is getting better each that has abd will come.", "I am a senior at HSET. Personally, I don't think this school is so bad for a public school. It has some of the best teachers in entire NYS and more are coming since the principal is eager to get the most capable teachers in the school. We also have some amazing clubs with some incredible opportunities like SkillsUSA and STEM etc. We are also associated with ConEdison and other corporations that gives students internship opportunities while in school. Overall, I don't think you will disappointed going there if you are eager yo learn.", "High School for Energy and technology is by far one of the worst schools possible. For starters it's name for it purpose to teach students about HVAC which stand for heating ventilation and air conditioning, however the school lacked all the materials and resources to teach us what the intended to teach us. Furthermore, as I closely become to finishing high school close to all the teachers quit and due to it I was unable to obtain an advance regents diploma which I rightfully deserved since I worked so hard for it. All in all, this is an okay high school but there is no many out there this school should just be closed down. ", 'As a senior we really did do anything special', 'Teachers can joke with you to male you feel comfortable', "If you don't like the schools specialty then transfer because your values wont be respected unless it corresponds with the schools'.", "The school safety are never around when there's a fight that's usually the teachers but they'll be there if your two minutes late to class.", "We have skill's which we have to do fundraising to get anything good and opening act is provided by an outside foundation so anything the school pays for will be low quality but if others pay for it, it will be high quality.", "There have been lots of changes between teachers and our principal being replaced so at this point we're just holding on to the peaces of a once great place.", "The education I have received at my high school was top notch. I've been able to do so many things and meet so many people.", "Overall, the senior teachers are great. The Junior teachers are horrible causing most of the junior class to fail. Lunch is horrible but from time to time its edible. One thing that is completely horrible is that 99% of all after school programs are on a Friday so we cannot join multiple which might be the one thing a college doesn't like about us. The new principle seems cool. She earned my respect by cooking the seniors dinner.", 'This school is great because of the new experiences.']

column1: High School for Enterprise, Business and Technology
column2: ['I had a great experience attending this school. The teachers were very attentive and caring towards the students. It really felt like they wanted the best for us and always went above and beyond to create the best experiences and opportunities for the students', "I had a solid experience at EBT. The classes were simple and there were always opportunities to get involved in the school such as environmental club, chess club, yearbook, honor society, and others. The school always promoted great academic  They had great school spirit which helped bring the students and facility together during stressful moments of the school year.  There were a couple of teachers who actually cared but the presence of the teachers wasn't always felt.  Wasn't enough study hours which was felt around the school. The school wasn't really clean with bathroom usually being vandalized, the smell of marijuana lingers in the hallways and sometimes distractions was apparent in classrooms and hallways. Overall, not a bad school. I wouldn't go back though", 'The high school for enterprise business and technology could improve on safety and resources to prepare students for college.', 'This school was very good. I enjoyed how much the teachers were investing their time in each student.', "To those who are unsure about going here and actually decided to learn about the school through the internet, I'm going to be completely honest: it's not a bad school. Although the ratings may be pretty low(i can 100% understand why), it won't really be the worst experience in the world. The school is trying its best to become a better place, like seriously. For instance, there's everyday scanning(yes it's annoying but it's for your own good) and for academics they've added the IB Program. I've had a decent experience in this school , and I doubt it'll affect your upcoming future since people in this school were able to go to Cornell and NYU, if you're worrying that the academics are too bad for you.", "This school is very diverse, with students and teachers, most if not all teachers are dedicated to the students success later on in their life, the only problem would be the students who arent there to learn and rather be babysit, its never the teachers fault on the school's rate of graduation, its usually if not everytime the student who is the problem", 'I liked how there was a huge amount of teacher-student appreciation. I disliked the lack of resources.', 'There’s nothing really special about this school that sets it apart from any other high school in Brooklyn.', "This school is the best active school i've gone too . The academic skills are wonderful they will make sure you pass with no doubt", 'Academic wise there are no problems, however, the organization of student activities and planning could be much better.', "My experience here has been fun and also academically helpful. There are so many programs the school offers when you really interested in looking into them. What I suggest should change would be promoting what the school offers and helping those even when they don't want help.", "I attend this high school. Gladly i will be graduating this year. the school isn't a bad school, theres smart and brilliant kids. We all get along with each other. the only bad things about it is that its in a campus put in with 2 other schools.", "I'm a senior now, and this school at first was a good choice for me but the fact that many teachers left and we are left with tight budgets, Deans who scream at you all the time and with students who disrespect that nicest teachers. I wished i can give it a better rating but i can't. I have to be honest. The more student that come to this school the worse it get. This generation aren't ready. Only few will work hard and the rest will just not put in the work to gain the knowledge needed. Students are disrespectful and it's something I'm glad I'm getting out of. The only good part of it is the teachers that would do there best to get you to where you wanna be. But this generation lost touch and teachers are being side tract by students disrespect and not willing to sit down and read a book.", 'I liked the college readiness they give you options and they help you stay focused. Some teachers need to change their attitudes.', "I've transfered to this school my sophmore year and it was a different enviorment. it was easy to adapt because i joined the schools footballl team. but the time i got here i made connections with some teachers and my college advisor and im glad about that because i seen the care and leader ship role in this school. ", 'Best high school in Williamsburg, the high school for enterprise business and technology offers so many great things for every student and work hard so that we can achieve as a family in ebt... be great and respect that ebt is known at heart and it should be an A+ school. ', 'Every year the security for the building increased, sometimes it interrupted our teaching lessons', "Their aren't that many extracurricular activities but the few that are available are great.", "This school is in a building with two ther schools. Which leads to a lot of drama and students getting mixed up in the wrong crowd. If the school wasn't so big it would be more safe", 'The teachers overall are okay. Some care about the students more than others.']
column4: ['I had a great experience attending this school. The teachers were very attentive and caring towards the students. It really felt like they wanted the best for us and always went above and beyond to create the best experiences and opportunities for the students', "I had a solid experience at EBT. The classes were simple and there were always opportunities to get involved in the school such as environmental club, chess club, yearbook, honor society, and others. The school always promoted great academic  They had great school spirit which helped bring the students and facility together during stressful moments of the school year.  There were a couple of teachers who actually cared but the presence of the teachers wasn't always felt.  Wasn't enough study hours which was felt around the school. The school wasn't really clean with bathroom usually being vandalized, the smell of marijuana lingers in the hallways and sometimes distractions was apparent in classrooms and hallways. Overall, not a bad school. I wouldn't go back though", 'The high school for enterprise business and technology could improve on safety and resources to prepare students for college.', 'This school was very good. I enjoyed how much the teachers were investing their time in each student.', "To those who are unsure about going here and actually decided to learn about the school through the internet, I'm going to be completely honest: it's not a bad school. Although the ratings may be pretty low(i can 100% understand why), it won't really be the worst experience in the world. The school is trying its best to become a better place, like seriously. For instance, there's everyday scanning(yes it's annoying but it's for your own good) and for academics they've added the IB Program. I've had a decent experience in this school , and I doubt it'll affect your upcoming future since people in this school were able to go to Cornell and NYU, if you're worrying that the academics are too bad for you.", "This school is very diverse, with students and teachers, most if not all teachers are dedicated to the students success later on in their life, the only problem would be the students who arent there to learn and rather be babysit, its never the teachers fault on the school's rate of graduation, its usually if not everytime the student who is the problem", 'I liked how there was a huge amount of teacher-student appreciation. I disliked the lack of resources.', 'There’s nothing really special about this school that sets it apart from any other high school in Brooklyn.', "This school is the best active school i've gone too . The academic skills are wonderful they will make sure you pass with no doubt", 'Academic wise there are no problems, however, the organization of student activities and planning could be much better.', "My experience here has been fun and also academically helpful. There are so many programs the school offers when you really interested in looking into them. What I suggest should change would be promoting what the school offers and helping those even when they don't want help.", "I attend this high school. Gladly i will be graduating this year. the school isn't a bad school, theres smart and brilliant kids. We all get along with each other. the only bad things about it is that its in a campus put in with 2 other schools.", "I'm a senior now, and this school at first was a good choice for me but the fact that many teachers left and we are left with tight budgets, Deans who scream at you all the time and with students who disrespect that nicest teachers. I wished i can give it a better rating but i can't. I have to be honest. The more student that come to this school the worse it get. This generation aren't ready. Only few will work hard and the rest will just not put in the work to gain the knowledge needed. Students are disrespectful and it's something I'm glad I'm getting out of. The only good part of it is the teachers that would do there best to get you to where you wanna be. But this generation lost touch and teachers are being side tract by students disrespect and not willing to sit down and read a book.", 'I liked the college readiness they give you options and they help you stay focused. Some teachers need to change their attitudes.', "I've transfered to this school my sophmore year and it was a different enviorment. it was easy to adapt because i joined the schools footballl team. but the time i got here i made connections with some teachers and my college advisor and im glad about that because i seen the care and leader ship role in this school. ", 'Best high school in Williamsburg, the high school for enterprise business and technology offers so many great things for every student and work hard so that we can achieve as a family in ebt... be great and respect that ebt is known at heart and it should be an A+ school. ', 'Every year the security for the building increased, sometimes it interrupted our teaching lessons', "Their aren't that many extracurricular activities but the few that are available are great.", "This school is in a building with two ther schools. Which leads to a lot of drama and students getting mixed up in the wrong crowd. If the school wasn't so big it would be more safe", 'The teachers overall are okay. Some care about the students more than others.']
column6: ['There is clubs like the Math and Science Institution where they help students with their math and science courses and help engage them in those subjects.', 'This school has college readiness classes and the college office is available to all students.', 'My school can be better. Needs more activities!', 'The safety system in this school is pretty well. I do feel safe attending this school.', "The national honor society in this school really changed me as a person because of all the team work that's involved. I've learned to stand in others shoes to handle the problem.", 'I ended middle school with quite horrible grades. It was the teachers in this school that helped me believe in myself again by trying their best to answer any questions or problems possible.', 'There are many engaging teachers in this school who are there whenever you need them. They are very welcoming and considerate to the students.', 'The honors or AP classes, are great and challenging', 'The amount of quality coaches for each and every sport at my school are second to none. they are the ideal coach that you would want to have and also get you prepared if you want to play a sport in college.', 'Every teacher at this school are passionate about teaching kids on a daily basis and are willing to go through anything to make sure that these students have the best knowledge going into high school.', 'The academics are pretty good.', 'The food is like almost every other public school.', 'The teachers are really good at their job.', 'There are enough for most students', 'The administration at my school is very helpful', "It's mediocre, but can be great for some students", 'there nice to all of us students', 'this is  great high school but can do better if they try', 'security is tight they protect us', 'they are dedicated teachers more than willing to help you after school for one on one tutoring']

column1: High School for Law, Advocacy & Community Justice
column2: ['High school for law advocacy and communit justrice provides safety for students with a good and welcoming enviornment. Theres very good teachers and some can be trusted, however my attention was caught on the activities that are created within student government and other clubs alike. I believe such things like rules and scanning couls or should change.', 'I like that my high school offers opportunities so that students can be on track for college, such as SAT prep and the counselors are very supportive. However, I would like for teachers to try to help students more rather than being quick to enter a bad grade.', 'I like how the teachers cared about students and they tried to engage with them. I felt comfortable with most of my teachers and I usually go back to pay them a visit.', 'The school offers a wide variety of academic advantages and offers a wide number of clubs. This school is a wonderful place to send your children who love to interact with sports', 'This school has some aspects that I would keep. This would include the teachers and the dynamic between students and staff. However, the amount of rigorous work could increase, and the challenging and independent aspects of school could be worked on a bit. The college readiness aspect all depends on who you have as a teacher and who you surround yourself with!', 'I used to be a student there, graduated, but there was a lot of different types of people there. It was every diverse but very fun. The teachers vary, some being excellent and passionate, others being too oriented with the curriculum.', 'This school provides a safe learning environment for students. It allows growth and prosperity. There are extracurricular activities, including A.P classes to prepare students for college.', 'I’ve had the best high school experience attending this place! I’ve met so many great people because of that school and also the class trips to visit theaters and watch plays were the best!', 'My learning in Law advocacy and community justice, has been a great experience as a ESAL student and new to this country, This school had a really big impact on me, I enjoyed it and had a memorable moments that I will remember forever.', 'I think there a specific teachers that really go out of their way to make sure that they give you a very educational experience. From having extended office hours to engaging their students in class, their dedication to having productive classes as seen.', 'greate school easy to connect with teachers.gives you all the support you need, such as educational help, personal help, ecteasy to interact to sport and clubs you are intrested inwill listen to you if you want a change and will try all thier best to help', 'Amazing teachers and staff that helped students excel in academics as well in sports. Opportunities for students to engage in extracurricular activities.', 'theres no words its just amazing its an amazing expierence i love this school its people its history especially the name.', 'Pretty average high school. Barely saw the principal when I attended but other staff were always around and made the college application process go very well.', 'I Like how some of the teachers really care about you but the bathrooms need get fixed and the food as well', 'The High School for Law, Advocacy and Community Justice is a good place to go to get a good education. There are great teachers that will go out of their way to help you learn and get great opportunities. As far as I know, there is no bullying in the school, everyone treats each other equally and with respect. The staff are not all bad, but you will have to know who to go to for help with anything. The guidance counselors are great and helpful. However, the school is in great need of a College counselor for seniors and upcoming juniors who are applying for college and FAFSA.', 'Being in this school really shaped the person I have become both positively and negatively. For the most part the teachers and most of the staff want what’s best for your future and help you strive for success. Although the individuals in the school can be a bit troublesome with fights and being loud, but for the most part you do get help for your future which I feel is most important.', "It's been a fun 4 years a lot of opportunities to meet many different people. Teacher's actually care about their students and try to set them on the right track.", 'My experience in this school was great. I have the opportunity to take A.P classes, many sports to choose from, allowed to take a class to prepare for the SAT, and we partner with John Jay university for college- now classes. The teachers and faculty members are supportive.', "What I liked the most about Law was the diversity. Students from all around in one building striving to be great human beings. Also, the support and the environment it's honestly amazing at law."]

The teachers and faculty members are supportive.', "What I liked the most about Law was the diversity. Students from all around in one building striving to be great human beings. Also, the support and the environment it's honestly amazing at law."]
column6: ["I've been at MLK law since my freshman year which is year 2014. My school has gotten better academically wise since then because now the freshmens this year take two algebra classes abs advisory something we never have. As a senior I want to see my school progress in terms of school culture and bringing more opportunities to kids now. The changes I would like to see is the administration involvement with the students.", "In my high school I enjoy how the students come together when we have after school activities such as the talent show, the fashion show, basketball games, soccer games and battle of the classes. When it comes to academics the teachers try their best to assist students with getting the grades that they know they deserve but don't try hard enough to obtain. The staff members of my school want all students to graduate and be successful in life. However this cannot happen if they tend to slack off and not care about their education.", 'I like in which the way the educational staff provides help and is able to enlighten their students in an efficient way. The school could be able to incorporate a couple of more real-life scenario classes in their curriculum. ', 'What I mostly like about niche was how they connected me to some Colleges that matched me according to what I want to major in, which is something I find very important. What I also like the most is all the scholarships they have to offer especially provided lots of funds. There are varieties of scholarships to apply too and as well as many colleges to look into . The way the website is set up is very good as well , they have separate sections that include scholarships, states of the colleges, majors , and even a section for minorities and much more scholarships. ', 'This high school is very educational, interactive, and overall amazing.  The people there are great.  The schools location is very ideal.  I love it. ', 'The classes were okay , the only good experience is making friends', "There's a couple teachers that stride to do more to help their students which is amazing because you get to interact and connect more with their own teacher", 'There are clubs that you can join that are fun', "Their very judge mental when it comes to certain situations. You can really talk to some teachers because they care and others just don't care about you at all. They just want shmoney and that's it cause all they do is teach us to pass a test we have to take at the end of year so technically you don't really learn nothing.", 'I have enjoyed my years so far at my high school. I moved to another state and returned to New York City. Upon my return, I had a chance to attend a new school, however, I decided to return to my current high school and overall I can honestly say that it was worth it.', 'The teachers in my school are very knowledgeable and approachable. Most of them seem to enjoy their jobs and they are very easy to be around. They truly care about the education of their students and try to keep us all in line.', 'they do too much sometimes', 'Not too much but the ones they have are good', "Not a lot of extra curricular besides sports and there's only a few GOOD teams. The scanning is annoying but you get used to it. But the teachers and the dean are great !", 'This is the first time I went to a school where I loved ALL my teachers', "There is only one school nurse available for  nurse available for the entire campus which makes it hard to see the nurse or get assistance when one goes to the nurse. However, I think the campus is safe due to metal detectors and an abundance of school safety. Each school on campus has their own Dean and there is a precinct at the school. There are also alarms on every exit the buildings has so if anyone exits or enters where they shouldn't the alarm will go off and the police are notified.", 'I am very involved in extracurricular activities. I play volleyball, double dutch and manage the boys varsity basketball team. I am also involved in the journalism club and student government. I feel that there are more than enough sports and clubs for students to join and if the club of choice is not available it can be started. Teachers are willing to stay and oversee a club once students are willing to participate.', 'The teachers make an effort to accommodate as many children as possible so that everyone can learn and understand. However, not everyone engages nor are all lessons exciting or engaging for students to want to learn. On the other hand, most of the teachers try their best to make everyone comfortable and offer extra help or extra credit if needed.', "With my school, there's good days and there's bad. In all schools it's really what you make it. You could be in the best school and not enjoy anything if you have the mindset of everything has to come to me and when i want it to. that's why i really appreciate my school because it not only makes me want to do better, especially graduate but it forces you to become a better student if they can't change your attitude.", 'I believe that the school is decent, compared to other schools. I believe there should be more of an interest to bring in clubs, organizations and initiatives for students, especially based on the theme of the school.']
column8: ['I have enjoyed my years at this high school. The people that work here and go to this school are absolutely wonderful.', 'I believe that overall my school is great and has axing teachers that care about their students education but on the other hand there are some things that could be fixed. Some security guards treat students with disrespect and there is sometimes bullying that occurs . Education wise my school is pretty good.', 'They are very good teacher.', "I wasn't in any clubs or organizations to know much about it.", 'The school prepared me for what college had to offer but I felt like they could have taught us in a way that college professors teach us as well.', "the principle of the school is somewhat helpful and rarely present. guidance counselors are amazing they're always there's for the students who go. office staff are friendly.", "Student involvement with studying and class work is great. peer pressure is not all that often. acceptance rate is ok.  there's no regard to ethnic/ racial diversity and/ or sexual orientation.", 'There was a drama club, debate team, and a lot of sports. there is a great level of commitment, the most popular was soccer and basketball.', 'There really arent any bullying instances but the confrontational issues we do have, the school officials are able to mediate and get through to diffuse the situation. I really appreciate that, in making our community better.', 'The only problem I have with the schools academic services is that there is rarely any law classes to prepare the aspiring attorneys. That is the only thing we lack, we have psych classes but not law.', 'The quality of the teachers in my school are unremarkable, they engage us in the curriculum, we are able to connect and communicate with them. They make stressful classes less stressful. Such as in my AP. English class with Ms. Gionti ,during the holidays we do like a cultural feast, or a bake off and connect it to the literature we read thus far. She takes us to plays , she bakes for us. And we engage in discussions after every book, ensuring our understanding of the book. Its just superb.', 'Resources such as sanitation in the bathroom and halls, are horrendous. But its not that we come in the morning looking at such filth, but its some students that make it this way. The counseling and teacher support around the school is superb. We can always go to an adult for anything and look at them as a mentor,although we often tend to talk to the janitors, school safety and counselors rather than the teachers.Overall , its resources it great.', 'The administration help to keep the school a friendly environment.', 'The teams really see the fun of the games they play', "There's a lot I've learned from this school", 'There are many ways for a person to be involved.', "The security guards watch us in school so that we are safe and there isn't any weird activity.", 'There are many opportunity for student to enter a sport. The sports are there but the students need to take the first step and try out for the sport.', 'Drama is everywhere, But this school tries to avoid it most of the time,', 'This school offers the opportunity for children to explore their creative side with our art classes. Students also have the chance to learn a new language, such as Spanish and French.']

column2: ['I loved everything about this school, the student to staff ratio, the rigor of work, the fascinating teachers and pretty much everything else.', 'Academics play a huge role in this school because it is their main focus. They want students to learn and be ready for the future; their goal is to ensure to students go to college.', 'There is not much diversity at the school but that has more to do with the area. However, now that I am in college (One of the most diverse universities) I find that this school was not very diverse.', 'I always felt safe at this school and this is very important because at other schools in this city I would probably not feel the same way. I never felt as though I was ever in danger. It was really hard to get into the school because we only had two available ways of entry.', 'The administration is adamant about ensuring that there are many school orgs to choose from. This school allowed a variety of school clubs and organizations and I was a part of may of them. My favorite would have had to have been chess club. It is where I learned to play chess and it was always fun.', 'I do not feel that this category is applicable to this school because we did not have sports or athletics while I was attending. If you wanted to be involved in a sport than you would try out for one of the other two high school teams. This was one downside to attending this school. However parents did want their children to succeed; atlas I know that mine did.', 'I feel that this school is a great school and it has a very caring staff. This is one of the more smaller schools in the city so therefore it is easier for students to engage. The fact that the school is so small makes it easier for people to know one another and its really difficult for anyone to be left behind. The guidance counselors are one of the most helpful humans ever! They really want you to succeed and ensure that you are aware of everything you need to know when it comes down to applying for colleges, scholarships, and they even set up field trip for college fairs.']

column1: New York City Charter High School for Architecture, Engineering & Construction Industries
column2: ['AECI is an adequate school. There are teachers that teach well and really do care about the students. But some classes are uninteresting and do seem unnecessary.', 'i am a senior now  classes are though . however is  a large mount of extra help given. this school is not made to let you fail . so far by the end of the year i will have 9 college creites. i don,t regret coming to this school', 'This school is very helpful when it comes to getting you prepared for college. They really sit down with you and do all they can to guide you every step  of the way.', 'This is a small school. But that’s what makes it a really good school because all the staff and teachers know all the students. It makes everyone have a close relationship so that we all have a equal chance at a future. The only complaint I could I have is the lunch’s. But this is really a great school.', 'Teachers are amazing, they take their time to know each studying a personal level! Small class size. Amazing staff! Great communication with students. Always have activities/ clubs / sports for kids. Reward good behavior/ grades.', "It's a very small school, but that is why it was so great. You work closely with your teachers. Really good elective classes and great computer lab. Teachers were very helpful and friendly. Not many conflict or fights during school. Also pretty good security. Not a lot of clubs besides the sport clubs. I learned a lot of skills from many of my classes.", "The school overall is okay, though there are amazing teachers who really wish to make a difference in the students lives, but teachers don't often stay due the administrations differences with the and that affects the staff constantly.", 'I learned so much at aeci. Not just from the learning of a trade but from a community environment. Aeci helped us all become college ready. In every subject, with professional teachers all aspiring for a higher degree. Teachers built support systems making sure no student was left behind. X periods to make up missing work, were good motivation for students to work harder in school.', "In my opinion, this school is alright. The staff are very caring but I feel like this isn't being used to its full ability. When I first began as a freshmen, there wasn't any type of diversity but now as a senior, there are more black teachers which is a good thing. I kind of wish the school had its own building but somehow it manages for all its 400 students. Overall, I haven't had a bad experience but I feel that this school could do much better in terms or organization and college readiness/awareness.", 'my favorite experience in this school was the basketball season, award ceremony', "Some teachers in this school try hard to help students who are struggling and have bad behavior, but some don't care. Thier communication skills are great but some teachers are weird and i don't understand them nor their teaching skills but i try to go with their flow.\r '", "I haven't seen anyone with anything illegal in the time I've been here.", "Some of the teachers are absolutely amazing, but others just don't seem to care at all. The kids are just another paycheck. I spent a whole year learning nothing in my math class due to a terrible teacher. This has crippled my chances of graduating with an advanced regents diploma, as well as a head start in college math.", 'Its okay, but I wish there was more.', 'This school has an amazing Architecture class.', 'Teachers in my school go above and beyond to help.', "We don't have many parent meetings only one or two a year.", "Some teachers are really good at their jobs the others don't really care", 'The school is really small which makes it easy to be in contact with teachers. It is a good learning environment, I believe that this really is a outstanding school and is a great way to spend your 4 years there.', "This high school is great academically and only have around 400-500 students in the whole school. So it's a small school so everyone knows each other and you create that bond with your teacher. Also it's strict since its a charter school, not many altercation occur."]

Also pretty good security. Not a lot of clubs besides the sport clubs. I learned a lot of skills from many of my classes.", "The school overall is okay, though there are amazing teachers who really wish to make a difference in the students lives, but teachers don't often stay due the administrations differences with the and that affects the staff constantly.", 'I learned so much at aeci. Not just from the learning of a trade but from a community environment. Aeci helped us all become college ready. In every subject, with professional teachers all aspiring for a higher degree. Teachers built support systems making sure no student was left behind. X periods to make up missing work, were good motivation for students to work harder in school.', "In my opinion, this school is alright. The staff are very caring but I feel like this isn't being used to its full ability. When I first began as a freshmen, there wasn't any type of diversity but now as a senior, there are more black teachers which is a good thing. I kind of wish the school had its own building but somehow it manages for all its 400 students. Overall, I haven't had a bad experience but I feel that this school could do much better in terms or organization and college readiness/awareness.", 'my favorite experience in this school was the basketball season, award ceremony', "Some teachers in this school try hard to help students who are struggling and have bad behavior, but some don't care. Thier communication skills are great but some teachers are weird and i don't understand them nor their teaching skills but i try to go with their flow.\r '", "I haven't seen anyone with anything illegal in the time I've been here.", "Some of the teachers are absolutely amazing, but others just don't seem to care at all. The kids are just another paycheck. I spent a whole year learning nothing in my math class due to a terrible teacher. This has crippled my chances of graduating with an advanced regents diploma, as well as a head start in college math.", 'Its okay, but I wish there was more.', 'This school has an amazing Architecture class.', 'Teachers in my school go above and beyond to help.', "We don't have many parent meetings only one or two a year.", "Some teachers are really good at their jobs the others don't really care", 'The school is really small which makes it easy to be in contact with teachers. It is a good learning environment, I believe that this really is a outstanding school and is a great way to spend your 4 years there.', "This high school is great academically and only have around 400-500 students in the whole school. So it's a small school so everyone knows each other and you create that bond with your teacher. Also it's strict since its a charter school, not many altercation occur."]

column2: ['Through my 3 years at Elmwood park Memorial High School I have met wonderful teachers who were thoughtful and helped me understand certain topics well. Despite that the clubs and activities are not active, and do not work on starting new and exciting things.', 'As long as you get along with your class, you will be fine. I just go there to learn, talk with friends, and have a good time. There are a few teachers that do care about what they are doing, and those are teachers I want to learn from. What I want to see change in the school is in the administration. Otherwise, the school is okay.', 'The most of the new teachers were inexperienced and did not provide the necessary tools. Also the senior guidance counselor was not available when students needed her the most. There should be classes that better prepare their students for the real world situations. The diversity of the school was great and very inclusive. The clubs and activities included arrange of different selections.', 'I enjoyed hanging out with my friends each day during classes. It helps ease stress placed on me knowing that they have my back. I wish the school would be more enforcing on the junkies in the bathrooms smoking it up.', 'It’s a really good school but not very diverse. The academics are very good and supposedly schools rank you a quarter higher if they know that you are from Memorial.', 'I love that all the students here are kind to one another. I think this is rare in high schools nowadays, and I am proud of my school for this. Also, the teachers, guidance counselors, and the staff in general really push you to be the greatest you could be. They encourage me to be a better me than I was yesterday. However, I would like to see more sports teams. It would give more students a chance to participate in after school physical activities if they were given more choices.', 'Vice- principal slapped my butt and I had a rat in my soup, and I found two girls kissing in the bathroom', 'It’s a great school. Some teachers aren’t too good while some are. There isn’t a large selection of AP classes, but it’s good enough for most.', "There is a great variety of extracurricular activities available for all students. Everyone has a chance to find something to fulfill their needs. I can tell that teachers as well as students are very devoted to their clubs. They create many opportunities so the after-school activities won't ever get boring. Teachers help their members organize different activities like field trips, fundraisers, school parties and much more. The level of commitment is very high and is driven by each student's motivation. Most of the student's ideas gets the administration support which is great, because with their support and help we can do much more.", "My overall experience at this school has been great. I wouldn't have changed a single thing if I could. Teachers, who have always been there for their students and who have been always motivate kids to do their work and participate in extracurricular activities, are the most important. They are the ones who make this school unique and fun. All activities available for students helped bond with other students. Games, homecoming, prom, field trips wouldn't be the same without all those great people and teachers that I've met. Fun activities during classes were always exciting and made students learn a lot. If I could, I would definitely choose this school again and I'd be more than happy to relive all those happy moments all over again.", 'All teachers in Elmwood Park Memorial High School are friendly and very helpful. Each one of them goes above and beyond to help the student in need. Teachers create a lot of great opportunities for students to help them learn. Every single teacher tries his best to motivate students to participate in class and/or different clubs and organizations. Teachers try to create a safe and fun environment in school and also outside of school. Most of the teachers are available after school or even during the weekends to help students who need help with certain homework or project. Teachers in Elmwood Park Memorial High School are more like a family, because they always support and care for their students.', 'This school is very safe, we have practice lockdowns every month.', 'Most students do not take extra curricular activities serious.', 'Most of my math teachers were excellent and helped me outside of the classroom.', 'Not too many clubs and if there are they are underfunded', 'Not many parents involved in school activities', "Many new teachers this year and many teachers quit. Some don't know what they are doing.", "Most teachers don't even teach the subjects. More than half the time I find myself teaching the material on my own because the lesson in class wasn't even taught or wasn't taught properly. The teachers aren't approachable for the most part and not always cooperative or flexible. I am currently taking AP and honors classes of which the material and learning is intense. Since the teachers don't care enough to teach, it makes the school year even more arduous for me. Why should they get paid to do nothing while I basically do both the job of a teacher and student?", 'I feel the school is safe.', 'Every teacher I had are great.  They are always pushing me to work my hardest.  My teachers are willing to go above and beyond for the students.  They come in early or stay after school for extra help.']

column8: ['I feel that the academics offered are good.  I always had great teachers that encouraged me to work hard for my grades and was always willing to stay after school for extra help.', 'The clubs and organizations are good.', 'Elmwood Park Memorial once used to be a school filled with creative fun extra curricular activities, late busses, inspiring teachers, and bleachr filled games. Today, then quote of "pride" which can be found throughout the school is washing away. With our very low budget, grass less fields, and the non existing track it is hard for athletes to be proud of their home team. Our school has become little to nothing with little clubs and even less people willing to participate. We have lost determination to make the best of what we have. Our school is poorly managed and teachers are working without contracts.', 'Teacher are always before school and after school for extra help.', 'I made a lot of new friends there that I will hope to stay in contact with as i get older. The education could have improved', 'I had amazing time at that school. They had great selection for lunch and we also had mandatory gym classes everyday so if kept us as students and teachers very active.', 'the administration does not care about the students. politics ruined the school.', "I don't like how everything's whole wheat now", 'Take action correctly when needed', 'We are a lot more fortunate than other schools are', 'Most but not all are very helpful and friendly.', 'Variety is nice, but better funding is needed.', 'There is hardly any bullying, everyone is mostly sociable with everyone. Very accepting students.', 'Lack of money means lack of sports varieties', "The academy teachers are probably the best. I don't have much experience with the normal class teachers.", 'I\'m not prepared for the "Real World" I will find out on my own of college lifestyle', 'the food services at the school displayed fast foods, sandwiches and cookies. Not many choices of fruit.', "Some teachers don't teach very well for some to learn as much as they want to.", 'the level of commitment towards sports and clubs are high. some students have more dedication on the field than in a classroom.', 'the faculty in my school is effected towards dress code and bullying. the school itself is an average school with low cut budges and big classrooms.']

column2: ['Bound Brook high school honors/AP classes helped prepare me for college. If you choose to take your classes seriously, you will be successful. We have a very tight knit community and a lot of alumni care about giving back to students. Clubs were very involved in the community as well. A few teachers were lazy in the classroom, but the good outweigh the bad by far.', 'Bound Brook High School is not one of the top choices for schools. The diversity level is about average, and the academics are around the same. College readiness is definitely not a priority in this school. Many seniors have said they feel alone in the application and decision process, as the counselors are not too much help. As for the student body, in some grades, racism is prevalent. Jokes are still being made against the African American population in the school, along with religious discrimination towards the Muslim population. Administration has not suspended or expelled any of these students that have participated in this matter, and show little to no support towards the population affected by these jokes.', 'Bound Brook High school has been a great high school and the teachers as well as the other school administrators have been an extremely big help in helping me find out what I wanted to be and once I realized that, figuring out what steps to take to get there. I am extremely thankful for that since they pushed me in the right direction to get started. The teachers are also really nice and are ready and willing to give up their time to help you which is really appreciated.', 'I attended Bound Brook High School my freshman year. I am now a junior, but no longer attend BBHS. I did, however, want to leave my opinion here. There are obviously some nice and accepting people at BBHS. However,  most others are judgmental or disrespectful if you aren’t quick to fit in to all aspects of a BBHS Crusader. Teachers are hit or miss, most of them truly care about your grades and future. Very few are concerned about your well-being. The lunch is average. Lots of athletics and clubs to take part in—lots of electives as well. Student IDs are heavily enforced here—if you forget to bring yours to school one day or don’t have it around your neck you can be fined. I’ve been involved in one lockdown in which a student was found with two kitchen knives. There was an incident that happened after I left in which a trash can was set on fire by two students in the cafeteria. Safe but could be better. The building is old and honestly needs updating', 'I have a pretty good experience. Very small, and there are many student here. The teachers are predominately white, very few colored teachers, and that may discourage some colored students.', "Although the school has dedicated teachers and challenges students, the visual and performing arts departments could be improved if it had the school's support.", "The school itself is not that big but for those looking to get to know nearly every student, this is the place to be. Although administration can be questionable, it does not take away from the experience the school can provide. The education isn't the best nor the worst but you do learn life lessons overall at BBHS.", 'Opportunities are endless at Bound Brook High School only if you take advantage of them. As a current student, I have been satisfied with the education that I have been receiving. The guidance department is always attentive and is willing to do whatever a student needs in terms of college admissions. The one problem with the school is the student culture. There is a lack of appreciation for learning amongst the student body. It seems that most students are just at school to graduate and move on, not for the sake of learning. This hurts those who are passionate about making the most about their education.', "I'm a Senior at Bound Brook High School. I am born and raised in Bound Brook so I went to all the school districts in Bound Brook. As a Senior, my experience at Bound Brook High, sadly went really fast however I really enjoyed my experience. Though I do have to say that as a first generation in America, my freshman year could have been better. I was lost and did not know if I was taking the right classes and if my schedule was good enough. That year could have been better on the long run because I would have taken that year more seriously and I would be higher on my class rank. I participate in a variety of clubs like Art club, Interact club, and the Student Committee. I really wish my school had a dance club because I enjoy dancing. I appreciate my high school years so much and I will miss my school when the time comes to graduate in the following months.", "Bound Brook High school is a good school to attend. There are it's ups and downs, but still a great place to learn. The teachers are extremely helpfull and caring to all students. Bound Brook has recently acquired Chrome Books instead of the old ipads. To help us learn and new modern era.", "The nurse at my school is never around when you need her to be, I don't know where she goes but if you don't need her, she is just sitting right in her office. The officer at our school is cool, he does his job... I still believe that he should have a gun though, just saying.", 'Im giving this another "it\'s okay," because the extracurriculars\' that I was took on were very average and didn\'t catch my attention the way I intended them to. Don\'t get me wrong, I liked them, Intro to Engineering and Financial Literacy  were very fun but after a while I lost interest.', "I don't believe that this school is the worst but it could be better.", 'All of the teachers have thier days, some are more excited and engaged than others but we have to deal with that as students right?', 'The math program is excellent. The school offers algebra 1, algebra 2, geometry, pre-calculus, advanced algebra, calculus, and statistics. A lot of dual-enrollement classes are offered. There is a strong connection with RVCC.', "Health and safety is pretty average. Drug aren't commingle heard of.", "This school is very unique in the way it is run. The way in which the school's funding is managed is very controversial. The superintendent wants to fire the school aids who are under-paid, but he has hired not one, but two vice principals who are paid over 100k annually. With a school as small as it is and the demographics it embodies, it does not require the amount of administration that the school currently has in place. Many parents and students feel that nepotism has a strong presence throughout the school. Many feel that this hinders the ability for other students who exemplify qualities much stronger for certain positions the ability to uphold said positions. It seems to be that students who obtain connections with higher authority receive special privileges. The school used to have a period 11 to help students who were falling behind, but removed it and extended the school day which gets in the way of after school activities especially sports. Most clubs were forced to move their meetings to the morning.  Each class was extended 5 minutes which does not make a difference. Teachers now leave right when the last period is over and don't have to stay. My child passed sophomore year thanks to the extra period(period 11) and now is struggling. All these examples go to show how poorly decisions are made in the school. The board of education and administration does not care about the opinion of parents or students. They don't evaluate all outcomes and possibilities. Parents and teachers voice their opinions, but nothing is changed. Besides that, Bound Brook High School has improved academically. They offer dual-enrollment and AP coarses. There are very few students who actually care about their grades and going to college. Students should be more motivated to excel. School spirit is basically inexistent primarily due to the strict rules that are in place. The guidance department is very helpful and interactive.", 'This is a sport school, and a large majority of the coaches are incredible but like every school you have a few knuckleheads.', 'A large majority of the teachers Ashley has had are incredible. Her Freshman English Teacher brought out Ashleys hidden talent and passion of writing.', 'Policies are always updates and in place its up to the staff and administrators to execute those policies.']

Most clubs were forced to move their meetings to the morning.  Each class was extended 5 minutes which does not make a difference. Teachers now leave right when the last period is over and don't have to stay. My child passed sophomore year thanks to the extra period(period 11) and now is struggling. All these examples go to show how poorly decisions are made in the school. The board of education and administration does not care about the opinion of parents or students. They don't evaluate all outcomes and possibilities. Parents and teachers voice their opinions, but nothing is changed. Besides that, Bound Brook High School has improved academically. They offer dual-enrollment and AP coarses. There are very few students who actually care about their grades and going to college. Students should be more motivated to excel. School spirit is basically inexistent primarily due to the strict rules that are in place. The guidance department is very helpful and interactive.", 'This is a sport school, and a large majority of the coaches are incredible but like every school you have a few knuckleheads.', 'A large majority of the teachers Ashley has had are incredible. Her Freshman English Teacher brought out Ashleys hidden talent and passion of writing.', 'Policies are always updates and in place its up to the staff and administrators to execute those policies.']
column6: ["My daughter was fortunate to choose the High School she attended through the School Choice program offered in New Jersey. Although her classmates since Pre-school went to the local High School, Ashley, through research and site visits choose to attend Bound Brook. The opportunities she has been offered in this new school have been endless, from the classes she has been able to take and the small class sizes to the extra curricular activities she has joined. Ashley was a student who disliked writing but because of her Freshman English teacher, she has found her passion and hidden talent. Now we can't stop her from writing. The administrative team is very approachable and visible. Now every school has the teacher that has his/her own agendas and Bound Brook is no different but we have been lucky enough to only have to deal with a few of them, so far. The High School Ashley was supposed to go to was larger in size and had many more clubs/activities, not to mention only being 5 minuted from home. Bur during her site visit and attending some sporting events, Ashley witnessed some disturbing events, such as open use and distribution of narcotics, which made her feel unsafe. We are blessed to have raised such an incredible young lady who can make wise decisions and not be drawn in by peer pressure. When she announced she was not going to the local HS with her classmates, many of her friends stopped talking to her, including her best friend since Kindergarten.  You can imagine the sorrow this cause her, it broke our heart. But after being in Bound Brook 3 years so far, she says it was by far the best decision she has made.  Bound Brook is a great High School with many great students, teachers and parents. Not many parents are active in the school because of the area demographics, many work two jobs to support their families and others do not speak English", 'Not very informative that there are any', 'The parents of the students should be involved more', "The teachers are good but don't seem to challenge", "I don't know too much about the safety in this school, but from my personal experiences, it is pretty average. There is really nothing more I can say about it.", "Athletics are very popular and supported in this high school, but other clubs really don't get much support or promotion at all. The wrestling and football teams receive a lot of support from the school and receive money as well. However, as a member of the robotics team, we don't get any kind of support at all—not even moral support. Whenever robotics is mentioned around the athletic director or the assistant principal, they would laugh at our faces. The superintendent of the school district even laughed at a student's face when asked about varsity recognition. In short, I believe all the school really cares about is athletics and could care less about other activities such as robotics.", 'What I like most about this high school is the diversity in the students and the robotics team. Besides that, there is nothing really so special. Classes are limited and the staff treats students as if they are still in elementary school. The school really does not prepare the students to go to college because they treat us like kids.', "There are many good teachers at this school, but there are also many bad ones as well. This high school has always had a weak spot for science teachers, and in my personal experience, they really can't teach at all. However, some math and English teachers go above and beyond and show the students that they care about them and their success in the future. Most of the other teachers are just average and don't stay after school to help out kids.", "There aren't as many extracurricular activities in this school. That could be because we are such a small school that not many people have the time to do a lot of clubs or will join some of the clubs. For example, we have a debate club but there are only 5 students who are in it. If there were more kids who were interested in clubs then that would make extracurricular activities better.", 'My past four years in this school have been a roller coaster ride. I came in as a freshman trying to explore all the opportunities bound Brook high school had to offer. Now that it is my senior year I found my self only liking a handful of clubs. Now, I am ready to move on from this school and move on to bigger and better things.', 'This school does try to be at an equal rate wi society but does struggle a bit. Some teachers will give you lessons that you are going to remember for a while, others you find yourself zoning out on them talking. There are only some clubs that I could count with two hands, and sports I could count with one. Overall, this school is tolerable, but needs to improve a bit.', 'very fun to be with at this school', 'This school is great for making you go forth', "Every teacher at Bound Brook High School is very engaged with every student. Some students don't even know this but, a lot of teachers put a lot of work into their teaching technique.", 'Not that good at all', 'Not that good of a review at all', 'There are a lot of drug problems and promiscuity within this school system not only including the students but also the staff.', 'it sucks, like i wish we were able to go out for lunch as juniors or seniors', 'when new jersey adopted the HIB polices it didnt allow for growth and develop it instead creates babied student', 'the people in charge dont like it when teacher go above and beyond if their not the ones getting the credit']

column2: ["There is no sports for students which is a downfall as students do not participate in any eca programs. Teachers have no control over students. Deans behave like they rule the world. And don't make me start about the students. A great advice from me. I am stuck her due to some reasons. Do not send your child here if you love them. If you don't this school is your number one option.", "The school has changed drastically over the years and morphed into a stage  of faculty against faculty and students without anyone who can truly be there for themIt's sad to see things go wrong but safety isn't among their top prioritiesIt seems as if the administration is more preoccupied with their own agenda rather then the lives of those in front of them", 'The school was very small which made for better connections and not feeling overwhelm in a big hs. It was in a nice area and had many resources near by.', 'I was part of the class of 2016. The teachers were good. I felt underprepared entering college. There are better high schools in Queens. The HS curriculum could have been more rigorous.', "What I liked about my high school was I have made a lot of good friends. It was a very nice experience. There's a lot of nice and cool teachers there. But, since our old principal has retired, we have gotten a new principal and let's just say our senior year wasn't a very good year. They have been a lot of bad changes. He's been firing a lot of good teacher because he thinks that they're too close with the students. I hope the seniors now will try and make their last year a good year.", 'This is an amazing school, teachers are friendly and fun to learn from. Subjects all vary from chemistry, to art, to theatre. This school is a place to learn from, either friends, faculty, or staff and  by the sports and activities given. I truly miss this school, and its diversity, and family like feel.', 'Something I like about High school of Applied Communication is the amount of diversity and the changes being made in the school. Diversity  plays an important factor  because it can being amoung the student to work togther cooperatively. Another positive factor is the school offers more ap classes and college ready class these are essential to the student future education. Something I like to improve is to create more clubs and after school activities, the school seem to lack these things. Creating more clubs can helps a student resume and actually help the student get involved in a variety of fields and improving their social skills and other essentials.', 'Faculty and staff really care and lookout for their students. They push students to exploring things outside their comfort zone which allows them to grow and aim higher.', "My four years at the High School of Applied Communication were great. We consider ourselves to be a small family because of all the familiar faces we see and greet everyday. You know all the teachers and students and everyone knows you. It offers great Art and Academic programs, as well as advanced college courses. We have combined sports teams with the other two schools that are above and below us. The school is constantly working on ways to make the school better and offering more things. If you're ever looking for a high school to go, this is the place to be.", "If you want to do well in high school you will. It's up to the you, the student, to decide on taking the most challenging courses available. I'm currently a  senior and my experience has been great. My senior class is very loving and we are like a big family. It has been rare seeing a conflict spark up and if it does it's minor. I feel safe walking into school, during class, and while going from class to class. Since it is a small school, I was able to build really close bonds with the teachers and ask for help, advice, and anything in between. I was part of Cross Country and Track and Field, I got a great sense of athletics in the school and I can say there is no judging based on your physical abilities, in fact, other students help you become better. Diversity at this school can be better, but everyone is very accepting of each other regardless of race, sexual orientation, gender, and religion. My time was great.", 'I felt prepared enough to know how to go about college and what to expect from my professors as well as what they will expect from me.', 'The teachers are absolutely amazing! They make you feel comfortable and will stop at nothing to make sure you are excelling in the class and understanding the material. They have different teaching styles which can be a little difficult to follow and engage the students as much as possible.', "The food is okay. There are some options that are really tasty and others aren't favorites. I do praise the cooks and school lunch helpers for their hard work considering I had experience working in a school kitchen.", 'There are many different ethnicities present and everyone is accepting of everyone as well as people who demonstrate other sexual orientations.', 'Tutoring is always available from both the students and the teachers. The guidance counselor always has open ears and parents are as active as their lives allow them to be.', 'I believe administration can be a lot more strict in disciplining the students.', 'At this school, the safety agents are A1 and do their part in making sure everything and everyone is safe at all times. If they suspect something is wrong, they will observe and may notify the guidance counselor, assistant principals or social worker.', "This school is combined with two other schools since it doesn't have that many students. The team performance is always in tiptop shape especially in wrestling! The student body is very proud of our teams and their accomplishments are always shared with everyone during morning announcements.", "If I could go to this school and do it all over again, I wouldn't change a thing. It's a big family that accepts all different people and cultures. This school has a very loving and encouraging environment. My favorite experience is all four years that I went through this school from totally hating it being that I wasn't use to a one floor school to me totally loving it and wishing that I didn't have to graduate.", "I will admit that some teachers are more challenging than others. The workload isn't too bad unless you are enrolled in an AP class that involves more challenging work and a lot more work. The teachers are wonderful and give their all in making sure you understand the concepts and pass the class."]
