column2: ['My school is really good in academics It has really nice classes and great teachers but something I would like to change about my school is the how should students behave in school. Students should behave mannerly, politely, and respectfully to everyone.', 'Overall William L. Dickinson High School was a very diverse school but lacked college readiness in the English department which stunted my growth as a incoming college student. The social experience you gain from attending Dickinson is unique to the various cultures in within the school.', 'I loved the diversity of the school, I learned about so many cultures and different kinda of people. I also got views from people from wealthier backgrounds and less fortunate backgrounds. I did not like how loosely they teach, and how little they communicate, it could be much more efficient and there could be a greater focus on the school work.', 'I have learned a lot in Dickinson, not only toward academics but also towards life. Dickinson taught me how to deal with situations wisely and the smart actions to take. I learned a lot from my teachers and from the environment around me, I learned that you have to be focused because if you fall, you set yourself up for failure. This school made me who I am and I believe that If I would have went to any other High School I wouldn’t have learned half of what I know today.', 'William L. Dickinson is one of those few schools where I found academics went along with extra curricular activities. The staff are really helpful. Students get problems very often but the school manages it well. Diversity Honor Success fits the school well.I just hope more clubs are opened in the school so that students get opportunities to be engaged .I would recommend this school to new students who seek for better future.', 'I’ll begin by saying the things I don’t like about Dickinson. To begin with the late rooms are terrible because how you get detention from being 4 minutes late but not 20, they just take an absence which you can make up. Secondly, there are many motivating and education involved students which are a positive influence but, many others can be involved in school activities and sports and always try to involve you in drama and negativity. Lastly, it’s plain and simple, some teachers are just rude and the food is terrible. Overall, I try and focus on the positive the funny and motivational teachers that try and help us progress to college as well as the good friendship made with optimistic people.', 'My experience here was alright. I honestly thought it would absolutely be like the show Degrassi.  But, instead it is the opposite it can be like a bit of like the show an idea what high school can be like.  I had my ups and downs but it is part of life to deal with highschool and mature within overtime. Overall it is a safe school. I like how they had a CPR class which i am highly interested. I want to be expose in these type of environment and be able to prepare in life when necessary. I want to see less diversity. I just feel comfortable and how i like to try to be in a bit of a less diverse school.', 'Great school overall, just needs to work on its communication with parents. Wonderful faculty and staff, most teachers are extremely helpful and will stay after school in order to help students. Really diverse crowd; no student would ever feel like they are "different" or being left out.', "William L. Dickinson high school is an amazingly diverse school. It exposes you to a variety of cultures and ideas. It's not a typical school where kids are mostly oriented by the similar goals. Here you come across very complex, unique, smart, not excluding, troublesome individuals. It's up to a student to make the rational decisions, hang out with the good crowd and work hard to pursue their dream or goal. Staff is encouraging and will assist you. All of the teachers that I encountered were amazing. However, the part of the school that I wish was different is the spirit. DHS doesn't have a strong school spirit which makes it somewhat boring for most kids here.", 'The teachers are really good and the overall education part is great. I would like to see some type of renovation to the entire school since the buildings are really old. It would be great if the school was modernized. The school itself is really good but being in Jersey City, some students were part of or joined gangs and got into fights and a lot of them didn’t really care about school and kind of ruined everything for the majority of the student body who actually did care. The uniforms were also a pain.', "My experience was awesome. I learned a lot of things which got me ready for my future.Some teachers were awesome and very helpful. The only thing i didn't like about this school is that the students fighting caused so much distraction to the studies.", 'Mostly everyone knew each other. Enjoyed going to school because of the teachers and students. Even with bad reputation that is given for he school i can say It’s the best high school in the district. You get to experience different cultures since It is the moat diverse school in the district. I have no regrets spending my four years in high school there i couldn’t ask for more then what i received.', 'I have heard many negative responses about Dickinson before I became a former student, which is all very very unstable and judge mental, for in Dickinson I have learned to carry the responsibility on my own, learning to find the right career for myself, respect diversity and honor, yes it isn’t true in Dickinson we have some trouble makers but that doesn’t ruin the school because some silly ones that don’t know how to act are messing everything up for the rest. I love Dickinson don’t regret a day being there, thank you to all the teachers who put effort and making us the mature ones we are now', 'This school is amazing. Teachers there are always willing to help you. There is a lot of AP courses available to those who like to challenge themselves through their course of their High School career.', 'This is my senior year at Dickinson and has been a treacherous journey. There were good moments and bad moments but overall i think My time at Dickinson has been a wonderful experience.', "Dickinson High School is a good school for the students who want to learn. The school is very big so it's really hard to be able to get one on one time with teachers if you need help. The biggest issue is the administration, sadly they only do the bare minimum and it doesn't seem as though they care about the students, they mostly care about what the school looks like to other people like their bosses. The teachers get treated unfairly, and a lot of school events or even basic information are just unorganized.", 'I have attended Dickinson High for about 4 years. I have participated in many sports and clubs provided by the school. Everyone gets along and teachers help the students when they need it the most. The school is very diversified. There are many cultures that come together under one building and see that is extraordinary.', 'What I loved about William L. Dickinson was the huge diversity within the students and staff. It truly is such a special and different experience to attend a school where you can learn about so many different cultures and traditions.', 'I’ve only  joined this year so far, however the experience has been mostly amazing. The students  are nice and most of the teachers actually do what they’re supposed to do, teach. However some teachers have been a pain as they refuse to either teach and or decide telling their life story  is a better replacement. I also had a mishap with my grades that was entirely in the fault of the attendance office as it cost me an A in a course I worked hard for. All in all, save for a few teachers, this school is lovely.', 'Dickinson is a wonderful place to obtain your education and a place that allows you to branch out into new things that are usually out of your comfort zone, along with that, Dickinson also brings your typical peer-to-peer conflict.']

It exposes you to a variety of cultures and ideas. It's not a typical school where kids are mostly oriented by the similar goals. Here you come across very complex, unique, smart, not excluding, troublesome individuals. It's up to a student to make the rational decisions, hang out with the good crowd and work hard to pursue their dream or goal. Staff is encouraging and will assist you. All of the teachers that I encountered were amazing. However, the part of the school that I wish was different is the spirit. DHS doesn't have a strong school spirit which makes it somewhat boring for most kids here.", 'The teachers are really good and the overall education part is great. I would like to see some type of renovation to the entire school since the buildings are really old. It would be great if the school was modernized. The school itself is really good but being in Jersey City, some students were part of or joined gangs and got into fights and a lot of them didn’t really care about school and kind of ruined everything for the majority of the student body who actually did care. The uniforms were also a pain.', "My experience was awesome. I learned a lot of things which got me ready for my future.Some teachers were awesome and very helpful. The only thing i didn't like about this school is that the students fighting caused so much distraction to the studies.", 'Mostly everyone knew each other. Enjoyed going to school because of the teachers and students. Even with bad reputation that is given for he school i can say It’s the best high school in the district. You get to experience different cultures since It is the moat diverse school in the district. I have no regrets spending my four years in high school there i couldn’t ask for more then what i received.', 'I have heard many negative responses about Dickinson before I became a former student, which is all very very unstable and judge mental, for in Dickinson I have learned to carry the responsibility on my own, learning to find the right career for myself, respect diversity and honor, yes it isn’t true in Dickinson we have some trouble makers but that doesn’t ruin the school because some silly ones that don’t know how to act are messing everything up for the rest. I love Dickinson don’t regret a day being there, thank you to all the teachers who put effort and making us the mature ones we are now', 'This school is amazing. Teachers there are always willing to help you. There is a lot of AP courses available to those who like to challenge themselves through their course of their High School career.', 'This is my senior year at Dickinson and has been a treacherous journey. There were good moments and bad moments but overall i think My time at Dickinson has been a wonderful experience.', "Dickinson High School is a good school for the students who want to learn. The school is very big so it's really hard to be able to get one on one time with teachers if you need help. The biggest issue is the administration, sadly they only do the bare minimum and it doesn't seem as though they care about the students, they mostly care about what the school looks like to other people like their bosses. The teachers get treated unfairly, and a lot of school events or even basic information are just unorganized.", 'I have attended Dickinson High for about 4 years. I have participated in many sports and clubs provided by the school. Everyone gets along and teachers help the students when they need it the most. The school is very diversified. There are many cultures that come together under one building and see that is extraordinary.', 'What I loved about William L. Dickinson was the huge diversity within the students and staff. It truly is such a special and different experience to attend a school where you can learn about so many different cultures and traditions.', 'I’ve only  joined this year so far, however the experience has been mostly amazing. The students  are nice and most of the teachers actually do what they’re supposed to do, teach. However some teachers have been a pain as they refuse to either teach and or decide telling their life story  is a better replacement. I also had a mishap with my grades that was entirely in the fault of the attendance office as it cost me an A in a course I worked hard for. All in all, save for a few teachers, this school is lovely.', 'Dickinson is a wonderful place to obtain your education and a place that allows you to branch out into new things that are usually out of your comfort zone, along with that, Dickinson also brings your typical peer-to-peer conflict.']
column6: ['I attended William l Dickinson highschool from 2013-2017 its a  very diverse school. The teachers majn focus is to help you grow into a mature studebt whose ready to face the world upon graduation.', 'My experience at William L. Dickinson High School was very good. There are a lot of people you will meet from different countries. A lot of the people are very friendly.', 'My experience at Dickinson High School was enjoyable and I had a great four years. The education I received was great, the teachers were great, the facilities were not as good and I hope that changes as the years go by. The safety also needs to improve a lot of fights and troubled young students.', 'William L. Dickinson High School offers free AP courses for which you can take the AP exam for free. The students are offered jobs and programs that can help them move in the right track. There are also many clubs and sports to get involved with school spirit.', 'This High School offers good programs such as the COOP program that helps students gain experience in the workforce as well as whatever career they are focused on. Unfortunately, the school is also plagued by mischievous students that cause many fights and can make it unsafe for other students. Regardless, the school does have dedicated teachers that are dedicated to students who go there to learn and prepare themselves for the post-high school challenges whether it be the work force or college.', "Great school and great staff. However, many of the students are not motivated to learn. Attending this high school hasn't influenced my readiness for college. Entering college has shown me the drastic difference between students who do want to learn, and those who do not.", 'I was studying at Dickinson High School for past 2 years of my high school life. It was great experience at Dickinson High School.', 'I had great experience at Dickinson Highschool, i learned plenty of things that have helped me in my college experience. My peers and teachers would always want to see e succeed which helped with getting through the semesters. Although Dickinson has a bit of a bad reputation, if the students works to their potential, stay focused, and communicate with teachers then itll be a great learning experience, i wish i could go back and re-do my four years. My highschool has shaped me in to a smart and successful individual. On top of all of this, its a highly diverse school, which helps you see a little of multiple countries around the world, and helps us understand how multicultural our city is.', "The school's diversity was amazing. It reflected on how the city was very diverse. I enjoyed being part of the swim team and swimming competitively. The sports that this school has to offer are also diverse and it has many clubs and activities for student engagement.", 'Amazing!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍', "Spending my last year in my high school will be a hard yet stress relieving experience. Although it has it's flaws, it is a beautiful, giant, and diverse home for everyone.", "This high school had one of the most diversed atmosphere. Classes and teachers make different learning processes. It's a nice experience.", " William L. Dickinson High School has thousands of students. It is actually the first high school in the jersey city district. This building wasn't a school at first,  it was made as a hideout for the World War II. There is a significant amount of history and memorable for the school. Now, since it's only a high school, it teaches English, history, math and sciences.  Since this high school is named home of the sciences, it is the top best science department in the school. There's also a lot of electives you can choose from. For example, comparative beliefs, creative writing, sculpture, etc. Also, there's a lot of clubs you can join such as student council,  palisade press, etc.  Far from that, there's sports you can join like soccer, bowling, and track for both girls and boys. There may have been disagreements with students that results into fights, but that doesn't represent the school. This school is one of the most diverse, lovely places you can be a part. ", 'Liked - a big array of courses to chose from and the numerous clubs change- to switch to rotating schedules.', 'They are there you just need to ask around', "You can meet great people but also people you'll regret sharing air with", 'You can come across with great inspiring teachers but also some not so pleasant teachers', 'There is a lot of students from different backgrounds and people are very accepting about it. The diversity is great and the amount of people one comes across is amazing as well as the experiences one encounters with them.', 'There is advisors one can speak to if bullying is occurring or if problems at home occur to an individual which is helpful. People rarely search for the help though ,due to the fact that they are either shy, afraid or simply lack of trust. There is metal sectors at every door for the safety of students and security guards walking the halls at all times. It feels safe in school.', "There's a variety of extracurricular activities ranging from clubs to sports. Its great actually because you get to be involved in something which keeps you active. Theres sports such as soccer, track/field, football,basketball,volleyball, swimming, fencing, tennis. Also the clubs range from student council, math club, diversity club, poetry club, national honor society, newspaper club and many more."]

column2: ['M y experience at bronx river high school has  been great so far.  The teachers are great help. Im currently a senior inn this school and for the past three years things been challenging, the teachers help student get thru it.', "I like how they greeting the students and make them feel safe.and how they're helping the senior to sure they are on track to graduate on time.", 'There are good teachers but a lack of opportunities within this school. With  pre-calculus and chemistry as the most difficult courses offered, Bronx River appears to stray from competitiveness. It would be nice to see a music program. However, this school is very big on having everybody graduate, and that must be appreciated.', "What I liked about this school is the teachers and staff who were very friendly and helpful throughout the years I've been their.", "My experience so far in Bronx River so far is alright. It's nice to have a college prep class provide to help with the college applications process. However, I really dislike that there isn't enough teachers in the class for students to get the help they need. Some classes are filled with 30 students, which makes it difficult to the teacher to teach especially when they don't know how to control the class. A few teachers in the school aren't very fully experience so students aren't able to learn alot about the subject which is difficult because it's reflects heavily on regent score.", 'I am a student in Bronx River High School, and everyone welcomed me so well. I was a little nervous in the beginning when I was coming to this school, but the students, and staff all opened up to me, I felt comfortable. The teachers are all great !', 'I have been attending bronx River High School since freshman year and so far it has been amazing. The teachers have been great all school year long helping and getting students ready for college. Bronx River offers a lot of clubs that many students attends which can be everyday or twice a week.   I have been enjoying the extra help the school have been providing from blue engine. The betas from blue engine are there for you all the way to help you understand and know the work well, no matter the subject because they are there ElA, math, and so on. One thing i admire about the school is the field trips. The students such as myseif get to go on so many field trip, it can be a college trip, six flags, Yankee game, or anything fun. The school sometimes and when they can get after school activitys where students and myseif attends and we recieve community services hours. However, Bronx River High School have been a excellence choice for me in which it have been getting ready for college.', 'I liked the tight-knit community and the fact that the principal and teachers of other campuses know your name. I would like to see a change in the attitudes toward students by teachers.', 'What I liked most about Bronx River is how it is a new school and as the first graduating class, I was given the opportunity to create clubs and get to know the teachers on a personal and professional level.', 'I like the teachers and the staff of the school. I would like to see a better classroom curriculum among the teachers.']

['I’m currently a senior at Gramercy. The staff is so nice. I fell in love with every teacher I had. They care about you. I wish the students cared more about the school. I wish the teachers could do more about disruptive students in class. It’s on the 7th floor and the elevators didn’t always work. It doesn’t really feel like a high school because there are no lockers. Offer a wide range of classes for such a small school.', 'the people who attend and work there are nice but the guidance counselors barely help students with the more important life things', "It's a one of a kind school with friendly teachers, students full of personality, as well as a great atmosphere when you enter the campus. Gramercy Arts High School is really a school that will stick with you, even after you graduate.", 'I wish my school provide more hands-on experience because I think  high school supposed to be preparing us for  College and the real world but they don’t offer that and they don’t even offer all Different type of arts beside visual arts and drama.', 'Gramercy Arts high school is full of fun personality and let’s kids be themselves. That Have have opened more clubs to help kids express themselves from the LGBTQ club to an all girls coding club to a go green club. We also participate with the YMCA where we go on college trips and have a safe space during and after school', 'I’m a junior and to be honest I love it. If you don’t mind loud and sometimes disrespectful kids sometimes than you’re fine. The teachers can spot kids who are trying hard so you’re not left alone.', 'Gramercy Arts High school gave me so many opportunities and it helped me develop and improve skills I once did not have! This Highschool introduced me to programs such as Big Brothers Big Sisters which is a college readiness program. Helped me with my confidence that I joined the drama club and even performed in numerous shows. My communication skills improved from 9th to 12th grade. Lastly, teachers make sure you’re really learning and understanding the material handed to you!', 'looking back as a current senior, being at Gramercy has filled me with many experiences I will never forget.', "I would like to see the dynamic between  students and teachers change. Some teachers act as if they don't care about there job and there are only a hand full of those who do.", 'This school is so lovely.We offer art,dance,vocal,and theatre as majors. We go on lots of trips and we meet new people through trips, plays and musicals.', 'When I first came to the school I didn’t really feel a warm welcome it was more of a Your expected to no what everything should be about. And access to only 2 elevators really slows things down', "I am currently attending this school and I must say this school has made college a big topic since freshmen orientation. This school has an amazing mock trial program and very little sports for students to have an opportunity to participate in extracurricular activities instead of just attending school and leaving. Many of my friends auditioning for dance & singing during the audition process and got into the school for these majors but when attended were told that the school only offers Visual Arts and Theater Arts which is fraud in my wyes. Many of the students here don't get the chance to attend colleges besides CUNY & SUNY and I question this a lot.", "Gramercy Arts high school is like many schools around, had their pros and cons.  A positive part that gramercy continues to carry is how they like to bring their small school community together by allowing students to be involved in school decisions.  Allowing them to take a stand.  Although the cons still stand, one thing negative about gramercy is the staff.  First coming in and with my four years I came to realize that staff at gramercy lacks more motivation than the students.  Which doesn't really help the environment they are already is, this causes the whole school to feel as if a cloud is always following.  In my opinion gramercy arts high school can still improve in many ways, but honestly I don't see a high school reunion happening for the school ever.", 'I rate my Experience at Gramercy Arts High School with Five stars! because being a student and at gramercy Arts has change my life completely, I have become someone far from the the first year I step into the school. I have become part of Gramercy and Gramercy has become part of me, Just like gramercy has influence me I try to influence it too, by join the clubs that the school offers. one of the clubs that I like the most is the SGO (Student Government Organization), which has allow me to have a bigger voice in the school since I was announce President. I have the job to lead school activities and other stuff, I would recommend anyone to come to Gramercy arts. You will not regret it.', 'I liked the opportunity to create clubs that did not exist when I first entered the school. The support of the faculty and administration helped the clubs like Newspaper and Student Government get started.', "Some of my teachers were very nice and helpful. My energy of the school could be better. The school could be cleaner. The should have more clubs or activities for students so they can enjoy themselves while they're here.", "What I like about Gramercy Arts High School is you feel accepted in the school and you don't feel left out or different than anybody. They have great acting, dancing and vocal classes.", "When I first entered this school I was welcomed with a positive environment. Sadly over the years my school has cut a large portion of the art programs and all that is left is visual arts and drama. It feels as if the school is less of an arts school and now a regular high school, it's very disappointing.", 'What I enjoy about my experience in Gramercy Arts High school is that, the principal is very involved in the school and she actually listens to the things the students complain about. My school has gotten a brand new lunch room and it is very comfortable and gives you a restaurant feel to it. There is more of a variety now and the food tastes better. Also, I value the time made to give us talks about college and our future, and that our school administration is very understanding and is open to any idea we bring to the table. I highly appreciate the efforts made to keep a united and positive school.', 'I am going to start with the cons of gramercy, when first entering I was very confused on the environment tensions but then as years passed the school environment because very comfortable, the pro is how much the school has actually improved over the years.  I am very proud.']

column6: ['it is just the start for 9th grade for my child & I but i do have to share so far our outcome is nothing but positive. I love the fact my child ( said she enjoyed going to school ) is is always great too hear! and to top if from what we have been introduced too so far is awesome  the teachers  feel very Educated and outstanding personalities! we are looking forward to seeing where our high school takes us! i like to thank all the teachers along with Mrs. Di cicoo & Mr. Patterson.....', "I am currently a sophomore in Gramercy Arts High School and I really like my school. I think the people there are fun and inviting. Certain teachers are amazing and their classes keep you engaged. Whereas there are others that simply give you the material, explain it a bit and they're done. Which isn't necessarily a bad thing but its things like that, that make learning boring. The school itself is small on a very large campus so everyone knows each other which is pretty cool. When you enter the building you have to go through metal detectors which is annoying but its for safety so it's understandable. The process is just so slow so I would appreciate it if they added another metal detector to speed up the process. Overall a good school I would recommend.", "Gramercy Arts has been, in my experience, the first time I have ever felt this free within a school.  The students are loud, only because of their confidence and firm beliefs. The students are dreamers, and are not limited to what they fear or cannot do, but what they know they do not want to do. Other schools I've seen are at times seemingly assimilated, in how they are driven only by academics and no other source of passion, and their strangely and scarily similar sense of success; becoming a doctor/lawyer/therapist etc because that's what seems to bring in the most stable money, or what their parents want. The transition from those kinds of schools to Gramercy, with its sanguine, unique environment, with each student being so individual with clear character and strength, was the most confusingly, unexpectedly, yet positive thing to happen thus far.", 'Students at Gramercy Arts High School were given the opportunity to truly bond with teachers and lead their peers if willing to take on the responsibility. However, Gramercy would improve if the arts were taken more seriously and better facilities were provided to truly allow the arts to emerge.', 'As a freshmen coming to Gramercy arts, I was very excited. With being a theater major I made sure I participated in every production and did everything it took to get more involved within my major. But as time progressed the urge to come to school declined and I just lost interest.  Certain changes at my school I would like to see, such as hoe the academic system is controlled and also having enough funds for all of the majors. As well as having teachers in the school that genuinely care', "I'm a junior in Gramercy Arts High School and my experience has been pretty good. All my teachers are very respectful and kind. When I need help (personal problem or a school problem like homework or class work) my teachers have always helped me out in any ways they could especially the deans and guidance counselor.", "The school lost its drive. It's not the same as it was when I first started attending, and it breaks my heart to see it this way. Despite the name of our school, the arts department is slowly crumbling down.", 'I like that the school is small so you can know people better, however sharing the building with different schools can be crowding, especially the sharing of elevators and the use of stairs just to get to our floor making people late for class. With the rule of being late once resulting in detention, that will not encourage students to come to class instead skip the day or not go to school at all to avoid being late and getting detention for at least showing up.', 'I would love to see more school pep rally!!!! Something student government sets up. To bring our students together and excited to start each semester.', 'When I first started Gramercy arts high school it was a really cool place. We were all like family. There were tons of clubs and after school activities. We saw many Broadway shows and off Broadway shows. The staff there are pretty decent with an exception of a few who suffer from slight problems which cause them to constantly be absent or not perform well in school. As the years past the school got worst we went through about 3 principles and every year they changed and cut programs out of laid off some of the best teachers we had. But i did what i had to do and set goals for my self so i can leave and graduate on time with a decent grade.', 'After spending 3 years in Gramercy Arts High School, I am proud to say that I am student of this high school. I would not be an honors student without the help of my teachers and staff of the school. Without meeting new people or classmates, who are now my trusting friends, I would not have these memories during my time in this school. I would not be where I am today without being a student of Gramercy Arts High School. Therefore, I am more than thankful for the support that the community of my school has offered me.', "When I first entered this school I was welcomed with a positive environment. Sadly over the years my school has cut a large portion of the art programs and all that is left is visual arts and drama. It feels as if the school is less of an arts school and now a regular high school, it's very disappointing.", 'Gramercy arts high school gave me an experience of self expression, wide education, and opportunities. This school consists of outstanding teachers that work with you and love their students. The environment is very open and vibrant and friendly to all along with giving many activities and shows.', 'My experience in this school was good. I like the teachers in this school because they teach you a lot of things that you may not have known. The change that I would like to see is to have more performing art programs.', 'I loved that it was completely a performing art school . The dance program was great when Ms.Eubanks worked there. Teachers are nice.', "It's average no better or worse than any other public school.", 'This school have the right ideas in terms of what can make it better, fun and more productive however the people in charge are unorganized and some seem to be unqualified for their positions. Perhaps a changing of the administrative staff as well as academic staff may make for a healthier school environment for students. Also I believe that all majors such as the dance, musical theatre, vocal and band departments SHOULD BE RESTORED this was supposed to be a Performing  Arts and Visual Arts school SO LET THERE BE ART!', 'There are little to no outside activities, clubs or organizations for this school. There was LGBT meetings every Friday night but that only lasts for two weeks. The YMCA use to come up to our school and help kids but they stopped discontinued their visits last year and has not come yet', 'My overall experience was definitely just that, an experience! I have learned the rules of Respect For All, and how important it is to help the community in any way I can. Being in this school for four years now has given me the proper growth I needed to move forth with a successful career', 'There are a few teachers who really truly care about the students and then there are some others that are extremely rude, and disrespectful and constantly gloating about having a Masters Degree']
column8: ['it is just the start for 9th grade for my child & I but i do have to share so far our outcome is nothing but positive. I love the fact my child ( said she enjoyed going to school ) is is always great too hear! and to top if from what we have been introduced too so far is awesome  the teachers  feel very Educated and outstanding personalities! we are looking forward to seeing where our high school takes us! i like to thank all the teachers along with Mrs. Di cicoo & Mr. Patterson.....', "I am currently a sophomore in Gramercy Arts High School and I really like my school. I think the people there are fun and inviting. Certain teachers are amazing and their classes keep you engaged. Whereas there are others that simply give you the material, explain it a bit and they're done. Which isn't necessarily a bad thing but its things like that, that make learning boring. The school itself is small on a very large campus so everyone knows each other which is pretty cool. When you enter the building you have to go through metal detectors which is annoying but its for safety so it's understandable. The process is just so slow so I would appreciate it if they added another metal detector to speed up the process. Overall a good school I would recommend.", "Gramercy Arts has been, in my experience, the first time I have ever felt this free within a school.  The students are loud, only because of their confidence and firm beliefs. The students are dreamers, and are not limited to what they fear or cannot do, but what they know they do not want to do. Other schools I've seen are at times seemingly assimilated, in how they are driven only by academics and no other source of passion, and their strangely and scarily similar sense of success; becoming a doctor/lawyer/therapist etc because that's what seems to bring in the most stable money, or what their parents want. The transition from those kinds of schools to Gramercy, with its sanguine, unique environment, with each student being so individual with clear character and strength, was the most confusingly, unexpectedly, yet positive thing to happen thus far.", 'Students at Gramercy Arts High School were given the opportunity to truly bond with teachers and lead their peers if willing to take on the responsibility. However, Gramercy would improve if the arts were taken more seriously and better facilities were provided to truly allow the arts to emerge.', 'As a freshmen coming to Gramercy arts, I was very excited. With being a theater major I made sure I participated in every production and did everything it took to get more involved within my major. But as time progressed the urge to come to school declined and I just lost interest.  Certain changes at my school I would like to see, such as hoe the academic system is controlled and also having enough funds for all of the majors. As well as having teachers in the school that genuinely care', "I'm a junior in Gramercy Arts High School and my experience has been pretty good. All my teachers are very respectful and kind. When I need help (personal problem or a school problem like homework or class work) my teachers have always helped me out in any ways they could especially the deans and guidance counselor.", "The school lost its drive. It's not the same as it was when I first started attending, and it breaks my heart to see it this way. Despite the name of our school, the arts department is slowly crumbling down.", 'I like that the school is small so you can know people better, however sharing the building with different schools can be crowding, especially the sharing of elevators and the use of stairs just to get to our floor making people late for class. With the rule of being late once resulting in detention, that will not encourage students to come to class instead skip the day or not go to school at all to avoid being late and getting detention for at least showing up.', 'I would love to see more school pep rally!!!! Something student government sets up. To bring our students together and excited to start each semester.', 'When I first started Gramercy arts high school it was a really cool place. column1: Middlesex County Vocational & Technical School (MCVTS) - Perth Amboy
column2: ['In my opinion, I feel like Perth Amboy Votech can be better than it already is. There are just a few errors in the education they provide. Some students aren’t able to take specific classes and the academic teachers teach differently. It was a good 4 year experience. Do i regret it? No , it showed me what my real passion was , with was to proceed with the major I had chosen.', 'The school itself was fairly easy to get though, without many activities to challenge the students. Readiness for the world and college after graduation were not really taught. As much as group work was fine almost every assignment was done in pairs which did not challenge us students. Shops classes gave a bit more detail into the career we had chosen.', 'All the teachers and staff are willing to provide help at all times. Any students that seem depressed or down will be approached by caring counselors. Since it is such a small school, about 300 students, everyone knows who you are and your name. All the teachers will get to know you pretty fast. Most of the students are good influences. Ms. Debra Haghighat is a great teacher and guide whenever you have trouble with assignments. The gym teachers are always interacting with the students. All the career choices that the school provides will set up any student who wants to succeed at great future.', 'Teacher are great and the school itself is new. small school with only 300 students. you get personalized treatment. people actually care about you.', 'I like that I get to learn a certain trade, preparing my self and being ahead of others once I have to go to college.', 'Vo Tech was a very small quiet school. There were no altercations and everything was very safe. A lot of kids came from different towns so we have people from other places to talk to. Overall it was a very good school!', 'MCVTS in Perth Amboy is a small school, which I did not mind at all. There are a lot of activities hosted throughout the year. Overall, it\'s an "ok" school. The education is not the best and neither are the teachers. Out of all the teachers I had while I was there (for four years), only about 3 were good teachers.', 'its a great place to be in.', 'There are always different healthy food options for the students. There is a sandwich station that provides us with different combinations of our choice. A salad bar is also always available with different choices of vegetables everyday. The meals always change but stay in a healthy range. All of the snacks sold are healthy and low in calorie.', 'Sports take a big role in this school. A big portion of the school students are involved. Every team always have their teammates support. The coaches are excellent trainers. Our gym facilities provide many activities for our physical and education class. Any student has access to the weight room as well.', "The safety system at my school is highly important. Everyone in the building uses their ID's to get in and nobody else is allowed with out signing into the school at the main entrance. There is always a police officer during school hours at all times for any case of emergency. Once you walk out of the building the only way back in is through the main entrance. All side doors are remained locked at all times. Cameras are provided everywhere in the hallways. During fire drills and lock downs, there is always a plan in case of emergency.", "In my school there isn't many choices when it comes to after-school programs. Tutoring is available for some classes but mostly in the morning before class. Sports are a very big part of my school after classes. They provide practices during the season and some also ahead of time during the summer.", 'Attending the Perth Amboy-Tech has been a great experience. It has given me four years of experience in the Culinary Arts field which I am looking forward to continue as my career in the future. Excellent and involving teachers and staff members.', "Sports were very great at that school, if we didn't have a sport the main school did.", 'Academics were great, the teachers all knew what they were talking about. Except one or two.', "The staff was great but the disciplinary actions that are set up by administration just don't work.", 'My school was something like a dream. It was a great school to go to!']

['This high school is very basic, but does offer a lot of opportunity for students interested in the business field. There are a lot of internships, events, and speakers for students to take advantage of. However, the curriculum is quite regular and not very challenging.', 'The Business of Sports School gives students lots of opportunities to get a head start in their future plans after high  school. They prepare students very well for major test such as the SAT and also have an excellent college process. Boss gives internships at many different places ranging from the sports industry to criminal justice. They well prepare us as entrepreneurs giving us business classes, training us to be Microsoft certified and getting a CTE endorsement when we graduate.', 'I like how the Business of Sports School prepares its students for college. We have a great college counselor and team of staff that have supported our journey to college since our first day as freshmen. The curriculum that is taught at my school is like no other because it challenges us and prepares us for what college has to offer. I believe that my school could improve on students interaction with each other and making sure students are more engaged in the schools community.', "It was life changing, it was something I'd never thought I would do but that school changed my approach on life and help guide me into my likings.", 'Business of Sports School, gives a tremendous amount of opportunities to their students as a freshman all the way to sophomore year.', 'It was okay, the school is advancing as the years go by. The curriculum is pretty good and the teachers seem to care for the most part.', 'I really enjoy most of the teachers in the school. Alongside with this the school offers large amounts of opportunities for students to have. We get to meet celebrities and interact with people who work to help get a better understanding how the work place is.  I would like the school to remove kids who disturb the learning of those who want to learn from the classrooms and place them in a separate classroom', 'BOSS is a school in which have changed my perspective on life and the things around me.The diversity of this school is amazing and you can interact with different types of people and personalities.The academics are what helped me think about my majors and what i want to do in life and the connections helped me see the reality of this world.I have met many people who have made it to the top of the food chain thanks to this school.Although the food can be better it this school offers many opprotunites for students like myself to ensure they stay on the right path and grow up to be a outstanding individual.', "For the most part it's a really good school even though it has its regular political issues, it still is able to get their student out with a degree and knowledge they need to succeed . One thing this school does specialize in is connections! Every single teacher in that school has some type of connection to someone of importance in the real world, so this school has taught me that connections is key because you never know whinyoubcould be speaking to.", "The Business of Sports School offers several extracurricular opportunities at this school such as, Morgan Stanley, Big Brother Big Sister, iMentor, JROTC, etc. These organizations, not including JROTC, give students the opportunity to be partnered up with a mentor that can help them with whatever they need and help keep them on track. They also prepare the students for the business world. Most of the students, as well as adults working with these organizations, are committed. Why? Well because they make it fun, making the students want to continue to attend. As for after school activities, there are a lot. Majority of them being sports. The school's name attracts many student athletes. A few teachers attend the games. Overall, BOSS has amazing extracurricular opportunities.", "My overall experience at the Business of Sports School was definitely not the best high school experience. I won't sit here and say it was the worst because I did have quiet a few memorable moments at this school. For example, all the college trips they took us on. Allowing us to see the college's campus and ask any questions that we may have. One of my favorite experiences was being a part of the NFTE Business Challenge's. I gained so much experience and knowledge of the business world. This is what makes our school unique. I wouldn't choose this school again because unfortunately, not all kids are able to participate in certain activities because the teachers all tend to favorite a certain group of students and they do a poor job at hiding it. There were several trip and activities that allow us students to gain knowledge and experience, but the same kids who usually get chosen are the only ones who get to attend these things. The school's staff needs to be less bias and give every child a chance to prove their capabilities.", 'The teachers at the Business of Sports school aren\'t the worst teachers, but I can definitely say they aren\'t the best. A vast majority of them will stay after school, if necessary, and/or come in on Saturday\'s for students who would like extra help. The rest of them will do whatever it takes in order to get you out their face. Most of the teachers teach the same and use the same "teaching style". One teacher who decided to do things her way, was eventually fired. Most of them are educated and know what they are talking about, but of course make mistakes. There are definitely favorites through out the school and the teachers to good job at showing it. The teachers at The Business of Sports School are also very bad at keeping students grades up to date. A website called Pupilpath allows students, as well as their parents to view their grades, attendance, etc. The only problem is the teachers fail to keep that grade updated. For example, if the grade is a 65, they won\'t change it until it is too late for the student to hand in any late work. The staff at BOSS also do a poor job at getting back to parents and responding to emails.', 'the reason its great because of the new experiences.', "They're not extremely rigorous but they're pushing!", "Teachers won't stop until they know you comprehend", "It's all about what you make of it. I made friends", 'There are a number of school safety guards around!', 'Teachers are always willing to stay after school and help students that require tutoring or extra help. They not only stay after school but they also refer students to outside sources that could potentially help them as well. The high school also has SAT prep help and college advisors are always readily available.', 'The deans and assistant principal enforce the rules as much as they can. They approach students with a dignified manor and are far from rude. When students do not follow the dress code and are "showing too much" their parents are called and asked to bring the student clothing. If there are extra school t-shirts around then the student will receive that. When events occur that do not follow school policy the principal and administration take all necessary measures.', 'The gymnasium is fairly large and students love to attend the basketball games during the season. There is no football field so we have no football team, while the baseball team uses the yard outside or the local park. Our weight/fitness room has some of the best equipment available for students.']

column1: Brooklyn Secondary School for Collaborative Studies
column2: ['I’ve been apart of Brooklyn collaborative for 7 years, I’m honestly a bit disappointed that my school didn’t provide me with all the essential resources to prepare me for college. The math program is seriously flawed for starters. I don’t remember learning much in any of my algebra/geometry  classes. Beyond that, pre Calc and calculus was a complete joke. I  guarantee  that almost everyone who graduates from BCS will have to take a beginners elementary Algebra course in college. What I really enjoyed about Brooklyn collaborative  despite it’s flaws  was the community feel of being in a smaller school. You were able to have a relationship with the teachers and everyone new you by name. Also the English program was pretty good, PBATs teach you how to expand your ideas on a concept which is a good skill to bring to college. Overall I do recommend this school, just make sure you’re in a pre-college program...if not, I strongly recommend a  tutor.', 'Brooklyn collaborative is a great school but required more discipline as well as having teachers engage with the student to better their teaching skills.', 'I feel like there isn’t enough teachers and there should be a change in how teachers teach, giving students a packet and telling them to do it themselves with texts books and then giving them a test after each packet is just not working, Students feel like they aren’t learning anything. What’s the point of a teacher if they aren’t going to teach? Visual learning is best and teaching the students each lesson plan is ideal for students to actually learn. You ask why students aren’t scoring high enough on these math tests and SATs ? because this school doesn’t actually teach beyond Algebra 2. There’s pre calc with one teacher and there isn’t an actual calculus teacher because there isn’t enough math teachers to teach it.', 'The school itself is fine. The teachers are great and helpful but at the end of the day I think students make the schools what they are rather than the teachers. Most of the students in this school have no respect and seem to have little education in what manners are. They can get violent and verbally abusive. I had and have great friends there but at the end of the day there are some messed up people that walk down those halls. I think they should have some type of stronger counseling system.', 'I have meet some of the most dedicated teachers at Brooklyn secondary school for Collaborative Studies who are willing to stay after school to help students with homework, essays, and projects. Despite some of the curriculum not being on par with other schools, the teachers do there best to prepare you for college with assignments and activities that build your character rather than focusing solely on academics. This is done through presentations, internships, and the teacher assistant program that help to develop the students into independent leaders. The students here are very energetic and outgoing.', 'The school has influenced a lot of students to go to college and provides outstanding work. Students show care into there work and provide such effort that they really want a future for themselves.', 'I have been here since freshman year and my experience has been mediocre.  The only "best" part of my four years here is getting the opportunity to be apart of the Global Glimpse program where I went to Ecuador and had the best experience of my life. Other than that, the teachers are qualified, the college counselor (Karlette) has been a joke lackadaisical  when it comes to submition to colleges and the food is terrible.', "I love the different types of classes that other schools don't have. I also like how we have PBATs instead of regents. The only thing I hate would be the kids who go to our school.", 'Brooklyn School for Collaborative Studies promotes interactive and outside of the classroom learning. Teachers are closely connected to students which builds a lot of trust in their relationships and opens lines of communication for better learning.', "The Brooklyn Secondary School for Collaborative Studies is a school that helped me build a ton of character. I've became a great writer and very outspoken, they allowed me to be myself and never to go unheard. I enjoyed the Expeditionary Thursdays because it gave us a break from classes as well as going to different places outside of our comfort zone. As every typical alumni I wished that they gave college credits and AP classes when I attended there instead of afterwards. Lastly, I wish the athletes had more publicity and networking.", 'Great school. 100% college bound students almost every year. Excellent teachers very understanding and intelligent.', 'It’s very diverse and comfortable. I feel very safe and welcomed. The diversity is a really important thing because it’s taught me about a lot of different religions, ethnicities, and even preferences.', 'Learning is made easy in BCS. The teachers only advance onto the next lesson when everyone has understood the current topic. They pay attention to your strengths and weaknesses and teach accordingly. They also offer help during lunch and after school as long as there are no meetings. They students are friendly and there is no problems with interaction. There are plenty after school activities to participate in.', "BCS was a school that motivated and pushed me to my best and to always strive for greatness. Every assignment was to get me ready for college assignments. PBATs weren't easy but now in college I feel prepared to write 5 page essays easily. The teachers there really care about their students and deserve respect.", 'This school has given me so many opportunities.', 'This School actually makes you believe that you can and will be something great in life. No matter how messed up your grades were there was always someone there pushing you forward. Never letting you give up.', 'Had a very learning experience', 'People mainly focus on graduating', 'Action is taken if kids are not following school policies', 'Most teachers are helpful, and strive their students to succeed']

You were able to have a relationship with the teachers and everyone new you by name. Also the English program was pretty good, PBATs teach you how to expand your ideas on a concept which is a good skill to bring to college. Overall I do recommend this school, just make sure you’re in a pre-college program...if not, I strongly recommend a  tutor.', 'Brooklyn collaborative is a great school but required more discipline as well as having teachers engage with the student to better their teaching skills.', 'I feel like there isn’t enough teachers and there should be a change in how teachers teach, giving students a packet and telling them to do it themselves with texts books and then giving them a test after each packet is just not working, Students feel like they aren’t learning anything. What’s the point of a teacher if they aren’t going to teach? Visual learning is best and teaching the students each lesson plan is ideal for students to actually learn. You ask why students aren’t scoring high enough on these math tests and SATs ? because this school doesn’t actually teach beyond Algebra 2. There’s pre calc with one teacher and there isn’t an actual calculus teacher because there isn’t enough math teachers to teach it.', 'The school itself is fine. The teachers are great and helpful but at the end of the day I think students make the schools what they are rather than the teachers. Most of the students in this school have no respect and seem to have little education in what manners are. They can get violent and verbally abusive. I had and have great friends there but at the end of the day there are some messed up people that walk down those halls. I think they should have some type of stronger counseling system.', 'I have meet some of the most dedicated teachers at Brooklyn secondary school for Collaborative Studies who are willing to stay after school to help students with homework, essays, and projects. Despite some of the curriculum not being on par with other schools, the teachers do there best to prepare you for college with assignments and activities that build your character rather than focusing solely on academics. This is done through presentations, internships, and the teacher assistant program that help to develop the students into independent leaders. The students here are very energetic and outgoing.', 'The school has influenced a lot of students to go to college and provides outstanding work. Students show care into there work and provide such effort that they really want a future for themselves.', 'I have been here since freshman year and my experience has been mediocre.  The only "best" part of my four years here is getting the opportunity to be apart of the Global Glimpse program where I went to Ecuador and had the best experience of my life. Other than that, the teachers are qualified, the college counselor (Karlette) has been a joke lackadaisical  when it comes to submition to colleges and the food is terrible.', "I love the different types of classes that other schools don't have. I also like how we have PBATs instead of regents. The only thing I hate would be the kids who go to our school.", 'Brooklyn School for Collaborative Studies promotes interactive and outside of the classroom learning. Teachers are closely connected to students which builds a lot of trust in their relationships and opens lines of communication for better learning.', "The Brooklyn Secondary School for Collaborative Studies is a school that helped me build a ton of character. I've became a great writer and very outspoken, they allowed me to be myself and never to go unheard. I enjoyed the Expeditionary Thursdays because it gave us a break from classes as well as going to different places outside of our comfort zone. As every typical alumni I wished that they gave college credits and AP classes when I attended there instead of afterwards. Lastly, I wish the athletes had more publicity and networking.", 'Great school. 100% college bound students almost every year. Excellent teachers very understanding and intelligent.', 'It’s very diverse and comfortable. I feel very safe and welcomed. The diversity is a really important thing because it’s taught me about a lot of different religions, ethnicities, and even preferences.', 'Learning is made easy in BCS. The teachers only advance onto the next lesson when everyone has understood the current topic. They pay attention to your strengths and weaknesses and teach accordingly. They also offer help during lunch and after school as long as there are no meetings. They students are friendly and there is no problems with interaction. There are plenty after school activities to participate in.', "BCS was a school that motivated and pushed me to my best and to always strive for greatness. Every assignment was to get me ready for college assignments. PBATs weren't easy but now in college I feel prepared to write 5 page essays easily. The teachers there really care about their students and deserve respect.", 'This school has given me so many opportunities.', 'This School actually makes you believe that you can and will be something great in life. No matter how messed up your grades were there was always someone there pushing you forward. Never letting you give up.', 'Had a very learning experience', 'People mainly focus on graduating', 'Action is taken if kids are not following school policies', 'Most teachers are helpful, and strive their students to succeed']
column6: ['We have basketball, softball, soccer', 'The schools keeps to its rules about dress, behavior and discipline. No one really gets away with braking the main rules.', 'The teachers here are passionate, caring and helpful, they make it their duty to teach every student in the best way possible.', 'Our school has an internship program for all high school students junior year. Everyone learns about networking and gets work experience through an internship. There are the sports teams, student council, and students often fund-raise for educational trips. Teachers are almost always available after school.', "There is a real safety effort. There's an anti drug counselor, there is school safety constantly patrolling, and advisers always talk to students about safety and risky behavior.", 'Middle school and High school share a library, they also share three computer labs. The guidance office is almost always open and the counselors are cheerful and ready to help anyone.', "Public school food has never really had a good rep, but I think the school is making an effort to meet everyone's needs.", 'We are just starting to get PSAL teams so things in terms of sports are moving slowly, but are coming along. The students and parents are supportive.', 'I felt the school was small and because of that there was a small community, so not seeing or interacting with new people often was a bit tough. What makes the school unique are its core values, leadership, persistence, collaboration.', 'Our curriculum is good, we cover as much as we can in as much time as we have. The academics could be stronger.', "I've never really needed the school nurse.", "I'm only in 2 so I can't really judge.", 'I wish I had come to this school in the 9th grade as opposed to the 11th.  I love everything about this school.', "The food will fill you for the moment. Bring cash to eat out around the neighborhood if you can, you'll be glad you did. The neighborhood offers good food you will be much happier with. If you're a vegetarian, good luck in the cafeteria!", 'This school will definitely open you up to a lot of possibilities. Keep a strong, determined head and you will make it through without a hitch. The teachers will always be there for support if you need it.', "It's pretty good here. You can join the band, drama club, and even a sports club that lets you create your own skateboards. What's not to enjoy?", 'The Teachers are caring and help the students out when needed. One thing I like about Brooklyn Schol for Collaborative Studies is the amount of help the teachers give us. The school it self can get some updates such as cleaner bathrooms and more room for the high school being that this school has a middle school and elemenatry school in one.', "The school is a small community school in caroll street, where everyone knows about everyone like family. My experience in the hs will not be forgotten, the teachers make a student feel comfortable, want to learn more, and when a student is failing they take their free time and use the time to help a student progress. and the grading policy is fair. Not only do they teach the students the 4 years, but they also prepare us for whats beyond HS years such as writing long similar college papers (pbats). The college counselor is an amazing person and has this passion for motivating his students achieve their college dreams and goals. Visit the school and you'll feel like home!", 'This school offers many programs you just have to work with the person involved with them. Programs such as the The Center for Leadership and College Preparation, affiliated with Bank Street College of Education, where they help a student with academic recources. Prep for prep ( a non profit group) helping students achieve to attend top colleges. An organization where I feel students should take the opportunity so try it out!- Free Arts NYC where the program offers Dance, painting, photography- this helps a student realize hidden skills.', 'The school maintains its building in good shape, there are some things to work on with construction, but everything else seems good. The students have acces to internet, library. Guidance counselors find the way to make more time for someone needing help. The community is very influentail.']

column2: ['The teachers are great and passionate about what they teach. Not only the teachers but all staff care for the students and want nothing but the best for all students. Over the past 2 years they have been making improvements to the school; putting in new air conditioners, new practice field behind the school, and improved lunch.', "I loved the drive my other peers had and encouragement we gave each other so all of us could reach our goals. Also, the administration is always finding ways to improve the school, the academics, and to improve the students' experience for all.  Our extracurricular activities were always very good, our performing arts and athletics are state recognized like the track, wrestling and football team.", 'My school can do better but overall the teachers and staff are all friendly and I myself have formed many binds that I hold dear and would like to keep once I graduate because when I look back I want to be proud my my highschool life.', 'I like the school diversity. This school gives me the opportunity to experience different cultures, regions and ethnic back rounds. This helps when going into the real world where you will experience many different people in the areas i may eventual travel to. The only problem i have with this school is the food services which could be modernized with current selections that the students and faculty would enjoy. Also healthier options should be a priority to the school to help keep the students on a healthy dietary plan', 'Rahway High School is an average school. It has many opportunities and good characteristics such as all of our clubs/activities, sports & diversity. However, it lacks in areas such as the food & could improve when it comes to college readiness & parent involvement.', 'Rahway High School has a lot to offer academically. when it comes to the teachers everyone has a different way of teaching the teachers are unique in there own way but many students have a hard time adjusting to the different was the teachers teaching  when it comes to culture and diversity we have kids from pretty much everywhere you learn something new from a different culture everyday. although the food could be way better it s over priced for the kids that have to pay it is no worth the money.overall this school has its pros and cons but thats every school its a great school to learn and also meet new people with different personalities.', 'I did like the fact that there were some students and teachers that had things in common with me. However I tried my best to stay to myself and avoid conflict. So my feelings are pretty neutral. I had some good and some bad experiences like everyone else.', 'Overall, Rahway High School is a good school. There are teachers who will bend over backwards for their students because they really want to see them succeed. It’s a diverse school filled with students from many different backgrounds. My biggest issue with the school is the lack of budgeting. For every single club, the students are forced to fundraise for EVERYTHING. There’s a huge lack of support for the arts from administration, especially for the marching band and other music-related activities. Like many other high schools, if it’s not the football team, they don’t care. The food here wasn’t that great either. The portions were the same as the elementary schools, but way more expensive. Rahway High School is an average school, but definitely needs some improvement.', "Overall, the teacher at rahway high school are amazing.  I wish they offered more language and AP courses in the school. They should update their technology and then provide it for those who don't have it. I wish they kept up to modern times a little more.", 'Very diverse experience with caring teachers. Physically the school is dated and technology is an issue. The school offers many clubs and after school extracurriculars.', "Rahway high school is a school that's diverse and rich in knowledge.  It is a school where many are able to discover who they are and who they can become.", "Now that I'm a senior at Rahway High School I had a great time learning there. I've made great friends, the teachers are great and understanding and there school productions are great too.", 'I am a senior at Rahway High School and my experience has been good. Teachers and counselors have always been there for me in my journey.', 'Rahway high school might not have the best academic nor do they have a high college rate but the thing it does have is a great faculty group that actually care about students fully. The memories made her are unforgettable this is a school i recommend it you want your child to truly enjoy there high school experience.', 'Rahway High School was big and diverse but when it came to fixing problems within the school they were terrible.', 'It’s an average high school experience. Resources are good. I feel as though counselors should be more hands on though.', 'I enjoyed my four years at Rahway High School. I was apart of every club you could think of from debate team, to Blue-Tri. We are such a diverse school and the district definitely accommodates that. We have over 30 clubs and 12 sports teams that its hard to not get involved in something. We have a great Performing Arts program, as well as one of the Track and Field and Wrestling program in the state. Academically we have numerous amounts of Honors and AP level classes for students who enjoy challenging themselves. If a students wants a diverse school, this is definitely the one for them!', 'Overall most teacher try their best to give you the best information for that subject. I especially love the AP Biology course. I learned a lot. The staff members are friendly and the guidance counselor really help you out. You can definitely get involved. There’s a lot of clubs and organizations.', 'Now a senior, Rahway has been really good to me. All of our teachers have a passion about teaching their students. A few of our teachers have recieved awards for being outstanding in the classroom. I will be forever grateful to my teahers that helped me to this point in my educational career.', 'Overall good experience i enjoyed it nice individuals very diverse atmosphere and have teacher who care, excellent special education department as well as athletics.']

column6: ['Our school is relatively safe. Any visitors who enter the building through the main lobby are required to sign in and are escorted to their desired office.', 'Our after school activities at Rahway High School are filled with sports, art, chess, outdoors, key and many different varieties of clubs. My personal favorite is outdoors club where we go hiking and have an annual snowboarding trip to Pennsylvania.', 'Parent always find time in their schedules to come and support the sports and even our small orchestral performances. Our community is pretty small so many of our parents know a lot of the students by name', 'Most teacher puts their students first and enjoy coming to work everyday. Despite their bad days they still try to incorporate a smile on their students faces.', 'Many AP courses are available for students to choose from each year.', 'Many offer their own time to assist students while some do the minimum.', 'I loved my high school years.', 'Could use much better teachers', 'Rahway prides itself on the achievements of their athletes.  Historically, the high school does well in track, wrestling and football.', 'The principal and his staff offer sessions throughout the year to assist families with a variety of high school level agendas.  They are always available through emails or phone calls and that makes you feel connected with your child to deal with any issues or inquiries that you may have.', 'The teachers make themselves available for extra help and are extremely encouraging to students.  They build a safe and inviting relationship between themselves and the students and treat them like growing adults.', "There is an abundance of activities made available to the students,  Unfortunately there just isn't enough time to partake in all that you might be interested in.", 'The school employs safety officers, anti-bully specialist and performs frequent drills of safety at the school.', 'i got through 4 years.', 'I am  still in one piece after 4 years', 'Some things i wish i could change about it.', 'if its edible they serve it.', 'They work to give good disciplinary precautions to prevent problems', 'They supply a sport for everyone. They do not discriminate anyone.', 'From what I remember, most organizations were great especially our drama and theater club has won multiple awards and achievements. My high school was well known for their shows, but also the french and Spanish clubs would take trips to restaurants and events that were mostly french and Spanish related.']
