Yet in the ones that i have participated have provided me with a lot of fun"]

column1: FDNY High School for Fire & Life Safety
column2: ["i Must say it wasn't easy starting a new school in a new neighborhood. But the passion of the teachers the care of the principle helped me get my diploma. The push the positive feedback and encouragement meant a lot. i would not have graduated if the staff and my mother would not have pushed me. It's living in the projects the constant drug dealers alcoholics and young parents that made me realize it's all in the people who care for you. And that's what They did.", "My school makes it very possible to make a complaint to the school safety or to any of the adult when there is a problem in the school. They make sure that we are safe and that there's no bullying on campus.", "My school offers a lot of extracuctivities and after-school activities. it's a great environment.", 'High school was so much fun I want to so much interesting things that will help me in my future career.', 'The teachers are okay, and some actually make learning interesting.', 'So much gang violence and fights', 'You can become an Emt after high school.make a lot if money', 'We have an opportunity to get a job after hight school', "Its not what it should be but it's okay.", "I have learn so much throughout my almost 4yrs there.  The academic classes are great.  What has been the best was all the different activities I became a part of, those included JROTC, EMS, EMT, Track n Field, Representative of our student Government.  On top of all that i was able to maintain my 4-0 GPA for the 4yrs.  I've had so much fun in this school with all my extracuricular activies and class trips, it has been a great learning experience and very rewarding.  If I had to choose again i would."]

['Park Slope Collegiate is a small, but close-knit high school where you can achieve what you need and always feel happy being there.', 'This school sucks! Kids older than me running around in the hall ways, teens saying inappropriate language and the principle most of all, does nothing about this situation. Other teens smoking marijuana on the daily. Please, do NOT send your child here, especially not for there teenage years.', "My daughter started in the 6th grade here and we've been super impressed with the curriculum, the school espirit de corp, and the commitment of the teachers to knowing the kids and helping the learn. I appreciate their flexibility in letting kids learn at differing levels.", 'This school was the last resort for me. Only standard level courses are offered at this school. This fact became more and more troublesome as the time came to apply to college. If you want to be a competitive applicant at selective schools, do not come here. When some students in my graduating class asked why it is that there are no honors or AP courses at the school, we were told that our administration believed these classifications to be "discriminatory" and would not incorporate them into our curriculum. Some courses prepare students to perform well on Regents Exams, others did not. I would earn A’s in class and barely pass the exam.Staff also try to upkeep a productive environment through an emphasis on a strong work ethic (in many classes). There are good volleyball, basketball, and swimming teams at PSC.This school may be a good fit for students who want a more laid-back high school experience. This was not the high school for me, I\'m glad to be over it.', 'It is an excellent public school. The staff is amazing. They love and care about the students. The diversity in this school is the best thing. Students learn and connect with all these different cultures is really amazing.', "Park Slope Collegiate was a last option for me. What I did like about it though was that the teachers cared very much about you. They didn't only care about your grades but also about your mental and emotional health. You were important no matter who you were when you attended that school.", "Coming Into park slope collegiate was very different for me. During my freshman year, I had a hard time adjusting but I think that happens to every freshman. By the end of my sphomore year, I became more productive and more involved. Now that I'm a senior, due to this school I have become a activist, and I stand for what I believe is right. I slacked during my junior year but my counselor during my senior year guide me through the whole college process, and now I'm soon to be a freshman in college.", "Park Slope Collegiate is a very good school and Hebrew teachers take pride in helping their students. And that's what I love about this school.", "Park Slope Collegiate accept all type of kids as they are. School diversity is really important for us. We are big in expressing how we feel, we basically protest about all injustices that's going around the world. All 4 years I enjoyed how small the school was. The teachers always have time for us, they always there to listen to our crazy, sad, personal stories. We are like a big family. Our school is limited from resources, the gym barely have balls, our textbooks are dated compared to the school that is predominantly white (Millennium high school). But after all I could say our school is more diverse from the other school at John Jay campus", "I love the school. It's a small school but, there's a community. Everyone is like a family. Everyone knows each other.", 'Teachers are engaging, compassionate, and understanding. T', "I don't lie, the scanners at the school to me it's a waste for valuable time every morning", 'I love the teachers at this school ever since I came to this school they have treated me with love and constantly push me to be the best I can be. The quality of teaching is good but the teachers are very devoted to there work', 'It is a overall okay school. The teachers care to see every student graduate on time, but they are not as outspoken as they should be', 'My experience is how they get us ready for college', 'The school nurses are wonderful and friendly, they do their jobs well. The security offices in the school keep there ship running smoothly. They make sure the students are not playing in the hallways, they defuse fights when they happen or even before they start. Health class is very informative; they health teacher makes sure you know the risk of certain actions. For example, if you are sexually active, she makes sure you know that you can get pregnant or infected. She makes sure you know how to keep yourself safe. When I was attending the school or even when I am visiting I feel safe. Truthfully, if I didn;t I would not step a foot in the school until I was sure I was safe.', "we have this program called the S.A.S.F. and they have many clubs. They are very welcoming to the students and I believe to students that don't attend my school as well. We have some clubs in our school during school. I would say the most popular and active club is Student Government. I would say the students that join these clubs are very committed unless something causes them to terminate their involvement with the club they are in. But overall I would say that they definitely have options.", "I would say that the staff as in terms of the principal and assistant principal are very active with the student but still shows them that they are in charge. The guidance counselors are very down to earth, they give the students feelings as to where the student wouldn't mind approaching them. Bullying or any type of violence is not tolerated. We don't have a dress code. Everyone is pretty hands on and friendly. I have never came across problem anywhere in the staff.", "I feel like no one is absolutely prepared. But I can say I was 50/50 prepared. My school doesn't have a lot of resources but they try to prepare you in work ethic wise. I don't have a lot of money and I know what it is like to struggle really bad, so I would say I felt really prepared for the real world. College enhances that feeling because when take the chance to move away from home; you become even more independent. But overall I feel 85/15 percent prepared after I graduated!", "I would attend this school again because there is a wide diversity of students. Also because the teachers are wonderful. I would say that everyone has one favorite at the minimum. Everyone makes you feel welcome even though this school has had so many budget cuts. Even though we don't have a lot of clubs and choices of different sports, we are a strong and supportive school. We also have two schools in one. Middle and High School. You should definitely attend this school or visit this school so that you can get your own feel for it!"]

column1: Urban Assembly School for Media Studies
column2: ['I like that my school is very diverse, and challenges all of our students to do well and keep up good grades.', 'I am an alumni who is currently working at the high school that I graduated from. The Urban Assembly for Media Studies molded me into the self motivated and continuously evolving individual that I am. I learned that it is my responsibility to step into an atmosphere and try to make a positive contribution even just by being present. The importance of networking and holding myself accountable is also something that I learned. Even when I would get in trouble, the adults would reprimand me but not change their view of me. I was human, I am human and humans go through transitions... especially in high school. The administration and teachers pushed me to want more for myself and believed in me times when I did not.', "This school has provided me with a few opportunities such as jobs and internships. It has also helped me to make the decision for what major I want to pursue in college. However there aren't many opportunities to get involved in the school. As a result when an opportunity does comes students aren't interested in being involved.", 'In UAM there are teachers who give you good advice. It’s like another home. A lot of people focus on their grades. I hope that UAM improves on their economics. I want to actually experience how to fill out taxes not to Just read about it. I want to learn these things before I actually experience it myself.', "I was the first graduating class for this school. I can't speak for it now but then it was really disorganized and needed a big readjustment.", 'I liked the schedule that the school goes by. My school starts at 9 and ends around 2:40. The timing wise is really comfortably compared to the rest of the schools I have been to. I would want to change the look of the school. The school does not have many colors and is pretty dull.', 'Urban Assembly school for Media Studies helped me to be more outgoing. The staff and teachers are reliable, friendly and hardworking.', 'This was my high school, some of the best 4 years, the location is also great there is plenty  things in walking distance.', 'I like that Urban Assembly for Media Studies is very inclusive when it comes to opportunities for all the students. They’re also filled with staff and teachers who not only care about the students education but their well being.', "I'm am going to be a senior this year at Urban Assembly for Media Studies and I would say that overall I've had a very good education here. Teachers are very welcoming and easy to communicate with, they challenge you to do better and really motivate you to work hard. The students are kind and friendly, there are clubs that you can join to meet new people. At the school there are trips and dances which is really fun. Overall, Urban Assembly for Media Studies is a good school that I'd recommend to anyone.", 'Small classes, good teachers, close-knit environment, teachers and faculty make it easy for students to feel comfortable talking to them outside of class and/or about more personal issues.', "This school has a lot of extracurriculars but they're all held at the same time so students can only be in one school-sanctioned club which isn't particularly good.", 'Teachers at my school try very hard to help students learn and progress with their schoolwork and to adapt to teaching different types of students.', 'I am currently involved in Student Council. I started my junior year of high school and I will continue throughout senior year. This club has funding so the students can create fun activities that the whole school can be a part of.', 'The school tries to provide a healthy range of food.', 'The sports are fun and great to participate in. School spirit is always high as students always attend games supporting their friends and fellow classmates.', 'Students are challenged with their work and always have help when needed.  Teachers give work that help students get ready for college.', 'School administration can be strict at times but try to provide a friendly environment.', 'Teachers at this school develop a great relationship with students. They are easily approachable and are always willing to help you whenever you do not understand a lesson or topic.  Teachers make sure you are prepared for college.', 'We offer challenging classes like AP and Honors']

column2: ['Quest is a very diverse school that involves students and teachers from various locations. It embodies different cultural backgrounds that allows peers to learn about each other. This school’s academic approach is average and does not offer as many AP courses. However, the persistence for student success is very inspiring. The community can improve overall, but foundation at where it is currently at stands at a solid stand point.', 'Quest has its many pros and cons. Being here since freshman year has taught me a lot, and although I may have had better education elsewhere,  I wouldn\'t say that I entirely regret coming here. During freshman year we had a different principal, who honestly made the entire year not as productive or organized as it should have been, but I was able to acknowledge the diverse friends that I still remain close with. I have learned that it is really up to yourself to get things done. If you don\'t find out on your own, you wont be told about what you need to do to have a good profile for college. Participate in activities when you can, stay focused and don\'t be a fool of yourself just for "cool" factors. Good grades are simple to achieve, try to find summer opportunities in the city, and definitely look into colleges early. quest is pretty alright if you choose the right crowd and just do what will benefit yourself', 'Going to Questo To Learn was an interesting experience. The students weren\'t involved in the school so it was not a fun environment to be around since everyone was in their own world. Overall the teachers were great and I made close relationships with the majority of them. I give Quest To Learn three out of five stars because in my personal experience in my 9th-10th year we didn\'t have a real principle, and we had a "fill in" and the school was a mess. Ever since those first two years quest has been very disorganized, but in my senior year we got a new principle who is realy changing the school for the better.', 'I really enjoyed my high school expirence at Quest to Learn. They people are open minded and I always feel free to be myself. There are some down fakls though, for one the space is cery limited being that we share our building with 5 other schools. Also, due to the lack of space we are not able to have some activites other students may have. Over all the expirence is good.', 'Quest to Learn used to be a school known for innovative teaching techniques but over the course of the last three years it has become nothing more than just your average high school. There were a lot of administrative issues which caused a lot of teachers to leave. Quest lacks communication, drive, and commitment.', 'The school safety gets there job done as well as the health department we have. Students are kept safe in school because the safety prevents problems from occurring.', 'There are many different afterschool programs that students may attend and a great amount of students do so.', 'The school year has gone really well as of now.', "The teachers are respectable and are always on top of their work. They support the students in all activities as well as after school programs. They're also very helpful when a student is misunderstanding an assignment. They keep in touch with students by sending emails out letting the students know if they aren't attending for a week, also through emails they send notes and or assignments to students.", 'Everything is unprepared and rushed, the staff is always leaving to get better jobs, and the students are so bad.', 'I have gone from middle school to high school and never had a problem. Also, I am considered a role model for other students.']

column1: Broome Street Academy Charter High School
column2: ['What I liked is the freedom. I transferred to Broome street academy the middle of my senior year and quickly noticed the differences in both the high schools. My old highschool didn’t allow dress down or cellphones but Broome Street Academy does. With our cellphones, I noticed how helpful and distracting it could be. Whenever I was stuck with something, it was easy to just use my cellphone to help and in a way , it taught me how to self teach. Having dress downs made me realize how different everyone was. I mean, we all expressed ourself with our clothing. No one looked the same, we all had our own unique style. We all stood out individually.', 'the teachers and staff are all great people whom only want to see you succeed in life and if you build a relationship with them an alow them to do there job you will they all are exceptional teachers ready to support you through high school and collage', 'My experience has been a good one. The school currently doesn’t have a gymnasium but the have found alternatives. The staff has been extremely supportive to the students. This year has had quit a bit of staff changes.', 'I love the “champ” model they have basically an adult you can bond with and talk to. I would like to see the way they make schedules change.', "I enjoyed my overall experience and I have hopes to further my education. The school doesn't give u a high school feel due to the type of building but the environment tries it's best", 'Everyone is welcoming. You can be yourself, diversity between everyone such as ethnicity, gender, sexuality are good.', 'This school is terrible DO NOT SEND YOUR KIDS HERE!!! They have very poor college readiness, by the time it was senior year I was completely unprepared for anything relating to the college process.', 'Broome street academy is a place of opportunity. In the heart of SoHo NY, Broome street academy has many curricular activities; it also has very good teachers. Broome street Academy is apart of the dorr, which helps members with appointments ( it has dental and health care ), it also helps teens get jobs.', 'With all the experinces Ive had in High School Ive had some pretty good laughs the way how these People and Students have made me a better person', 'Wonder full school full of teachers that care about students well being for both the present and the future.', 'I liked how everyone except you for who you are no matter what. They try to push you in the right direction and the teachers show that they care about you no matter what and that they will always be there.', 'It is a very creative friendly environment. The teachers and champion model are the best support system that any student could possibly ask for. The Tech Arts Dept is the best in the High School system in my opinion.', "The school is a great school , but you're pressured to do things even when you're not confident in that specific subject which is uncomfortable .", "It's a great school, don't let the look of it fool you. The staff is amazing and I truly had the best years of my life here. It was great!", 'So many different clubs to choose from.', 'The parents were nice and cared about their child.', 'The school helped me to open myself to new things.', 'The programs available are great I just wish there were more and all equally funded', "I can't even count how many school events we've had! Parents and teachers/staff are ALWAYS getting together to discuss our future, college, choices etc and many more things.", "I love most of my teachers, they genuinely care for my wellbeing. There are a few teachers that this won't apply to but I've had great experiences with most and they're pretty awesome!"]

column2: ['It was amazing and still is ever since I came to lehman I have had the best experience and being a transfer student from africa they have helped shape me into who I am today. Everyone there is very helpful,thoughtful,kind and want the best for you and is ready to be with u every step of the way. It also has a very safe and friendly environment where u can feel welcomed and accepted.', 'The teachers and the guidance department are amazing. There are drug related issues every now and then but, academic-wise, it’s a really good school. There are a lot of opportunities that can set you up for future. You can take classes which, upon completion, will give you certificates from companies like Adobe, C-Tech, and many more.', "In lehman highschool I've improved and had a great highschool experience , education wise and social. teachers are highly determinat on teaching students the best way they can. It is very diverdiverse and safe. it also has a variety of art and technology classes appreciating students with different talents and intrest. One thing I would recommend and wish to be added is  close checkups on students emotionaly and academically, in addition to that, It is very essential to focus on students individually no matter how hard it can gets. schools fueling a student with courage and support will prevent a child from being pessimistic or wasting their future.", 'Hi everyone,      I go to Lehman high school and I will graduate from there in 2019. I have been there more than 3 years.  The most important things I like about my high school is the safety because they have scanners machine that protects us from those people who bring illegal things in school. Before going into the building, they have the scanners in the entry. They scan all students because of our own safety which I really like the most. The thing I want to be different is the lunch because I feel like they should give us little better lunch that we all like to eat.', "It's a mediocre school, although many of the teachers during my time at Lehman were the nicest and most caring teachers I knew. I can't speak for the newcomers and the new administration. Many altercations between students happen in school, but many promising stuff as well. Lehman is a good place for people who love the arts, especially music. If you want to learn guitar, Lehman is the place for you. The art teachers are very promising as well. Dance is also one of its pride, and the Law team is one of the best.", 'I like the diversity of the school. I like the classes. The teachers are very good. I would just like to see more improvements with cleaning the school and the promises made to better the school be kept.', "Lehman high school helped me grow. but Lehman wasn't always the best coming from Dominican republic my first year of high school was tough. teachers doubted my ability to participate in clubs because I wasn't ready or my English wasn't as good as the other students. As years went by I prove everybody wrong and started working on myself to show my fellow classmates and teachers that I had a dream to graduate high school and I accomplish that dream.", 'Well now that we have a new principal , it started of sloppy in 2016 because he was new  but now he is adding more program , so active with the school trying his best to make the school great', 'Cardi B went to this school boi (i like it like like)  This post has to be at least 100 characters btw', 'Lehman College Is One Of The Best Senior Colleges That Is A Part of The City University Of New York. It Has Over 10,000 Students Who Come From All Of The 5 Boroughs . They Offer 50 Undergraduate Programs & GED Programs For High school Dropouts. The Retention Rate For Lehman College Is 70% Which means Modt students who enroll graduate writhin 5 years! Overall, I am proud to be a Lehman college students because it has provided me one of the best undergraduate experiences and education.', 'What I like about Herbert H. Lehman High School is that how the teachers teach and how everyweek you get to do a fun lab for science. What I expected to see was what expected to see when I went to middle school and also new subject and take different electives.', 'I made a lot of good friends here and the teachers are great and very involved with the lives of their students. I would change the flexibility of the schedules. Classes that are not needed are given to the students in order to have a full schedule, which I feel is very unnecessary and adds unneeded weight on students, especially seniors.', 'Attending Lehman high school overall was a great experience for me, I was able to participate in many different activities, Football, Track, lacrosse,  and wrestling.  I was able to create a great relationship with my teammates, Teachers and Coaches which helped maintain me in honor roll all thru my 4 years, At senior year I helped win the first championship for our school. I communicated well with staff members, it was an emotional roller coaster for me, I had my ups and down but I will never forget the greatness of it all.', 'I liked making friends there but it needs better teachers, academics and resources. It is safer with metal detectors but the kids are still crazy. They mostly care about the football team and it makes the other clubs and teams feel bad. The teachers need to be chosen better because a lot of them are given courses with a curriculum they dont know how to teach. Lehman is very diverse and has a lot of mixed culture which is needed in todays society.', 'The school was horrible and dysfunctional before however, now there is a new principal who has shaped the school into a pretty ok school. Mr. Powers truly cares about the students and wants to get the school back on track. I believe that under his leadership, in a few years the school will be a really good school. This school has many sports and clubs to join and offers many AP classes.  Many of the previous teachers were fired and replaced with new teachers.', 'Herbert H. Lehman High School is implementing a numberof exciting changes that involve students, teachers and course sections. The administration is working hard to better align teachers, course offerings, and resources with the evolving needs of the diverse student body.', 'The teachers were very caring and dedicated. Even though they faced a lot of contention from not only the rowdy students but also the complications of the NYCDOE, they pushed through every day to make our experience the best it could be.', "In Lehman high school I had the most amazing time of my life I've made friends that'll never forget I met teachers that never let me fail they did their best to keep me on my toes and always push me to do better. Although I had my issues they were never too serious and I've always had the staff to help me through it overall my experience at Lehman was a great one", 'They do not offer much, they need to offer more so students can have a stronger academic record for college', 'The social scene is normal, most students get along with each other']
column4: ['It was amazing and still is ever since I came to lehman I have had the best experience and being a transfer student from africa they have helped shape me into who I am today. Everyone there is very helpful,thoughtful,kind and want the best for you and is ready to be with u every step of the way. It also has a very safe and friendly environment where u can feel welcomed and accepted.', 'The teachers and the guidance department are amazing. There are drug related issues every now and then but, academic-wise, it’s a really good school. There are a lot of opportunities that can set you up for future. You can take classes which, upon completion, will give you certificates from companies like Adobe, C-Tech, and many more.', "In lehman highschool I've improved and had a great highschool experience , education wise and social. teachers are highly determinat on teaching students the best way they can. It is very diverdiverse and safe. it also has a variety of art and technology classes appreciating students with different talents and intrest. One thing I would recommend and wish to be added is  close checkups on students emotionaly and academically, in addition to that, It is very essential to focus on students individually no matter how hard it can gets. schools fueling a student with courage and support will prevent a child from being pessimistic or wasting their future.", 'Hi everyone,      I go to Lehman high school and I will graduate from there in 2019. I have been there more than 3 years.  The most important things I like about my high school is the safety because they have scanners machine that protects us from those people who bring illegal things in school. Before going into the building, they have the scanners in the entry. They scan all students because of our own safety which I really like the most. The thing I want to be different is the lunch because I feel like they should give us little better lunch that we all like to eat.', "It's a mediocre school, although many of the teachers during my time at Lehman were the nicest and most caring teachers I knew. I can't speak for the newcomers and the new administration. Many altercations between students happen in school, but many promising stuff as well. Lehman is a good place for people who love the arts, especially music. If you want to learn guitar, Lehman is the place for you. The art teachers are very promising as well. column6: ['There are various clubs that are created the accomadate the needs of numerous students around the building.However, in some circumstances students tend to descend in academics due to their dedication to sports and clubs rather than schoolwork.', 'I attended an honors academy that gave me access to different opportunitites that other students did not have acces to', 'Teachers are sometimes to busy to attend to students when they need help. When students come for help they are quite busy with numerous amounts of work', 'My name is Neven and I attended Lehman high school. The teacher there are average, below average in fact', 'There are many extracurricular opportunities when it comes to sports such as football, softball, baseball, volleyball, lacrosse, track, and basketball. Sports are the most popular and fun, but they also require many hours of practice during the school week and sometimes on Saturdays. There also used to be a mentoring program called Peer Group Connection in which Juniors and Seniors mentored freshman weekly through group activities. This program required 45 minutes of lesson plan preparation four days out of the school week. There were also volunteer opportunities in helping the elderly with makeovers through GlamourGals. The National Honor Society (ARISTA) chapter at my school also served as an outlet for volunteer opportunities.', 'Overall, my experience at this school has been good due to the number of extracurricular activities this school has offered me. This school annually hosted a unique show called "Lehman Idol" in which students like myself got to showcase our vocal abilities on stage. Some of my favorite experiences has been volunteering to give makeovers to the elderly through an organization in the school called GlamourGals. I also got to mentor freshman in a mentoring program in the school called Peer Group Connection. I would probably choose this school again if I could do it all over because of all the clubs and volunteer opportunities.', 'The teachers at this school are decent. A few teachers go above and beyond, while others lack enthusiasm. Most of the teachers base their lessons on state standards which sometimes makes the lessons less interesting. Most of the teachers are knowledgeable in their subjects, but a few lack the knowledge in the subject they teach. Most of the teachers want students to do well and offer many extra credit assignments as well as due-date extensions. The teachers communicate well, and some even use a grading website called PupilPath to communicate with students about assignments.', 'The majority of teachers at Lehman carry around a disgusted attitude and look when they are walking the halls. Many teachers do not follow a strict grading policy. They are very lenient when it comes to grading. Teachers at this school also have poor communication with students and their superiors as well. However, a lot of teachers do have sufficient teaching abilities but it is hindered due to the lack of interest that students possess.', 'it is great! there are so many opportunities and club!!', 'The sports are fantastic and most coaches really put in effort', 'A lot of teachers care about the students and the well being. They are dedicated to their work and profession', "There's a Montefiore clinic in the basement, so that's good.", "It's slowly improving, I guess.", 'I feel safe at my school. We have metal detectors.  All dots are kept locked at all times from the outside. Visitors must enter through the main door, go through metal detectors and sign in. I have never felt unsafe', 'I participate in the softball team as well as the school band. For the most part the teachers and administrators are very supportive.', 'As I can only speak for myself, to me school and education as what you, as a student make of it. In all schools you will see good and bad. Whether you have teacher, who in my opinion does teach to the point that I understand. There are disruptive kids, security being an issue. Every where you go, there is something. All that matters is how I handle the pressures of school and education. I for one, I am very strong minded, keep myself busy with sports, music and academics. Would I pick this school again if I had the chance, maybe, because it all depends on me and how I handle myself', 'As per my observation and experience, most teachers care and work hard to help the students. However, it is also difficult to do so when a teacher has disruptive kids who make it difficult to teach.', "From my personal experience, i felt safe because I was focused in my studies and did not hang out with the wrong people. I'm sure people who did hang out with the wrong people were the one getting into fights, etc.", 'Extracurricular activities were available but not approachable, being that not everyone, like myself knew where to go or how to participate in them. They should be introduced in classes or announcements.', 'Overall my experience in this school was great, the connection the students had to their peers and teachers as well as after school activities and sports/clubs helped the school feel unified as one.']

column2: ['Vanguard is a very diverse and close knit school! The students in the school are always looking out for each other, and classes are always bright and full of innovation!', 'My experience was pretty good. Rounding off my 4th year at Vanguard I feel happy I applied and also that I grew from the experience as a student and person.', 'First off, Most of the kids here are disgusting with behavior most ditch and most are just rude to some people. I am the only white Latina sophomore. Overall this school gets you ready for college it teaches you a head start. Some people laugh on the person who I’m dating which should not be a concern at this state and matter and should be on your schoolwork. Colleges look at how many times you dont go to school. If you are considering this school I would recomended to look twice before you register', 'College and SAT prep could be SO much better. There are select staff members that really push college prep and only help the higher achieving students which causes an academic division. I’m almost done with high school and researching colleges/internships on my own helped me way more than any resource at Vanguard. Most Vanguard students struggle in math and there are little to no resources to help. However, there are many resources for humanities subjects. Lastly, the social aspect isn’t for everyone. Coming in freshmen year, I thought I would love a small community. Now, I hate it. The school is expanding with such little space. I feel highly  claustrophobic. It’s really up to the person. However, there are many benefits at Vanguard that do make it a good school (many extracurricular activities, close relationships with staff, power to students, students may go outside for lunch, school begins at 9 on Wednesday, etc). There’s just so much room for improvement.', 'We are a small school that is like a family. Teachers care about students and like to meet parents, you could talk to any staff members, and they will welcome you. It give you great opportunities and get you prepare of college.', 'I like the how the teachers have a great communications with the students . I like the activities we do in advisory but I do miss the trips we had to visit colleges. it only happened like once in my freshman year. also there should be more sport or clubs in the school.', "I am a teacher at the school not a student, whose going to graduate school part time. For the most part my experience has been good. The staff is friendly, the good kids are good, it has a lot of space to walk around in, and the rooms are nice. However the kids that are bad love to misbehave and it's almost impossible to settle them down and things like door stoppers or computers don't always work. For the most part, though, I have had a good experience with the school.", 'Vanguard High School is such a good school. If you are someone who is looking for a small community, this is the right school for you. Everyone knows you, from faculty to students. One thing I don’t like about Vanguard is that the course are repetitive. They barely change the course. Also, there is no representation of different culture other than Latinx and Black history. Overall, its a good school.', 'that there is a lot of diversity and you get to express yourself without being judged by peers. when I started coming to vanguard, I was a very quiet kid and there was a ymca and I started going to their programs and after that, I became more social and started to express myself as a human being. When I was an 10th grader, I started to join student government', 'Vanguard High School is an amazing community of learners and we have an excellent staff .They are committed to their students. They  are so amazing .I am so happy that I get to go to this school and to absorb all this knowledge  like a sponge.', "My experience at vanguard was good. What I like about it is that it is small so it's easy to fit in with other students from all grades. The principle William klann(Bill) is a great principle he is very nice and all the students are friendly with him. The teachers are very helpful they do everything they can to help their students succeed in a class. They have college prep classess for incoming freshmen for a semester which was really helpful for petaling for college. Overall it's a a good school.", 'Vanguard is a very community based school & it showed me what kind of school I wanted to look for when applying to colleges.', 'To really be prepared for College you must take full advantage of the programs affiliated with the school. If you trust the school to do it for you alone you may do well in the school it but you are not setting yourself for outside success.', "I feel safe at Vanguard High School. The prior high school I went to I was bullied and hated being there. I have made friends here at Vanguard and I like most of my teachers. They are very helpful. For instance, my AP Physics teacher helps me with AP Calculus exams. If it wasn't for my Physics teacher I would not be doing as well as I am. I thank him for that. Vanguard is a great school.", 'Underfunded school. Not really "diverse" if 60% of students are Latinx- theres not a lot of white, black, or asian students. O: education, cares more about teaching you how to be politically correct than teaching you geography, US history. No AP classes. Grading is too harsh with a heavy workload, little to no extra- curricular activities.', 'Vanguard is a pretty safe school with lots of diversity to offer. You will see Black, Latino, Hispanic, Muslims, Asians, and other races or backgrounds. A lot of resources in terms of extra-curricular are provided. For example, College Now at John Jay College is provided for students who get a 75 or above on their English regents. Also, SEO Scholars is provided if students want to apply. SEO is a 8 year academic program that prepares students for the Sat more thoroughly than their school would and provides college application support. However, at the same time Vanguard could improve in their academics because students are let off really easy with little homework. We need more rigorous classes that actually provide good material and has appropriate homework.', "I am really in love with my school. From the minute I walked in on orientation day, I just knew. The teachers and students are so supportive. Vanguard High School is built on respect and supporting their fellow classmates. Of course like regular high schools there are some students that don't follow through. But the staff is really strict on no bullying or fighting and will do talking or counseling if needed on both ends. Overall, it's the best school I've ever been too and I'm proud to say I go to school here.", 'My favorite program is the YMCA, they really keep you on track into college.', 'This is a diverse school that allows all students to be who they want to be.', 'Vanguard High School molded me into the person I am today. The teachers and faculty are incredible.']

column6: ['Vanguard High School aided me in smoothly transitioning from a poor, bully-filled middle school in the South Bronx, into a loving, creative, and supportive new environment. I was tormented in middle school for being "different", but because Vanguard is so welcoming and accepting to all students, I felt immediately at home since my freshman year. Now as a senior, it is awfully bittersweet to leave because whilst I\'m ready for a new adventure in life, I know I\'ll never find such a diverse, energy rich body of students ever again.', "Small school with teachers who won't say no if you ask for help. Great for cardio workouts as this school is o the 3rd and 4th floors.", 'I have an amazing school. The teachers are supportive. The principal is great. The schedule is flexible. Amazing', 'The school is a great learning place. With is being a performance based assessment school it prepares you for being a good speaker for the future.', "I've learned a lot from my teachers and have progressed as a student. However, the students coming in are just getting worse.", "They give us chances to correct our behavior but it is not to be taken advantage of and generally isn't.", 'We share all areas with the other schools so overall it is a pretty small school.', 'Our teachers are exceedingly devoted to knowledge and helping students to become more cognitive.', "We have basketball teams and volleyball teams for both genders. There's a film club and Rainbow Vibe (LGBTQ group).", 'not the worst i have ever tasted', 'the school gets really involved with team sports', 'the school takes bullying very serious', 'After graduating I felt prepared for college academically.', 'This school is unique because a lot of freedom is given and our current principle Bill is AMAZING! Bill makes Vanguard High School fun and unique.', "The only meal I eat from the cafeteria is breakfast and its not the best but it will do the job if you're hungry.", "The policies at Vanguard High School is somewhat prominent. When a policy is broken you'll most likely get a lecture from the principal and a phone call home. At Vanguard High School they want us to learn from our mistakes.", 'One thing I loved going into Vanguard High School was how diverse it was. Being a Cambodian girl and growing up in Utah for six years, I always felt different. When I went to Vanguard High School, I finally felt the same like other people. No one was giving me awkward stares while I was walking to class and it was so much easier for me to make new friends.', "Due to funding problems, Vanguard High School does not have a lot of organized clubs or  a lot of options. The clubs they do have not a lot of people participate and we don't do much because of the  lack of funding.", "As far as education and staff, Vanguard High School is a great school and it has helped me fulfill my requirements. Went it comes to the school's facility and available resources, Vanguard High School lacks cleanliness and a lot of resources such as simple things like colored paper or colored ink. The facility is shared with six different schools so it explains the dirtiness but the school can be a lot cleaner than it is.", 'teachers will do their best to help everyone pass']
column8: ['Vanguard High School aided me in smoothly transitioning from a poor, bully-filled middle school in the South Bronx, into a loving, creative, and supportive new environment. I was tormented in middle school for being "different", but because Vanguard is so welcoming and accepting to all students, I felt immediately at home since my freshman year. Now as a senior, it is awfully bittersweet to leave because whilst I\'m ready for a new adventure in life, I know I\'ll never find such a diverse, energy rich body of students ever again.', "Small school with teachers who won't say no if you ask for help. column2: ['I love my experience in world view high school so far because I have grown as a student and person throughout the years. I have established so many important and productive relationships/friendships while attending this school that I believe are important moving forward as an individual. I have learned things not only academically but also about life itself.', 'I would like to see many things change, but my main concern is bringing awareness to mental health. The overall school is not bad. The education one receives is good, however there is an incredible lack of diversity amongst the teachers.', "I've been a student there since freshman year and right now I am in high school. The teachers there are really welcoming and do help you if you reach out to them.  Also the programs they offer like college now, or student aide is also something good. I think also the fact that we start late like at 9am it gives students time to enter class and also time before class to get work done or printed. It's a small enough school that the staff and teachers will know you and recognize you and that's the best part.", 'Highschool has been great and this is my last year, i’ve been through so much trauma in highschool but i still managed to find a way to be happy and make the best out of it. The teachers have been more than supportive to me and i am forever grateful.', 'I love how the teachers support everything you do. There always making sure you’re on track for graduating.', 'The teachers care a lot about you and want to see you succeed. They work their very hardest to ensure that you are meeting the standards of school as well as the curriculum itself. They make you feel like your an environment where you will not be judged. There is at least one person you can confide in.', 'Wolrd View High School is a school in which you go to just to get your work done. This school is not a place in which you should expect top-notch classes and such; however, majority of those who have transferred out of this school has come right back realizing that World View High School is not that bad of a school after all.', 'Teachers here really do care and believe in their students and put in more effort then the city pays them for.', 'About World View high school, I like that very body is very friendly, the teachers treat students very nice, and when you need help there is always someone there for help you.', 'World View High School is a perfect match for new student to adapt for the future to enroll in a college', 'It’s a good school. The teachers are very nice and welcoming. I think you’ll have a good time here, especially since everything is so convenient.', "I like World View High School because it has many opportunities and there's always a way to improve and do better with the help of teachers. I like how this school has many resources for me as a student and the teachers make sure that you will be college ready. The only downfall to this school is that some of the teachers are very young and do not have much experience so they're not very good at teaching just yet.", 'I honestly enjoy attending World View High School because it has many opportunities. This school has many chances for where you can succeed and they set their standards high so that students want to do better and be above the norm.', 'World View Highschool has its good and bad qualities that makes you question what’s going on but if you find yourself in a predicament where this is happening, admins are willing to do anything in there power to help you out. The school environment overall allows growth in its students and I personally believe they need more recognition.', 'World View High School is all-around an average school, but great for college readiness and education.', 'In world view high school I like the environment that has been created amongst the students administration etc. However there are some things that I would like to change such as having more experienced teachers instead of new ones. It would help the students have more knowledge on what they are learning. The teacher would have experience in teaching them making the task much more easier for them. In addition the resources for the school should be better. We need textbooks because many students tend to perform better when they physically have something on paper, and not through their laptops.', 'What I like about World View is that the school is dedicated to our education and our future. We learn really well at that school and it is amazing to be in a good school like World View.', 'The staff and teachers are the best. They are very kind, and will always find a way to help you out on any questions or needs of someone. They always got time to help anyone, and encourage everyone to do their best.', "I just enrolled in World View High School last year September, which was my junior year. I fell in love with the school, the support system from all teachers are there, the great positivity is noticeable, they all care and want you to succeed. They have great academic programs that will definitely help your future, for example, Community service programs, Student Aide program which is when you get paid minimum wage to help teachers grade tests, make copies and etc. They also offer CollegeNow which is a program in where you can receive college credits while in school. World View isn't only great on academic base but also sports base, They offer boxing, swimming, softball, bowling, basketball and so much more! I'm glad to say I am a 2018 graduate from World View High School.", 'The staff member constantly beat down the students. In addition, the principal and the staff members do not listen to any of the students. The principal does not believe in any other sorts of solving problems other than suspending people. The assistant principal, Ms Flay, is constantly trying to get all the students in trouble.']
